loans.use: Increase product selection and open her own shop

loans.name: Yemen

texts.en: Yemen S. has a clothing stand in the bazaar of her hometown of Devechi, located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Yemen is married with three children and is looking for funding so that she can invest in expanding her inventory.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has requested a loan to help further expand her growing grocery business located in the Ivano-Frankovsk region of western Ukraine. Tatyana’s business consists of three market-vending kiosks at one of the produce markets in Ivano-Frankovsk and a little store she recently opened in a village called Nadvirna, just outside Ivano-Frankovsk.

Tatyana is an experienced entrepreneur, having had her own business for about 13 years. Originally, she started out by selling socks and hats that she made herself and later decided to move into grocery sales. Tatyana’s business is not only one of the primary sources of income for Tatyana and her husband and family, but it also supports her parents, who are actively involved in helping with the business. Tatyana has been a great loan client with Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to help her as she develops her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for new store.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with one daughter. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine, and provides transportation services around the territory of Ukraine. His business is the only source of income for his family. Vladimir has received and repaid all loans from "Nadiya Ukraine” without any delinquencies. He has been in this business for two years. His current daily profit is about $40. Vladimir loves being around other people. He is very balanced and determined.

Vladimir is hoping to use a loan of $500 to fix some body parts of his vehicle. He thinks it will make his car more durable and will help him handle tough competition and expand his business. Moreover, he is also hoping to develop his second business – a multi-level marketing venture. Profits generated will not only promote continued growth for Vladimir’s business but will also provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: To fix the car he uses for his transportation business.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with a teenage daughter. She and her family live in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. Yuliya sells plants and flowers in the city market. There is not much competition in this sphere of trade. 

Yuliya has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, her monthly net profit is about $400. Yuliya is very active and energetic. All of her previous loans were repaid without defaults. Her success is the direct result of thoughtful planning and structured investments. 

Yuliya is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her turnover capital so that she can buy flowers for further retail sale. She wants to purchase more flowers wholesale as she knows they bring joy to many people’s homes. She would like to see additional growth in her small venture. We believe her responsibility and managerial skills will help her use this loan wisely and repay it on time.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital.

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Mrs. Korng S. is 55 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 5 children. She sells rice and earns about $5/day in revenues. Her husband works as a construction foreman and earns $10/day.

This loan will be used to buy more rice for Mrs. Korng S.'s inventory. With the additional rice, she and her husband hope to continue supporting their five children until they can find better jobs.

loans.use: Buy more rice for her inventory

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mrs Nut R. is 63 and lives alone in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. She is a farmer and she also sells blankets. She would like to purchase additional blankets to increase the inventory and her store. She hopes this will increase sales and revenue for her business.

loans.use: To purchase blankets for her home products business

loans.name: Parwona

texts.en: Parwona lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan with her husband. She is tailor with 4 years experience. She wants to expand her business so she wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines to work faster and make a bright future for her husband and herself. She is happy about this opportunity and she would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Horng

texts.en: Mrs. Horng K. L. is 48 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their four children.  She earns a living selling vegetables, making about $6/day.  Two of her children work at a private company and help to supplement the family's income.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Horng K. L. to purchase more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mrs. Moa P. is a widow of 39 years old. She sells rice and khmer food in front of her house in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She earns 10 dollars a day. Mrs. Moa P. would like to purchase tools and equipments for her store. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She hopes to receive $1,000 in loans to help her food sales business.

loans.use: To purchase equipments and tools for her store.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Moa Phal start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Tahire

texts.en: Tahire G. has a beauty salon in the town of Devechi, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Tahire is married with one child and is looking for funding in order to invest in her business. Tahire has already successfully repaid three other loans from Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that she is a trustworthy customer.

loans.use: To invest in her beauty salon business

loans.name: Pheak

texts.en: Mrs Pheak S. is 20 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She earns her living by renting spare rooms out of her current home. In addition to earning an income of about four dollars a day, she has to take care of her mother. She would like to repair rooms and build additional ones to expand her housing business.

loans.use: To repair rooms in her house

loans.name: Agadadash

texts.en: Agadadash H. is a taxi driver in the town of Devechi which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Agadadash is married with two children and is looking for funding to invest into his business.

loans.use: To invest in his taxi business

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru:
Munavar F. sells women’s lingerie and purses. She is married and has three grown children who are off raising families of their own. Her husband is retired.

Munavar, who has a secondary-school education, has been a client of MFI MicroInvest since 2003, when her business was worth $700. After receiving a revolving loan, she expanded her product selection by selling purses as well as lingerie. This loan helped her increase the value of her business to $1,000. Munavar would like to continue this expansion with a new loan of $350, which she will use to buy new products to sell to her customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Фаёзова Мунаввар занимается продажей женскими нижними белями и женскими сумочками. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж пенсионер, дети - каждый имеет свою отдельную семью Образование среднее. С 2003 года является клиентом «Микроинвест», тогда её активы составляли 700$, она продавала женское нижнее белье. После получения неоднократного займа она расширилась и добавила в свой ассортимент женские сумочки. Сейчас её активы возросли на 1000$. В дальнейшем хочет увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: Increase selection of products available for sale

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar A. is a taxi driver in the town of Devechi, located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Ilgar is married with two children and is looking for funding so that he can invest in his taxi business.

loans.use: To invest in his taxi business

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham K. owns and operates a market in the town of Devechi, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Ilham wants to invest in his business so that he can increase the number of customers that come to his store.

loans.use: To invest in his business to increase his customer base

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam N. is 65 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and two children. She sells duck eggs in a market and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Their combined income is 12 dollars a day. Mrs. Sam N. would like to purchase additional ducks to expand her business in food production.

loans.use: To purchase ducks

loans.name: Yos

texts.en: Mrs. Yos S. is 53 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and four children. She sells vegetables and pork and earns 3 dollars a day. Her husband no longer works. She would like to expand her business by adding additional products to her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase products in order to expand her business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Yos Sep has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mr. Phun O. is a 38 year-old taxi driver in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He earns about 10 dollars a day. His wife owns a store where she sells rice and Khmer food. They also have five children.

They would like to purchase more rice and equipment for their business. In the future, they would also like to open a larger store. Inthe picture, we can see Mr. Phun O.'s wife.

loans.use: to purchase rice and equipments

loans.name: Zibar

texts.en: Zibar is a vulnerable woman from Baku, capital of Azerbaijan. She is 57, a widow , and has two children. She started her business in 1997. She buys used empty bottles and sells them as a wholesaler to small factories. But sometimes she cannot order enough bottles. This occurs in summer, when soft drinks and tonics are in great demand among the population. In 2005 Zibar applied for  and received a $500 loan from Normicro's Baku branch. Now she plans to receive a $1000 loan from the same organization. This amount is enough to buy more bottles and slightly renovate her shop.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru:
Ilhom A. is 32 years old, married and has three children. He has a college education and his profession is teaching English. Because he is a teacher, it is impossible for him to build a good future for himself and his young family on his salary alone, so he has also started a business selling men’s shoes. When their children are in school, his wife helps out in their shop.

When Ilhom and his wife started borrowing from MLF MicroInvest in 2002, the value of their assets was $450. After receiving credit and making effective use of it, the value of their assets rose to $1,700. Now Ilhom has come to us for a new loan of $900 to increase his product offerings and improve his place of business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Ашрафов Илхом – 32года. Женат, имеет 3х детей. Образование высшее, по специальности педагог английского языка. Дети учатся в школе, жена помогает мужу в его торговле. Так как одной зарплатой невозможно построить хорошее будущее, будучи педагогом, он начал заниматься реализацией мужской обуви. Когда начал кредитоваться в «Микроинвест» в 2002году, его активы составляли 450$. После получения кредита и целевого использования его активы возросли до 1700$. В дальнейшем планирует увеличить ассортимент и улучшить место своей деятельности.

loans.use: Increase product assortment and improve place of business

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar I. is 29 years old, single and has a secondary-school education. For the last 15 years, she has supported herself with the help of her mother by selling food products. Because her father is disabled, she and her mother are the family's sole means of support.

Dilbar has been receiving credit from MLF MicroInvest since 2002. Back then her business was worth only $80. After receiving credit, she increased her selection of food products and raised the net worth of her business by $1,400. She would like to continue to expand, and has come to us for a new loan of $1,150 to improve her place of business and open up a second shop in a new location.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Исоходжаева Дилбар – 29лет. Не замужем, образование среднее. Занимается реализацией продуктов питания, уже 15лет. Мать тоже торгует на базаре. Поскольку отец инвалид, она помогает своей матери в обеспечении семьи. С 2002 года она кредитуется в «Микронвест». Тогда ее активы составляли 80$. После получения кредита она расширила ассортимент и увеличила товарооборот на 1400$. В будущем планирует улучшить место деятельности и открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: Improve current business and open another location

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
Olimjon is the father of six children and lives on a collective farm in a rural community called Khonobod. Olimjon’s income from farming is not sufficient to support his large family, so he also raises cattle at home with the help of wife and children. This is not a new business for Olimjon and his wife because they have done it since the childhood.

Recently Olimjon received a loan from Microinvest to buy a young bull. Now he has asked us for a new loan of $800 to repair a shed in which he can house his cattle when winter starts, and to increase the size of his herd by buying one more young bull.

loans.use: To repair the shed in which he houses his cattle and buy one young bull.

loans.name: Maqsad

texts.en:
Maqsad is 59 years old, married and has eight children. She lives in a remote rural community while all of her sons are away earning a living in Russia.

Maqsad receives a pension but didn't want to sit at home all day, so she decided to start a business raising farm animals. She began with four rams, but thanks to a loan from Microinvest has added two little bulls to her growing herd. Now she has come to us for a new loan of $500 to repair her shed and buy one more bull. This will take her one step closer to her dream of owning a small farm where she cultivates a herd of cattle.

loans.use: To repair a shed and buy one bull

loans.name: Kenja

texts.en:
Kenja is 38, married and has four children. His main source of income is building and repairing houses, but he also runs a business raising cattle. Kenja’s wife and children help him do this, including by grazing their cattle in a nearby meadow every day.

When Kenja became a client of Microinvest he had only one cow. After receiving a loan he expanded his business and now he has more animals, including a cow and a bull. Kenja has come to us for a new loan of $500 to repair his shed before winter arrives, and to stock up on forage for his family's animals to eat in the coming months.

loans.use: To repair a shed and stock up on forage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a high-breed seeds and organic manure for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate would like to buy a high-breed dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy household items for her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Milka would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.en:
Cynthia Elizabeth E., 32, is married to Raul Osorio. They have an 8-year old daughter who is studying in third grade. Raul works in a supermarket and Cinthya started a despensa, a small convenience store, to increase family income. She sell mostly basic products such as flour, rice, eggs, and bread.

Before Cynthia had her daughter, she used to work as a sales person and as a maid. However, after the birth of her daughter, she started her despensa at her house in order to stay at home and care for her child at the same time. Together with her husband, they took their first loan with Fundación Paraguaya to buy a freezer and increase their stock of merchandise. During the past year, their business has grown and opened up many more opportunities. Cynthia and her husband are seeking a loan to reinvest in their despensa and buy more merchandise in order to offer a greater selection of products. They hope to increase their income and improve their standard of living. With their loan, they plan to purchase a variety of sugar, tomato sauce, and bread.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, tomato sauce, and bread.

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
In the past 15 years, Tarcila has become an expert on aluminum and glass products. She was born in Ayacucho, Peru, where she now owns a reputable shop in the center of town. Her clients are not only friends and neighbors, but also people who come from all over the area who have heard of her services. Most of her business comes from individuals who want custom frames for paintings and photos, often to give as gifts. She is especially busy around Christmas time. Other services incluD. replacing broken windows or cutting custom glass pieces for house doors.

Tarcila is married and has 4 children, all of whom live away from home. She runs the administrative and customer service siD. of the business, and her husband does most of the manual labor, which includes measuring, cutting, and filing glass to customer’s specific orders. He says all their work is custom maD., and sometimes requires ordering specialty glass.

Tarcila hopes to receive a loan for $700 dollars. She explains this money would be used to knock down on of the walls in the shop to expand the space and reduce clutter. She has been dreaming of this project ever since moving to the large storefront several years ago. As her clientele continues to expand, she says the space is much needed.

loans.use: Tarcila hopes to receive a loan for $700 dollars. She explains this money would be used to knock down on of the walls in the shop to expand the space and reduce clutter. She has been dreaming of this project ever since moving to the large storefront several years ago. As her clientele continues to expand, she says the space is much needed.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela’s round, smiling face is the first thing that greets customers as they walk in the door of her modest grocery store. She lives with her husband and two sons in Ayacucho, Peru. She has single-handedly managed this store for almost 3 years, with the exception of her older son who occasionally helps out after school.

Her love and pride of her family is obvious when she talks about the good grades they receive in school and how they help out around the house. The conversation is interrupted only when neighbors stop by to pick up household necessities or ask for directions. While her smooth skin and big smile exhibit youth, Graciela is clearly a reliable source for both dry goods and information. Pointing to the stack of carefully placed bricks, she talks about how she wants to add a room to her home so that her extended family has a proper place to stay when they come to visit. Graciela hopes to receive a $400 loan so that she can undertake this home-improvement project as well as purchase more products for her store.

loans.use: Pointing to the stack of carefully placed bricks, she talks about how she wants to add a room to her home so that her extended family has a proper place to stay when they come to visit. Graciela hopes to receive a $400 loan so that she can undertake this home-improvement project as well as purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. lives with her three children and their father in Ayacucho, Peru, a small town located high in the Andes Mountains. She owns a small shop on the hillside, located far from the city center. Here at a juncture in the dirt path that serves as a road, she sells soda, beer, and “abarrotes,” or dry goods. Esther has owned this store for 2 years, and it is her first business venture. Prior to operating the “tienda,” (store) she did not work and focused solely on raising her children, who now attend school. She very much likes working and supplementing her husband’s income. He is a moto-taxi driver, and Esther says that although he works hard, his income is often unpredictable.

Recently, Esther’s mother has become quite ill, and she has found it difficult to operate her normal hours. Much of her time is spent caring for her mother, who lives nearby. However, Esther is hopeful she will get better, and her shop hours will be able to return to normal. She hopes to receive $300, which she plans to use to stock her store shelves with products and also help pay for the expensive medicine prescribed to her mother.

loans.use: She hopes to receive $300, which she plans to use to stock her store shelves with products and also help pay for the expensive medicine prescribed to her mother.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana has been in the carpentry business for over 15 years, and has much to show for it. She uses the empty lot next to her house as a workshop, and recently hired 2 employees. The piles of fragrant sawdust covering the ground are indicative of the hours of hard work. Feliciana lives with her husband, who is also a carpenter, and their three children. She produces both custom orders and regularly supplies several stores with “muebles” or furniture. She does not own a storefront, but rather conducts all of her business from her home. She makes everything from rocking chairs and armoires to desks and bed frames. 

Once a week Feliciana travels an hour outside the city to buy the best quality, driest wood at the best price. She hopes to receive a loan of $500, which she would use to purchase her wood. She would also use part of the money to put toward another sanding machine, which she says is desperately needed.

loans.use: She hopes to receive a loan of $500, which she would use to purchase her wood. She would also use part of the money to put toward another sanding machine, which she says is desperately needed.

loans.name: Jorgelina

texts.en:
Jorgelina Ruiz Diaz D. Dure, 48, is married to Victor Mariano Duré. They have 10 children between 11 and 29 years of age. Her eldest son work for the press, two are studying, and one works at a hairdresser. Her husband is an employee in a factory of Coca-Cola as a truck loader. However, her husband's salary does not cover all of the family's expenses.

Jorgelina sells cosmetics so her children can continue studying. She travels to Clorinda, a city on the Argentina border, to buy her merchandise such as perfumes, creams, cosmetics to sell to stores in Villa Elisa. Jorgelina travels by foot or bus since she does not have a car or motorcycle. In order to insure she has enough income, she also sells food products such as onions, potatoes, rice, and oil that she buys from the central market to sell to other merchants. In addition, Jorgelina also sells raffle tickets and travels house to house to sell tickets.

Jorgelina took her first loan from Fundación Paraguaya few years ago to expand her business. Recently, Jorgelina had to put her work on hold for 3 months because one of her daughter spent three months in the hospital due to pregnancy complications. Fortunately, they are well now and Jorgelina wants to continue her work. She needs a loan to purchase perfumes and cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Martín

texts.en:
Miguel Angel Martínez, 41, is married to Rafaela Medina. They have a 17-year-old son who is a student. Both the parents and their son work together at the despensa (grocery sotore), which offers products such as corn, rice, cookies, sugar, yerba to prepare mate y tereré (two typical drinks of Paraguay), and also typical Paraguayan food such as empanadas and sopa paraguaya (a type of cornbread). Miguel also travels by bike to sell his food in other locations; unemployment is high in his community, and this means fewer customers for his store. In addition, he also sells lottery tickets in order to increase his income.
 
Miguel started his business 17 years ago and took his first loan from the Fundación Paraguaya in 2005 to expand his store. He also used the loan to buy new products for his store. He is now seeking a loan to  restock his store. He plans to offer a larger variety of products, because with a wider selection of products he can serve a larger population of customers, thus increasing family income. He will use the loan to buy products such as juice, bread, and pasta.

loans.use: Purchase juice, bread, and pasta for resale.

loans.name: Margrate

texts.en: Margrate  is married, mother of 3 children who are in school. She is an active member of Kandara moonlight women group. She practices farming which is the only source of income. She rears 1 dairy cow on zero grazing. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. Margrate would like to buy a high breed dairy cow. She is applying a loan to be able to buy the cow at once and repay the loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Margaret would like to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married, the mother of 5 children who are in school. She is an active member of Kandara Moonlight Women's Group. She practices farming which is her only source of income. She rears 1 dairy cow on zero grazing. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard toward its success. She practices mixed farming on her farm.

Jane would like to buy a high-breed dairy cow which will increase the rate of milk production from the one cow she already has. She is applying a loan to be able to buy the cow at once and repay the loan on monthly basis. She is very committed when it comes to repayments.

loans.use: Jane would like to buy a high-breed dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Charity would like to buy ready-made clothes and textile materials

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is married and has six children. Her husband, Rodolfo G., is 67 and retired from the company Itaipú Binacional. Two of their children live with them. The remaining four emigrated to other countries, such as Spain, Uruguay, and Chile, to seek a better standard of living and more work opportunities. They send money home to help their parents.

When her husband retired, they decided to invest their savings in a small business, and they opened a store to generate extra income. The business has been growing little by little, as has their income and their client base.

Ana says that business is good. They want to offer more products. They're asking for a loan to buy bakery products and dairy products, which are currently their best sellers.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

It's been a few years since thenLa señora Ana es casada, tiene 6 hijos, su marido se llama Rodolfo G. D. 67 años, es un empleado jubilado D. la Itaipú Binacional. Actualmente 2 D. sus hijos viven con ellos y los otros 4 trabajan emigraron a otros países como España, Uruguay y Chile en busca D. mejores condiciones D. vida y oportunidades D. trabajo; desD. el exterior ellos envían dinero a sus padres para ayudarlos. Cuando su marido se jubiló, decidieron invertir sus ahorros en una microempresa, y abrieron una despensa para generar ingresos extras a la familia. Ya son varios años que abrieron su despensa, poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio con las ganancias generadas, así como la clientela también fue incrementándose. Ana nos cuenta que el negocio marcha muy bien, y que están interesados en surtir más sus productos para la venta, para ello solicitan un crédito que lo utilizarán para la compra al por mayor D. panificados, productos lácteos y carne para surtir mejor su negocio, pues son estos los productos D. mayor venta en la actualidad.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, baked goods, and meat for resale

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 25 years old. She is married with 4 children. Loise is a member of Nalepo Redeemed Church. She is a religious person who practices good morals in the community. Loise is the secretary of Olkiret Women group. She has been campaigning for some of the negative culture; and has influenced many in her groups a community she has been involved in communal activities like building of water tanks, planting of trees and growing of family foods by advocating the importance of kitchen gardening. She has worked hard and has managed to take all her children to school, which is not normal according to their culture. As a member of Olekiret women group, she has applied for a loan of USD 300 to enable her buy 6 steers. She intends to graze the cows for 6 months and sell off triple the buying price. The profits will go to pay for her children’s school fees. She will repay all her loan after selling her cows.

loans.use: Loise would like to buy steers.

loans.name: Wanjiru

texts.en: Margrate is married, mother of 4 children who are in school. She is an active member of Kandara moonlight women group. She has a textile shop which is the only source of her income. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. She sews ladies clothes and school uniforms. Margrate would like to buy textiles items to add stock on her clothing shop. She is applying a loan to be able to buy morematerials and repay her loan on monthly basis

loans.use: Margrate would like to buy ready made clothes and textile materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in new clothing products and possibly buy a glass display case

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children. Agnes is a member of Nalepo Baptist Church. She is a staunch Christian who believes in helping others. Agnes has been a very strong treasurer of Olkiret Women group. She has been a strong advocate of the need to change some of the negative culture; and has been vocal in bringing out the plight of the women and the girl child. As a community leader in Corner Baridi area, she has led a cluster of the women groups in her village in building of water tank, planting of trees and growing of family foods by advocating the importance of kitchen gardening. Agnes is an advocate of education for the girl child. She has worked hard and has managed to take one daughter to a primary boarding school. Her wish is to have all her children educated. As a member of Olekiret women group, she has applied for a loan of USD 300 to enable her buy 6 steers. She intends to graze the cows for 8 months and sell off. The profits will go to pay for her children’s school fees. She will repay all her dues after the 8 months.

loans.use: Agnes would like to buy steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his auto-mechanic shop

loans.name: Viginia

texts.en: Virginia is married, mother of 2 children who are in school. She is an active member of Kandara moonlight women group. She practices farming which is the only source of income. She rears 2 dairy cow on zero grazing. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. She practices mixed farming on her farm. Virginia would like to buy a high breed dairy cow which will increase the rate of milk production from the one cow she already has. She is applying a loan to be able to buy the cow at once and repay the loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Virginia material would like to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is married, mother of 3 children who are in school. She is an active member of Muthiga United women group. She rears chickens which are the only source of her income. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. She rears the and sells them after 8 weeks for meat purpose. Emily would like to buy 50 chicks to boost the small stock she already have. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Emily would like to buy chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.en:
Mrs. Zulma Q. V. is 36 years old, is married with Don Gabriel Galeano, 38, and he works as a construction worker. This way, he is able to help out in the family income. They have one six year old son. The son is currently studying in the first grade of the Francisco Solano López School. They tell that with a lot of effort they are able to put their son in a good school even if it might not be the most convenient geographically.

Her business came about after her marriage, she decided to open her own convenience store. Considering the fact that the nearest store has more than 10 blocks away, she decided to open one from her residence so as to help out the neighbors and to contribute to the family income from the convenience of the house.

The required loan is for the purchase of more merchandise such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, yerba, and drinks. This way they are tried to uphold their promise of customer satisfaction by restocking their supplies and having more variety.

loans.use: To purchase of more merchandize such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, yerba, and drinks.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is married, mother of 3 children who are in school. She is an active member of Muthaiga United women group. She bakes cakes and prepares snacks for sale which are the only source of her income. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. She sells her cakes to the nearest town centre and to the locals. Judy would like to pay school fees for her child who is in high school and its difficult to raise the fees at once. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Judy would like to pay school fees for her child in high school.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 25 years old. She is married with one child. She is a member of Muthaiga United women group. Joyce joined the group so as to benefit from the women group revolving fund. She has attended the initial trainings that WEEC carries out on Group formation, group dynamics and the importance of the Savings and Credit scheme. The monthly group activities have enabled her to save USD 3 per month. She believes that her cosmetic business will benefit from the revolving fund and she will be in a position to generate more income in future. Joyce has applied for a loan of USD 150 to add to her business stock. She will make her monthly repayments at group level.

loans.use: Joyce wants to add more stock to her beauty shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 50 years old. She has 6 children. Mary’s wish is to educate all her children. She believes that education, good guidance of our children is a very importance foundation to our future generation. Mary has set a rule for all her children to take education very seriously. One of her children is studying in a local university. Mary operates a small bakery in Thika. She makes doughnuts and sells to the kiosks and retail shops in Weteithie area of Thika. Mary intends to increase her income generation by expanding of her business. Being a member of Muthaiga women group, she has trained on book keeping. This has assisted her to run her business well and to focus on its growth. Mary has applied for a loan of USD 150. She plans to buy ingredients for baking. She intends to employ one more work hand who will assist her in her business. She will repay her loan in 12 monthly instalments

loans.use: Mary would like to buy ingredients for baking

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 30 years old. She has 2 young children. Her economic activity is farming. With the revival of the Kenya Cooperative creameries, the market for the dairy products has greatly improved. The Government efforts to sell dairy products to the neighbouring countries have been very encouraging. Eunice has a plan to improve her dairy farming through the use of high quality dairy feeds and supplements. She also plans to use the Artificial Insemination for her dairy cow for better calves. Eunice has applied for a loan of USD 150 through her group. She will repay the loan instalments on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy Dairy feeds – The dairy meal and bran

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For investment in automotive accessories

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is 29 years old. She is married with 4 children. She is a member of ACK church in Gatangara. She is a member of Gatangara Pluto. Though she works hard in her farm, she believes that people have to allocate time to do God’s work. She volunteers for the church work. Her farm work involves the growing of French beans and dairy farming. She sells her dairy milk to the area residents and gets income mostly on a daily basis. This income assists her to cater for her household day to day expenses. She sells the French beans to the Frigoken co. agents. She gets her payments on a monthly basis. The money assists her to make her payments at group level. Teresa has applied for a loan of USD 150. Her plan is to carry out intensive farming of French beans. The loan will assist her to buy the beans and other farm inputs. She will repay her loan through the group’s revolving fund on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy French beans and other farm inputs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 45 years old, married with 3 grown up children. Her economic activity is farming. She grows passion fruits and french beans. She is a dedicated member of Gatangara Pluto and she has set a good example to the youthful members of the group. She would like to improve her passion fruit sales by expanding her fruit farming project. She is hoping to get a loan but more seedlings and other farm inputs. She is willing to repay her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Agnes would like to carry out intensive Passion fruit farming

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa R. owns a small business selling such goods as clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. Every week she features a new item in her store, something distinct that she knows her customers cannot find anywhere else. Elsa gains loyal customers from the nearby open-air market, festival celebrations, and street traffic. With five years of experience under her belt, Elsa has learned to run a very tight operation.

Elsa’s parents run a similar shop in Guayaquil, and they were able to provide some clothes to help her get started in her own business. Ms. R. will use her second loan to increase the volume of her sales by increasing her stock. She will buy seasonal clothes, such as sweaters and rain jackets, and if she pays in cash, she can benefit from the distributor’s discounts.

Her husband left his family seven years ago, and Ms. R. has done very well as a single mother raising three children. Life continued to throw challenges in Elsa’s way when her daughter, only 14 years old, had a baby. Rather than complain and quit, this hard-working entrepreneur pulled herself up and put extra effort into her job to raise her children and grandchild.

Elsa is 41 years of age, and although she has experienced many hardships in life, she wants people to know her for working hard and supporting her three children, all of whom attend school and enjoy good health. They live in a modest house which was passed down from Elsa’s mother, and this house is the focal point of her small business which Elsa is growing into a very profitable venture.

loans.use: To invest in new clothing stock

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice a young mother of two children. She is an active member of Gatangara Pluto women group. She is a responsible member of the group and she has benefited a lot from the group. She has a small retail shop which supports all her family basic needs although staining with small stock. She is hoping to get a loan and boost her small business and she believes one day it will be a wholesale business. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Alice would like to add more stock for her small retail shop.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor R. has 25 years of experience selling shoes and clothes. He started working in the biggest market in Ecuador named Bahia. His boss at a previous business sent him to rural towns to sell his products. When Victor and his wife decided they would go into business together, they based their business model on Victor’s previous job. They had success early on because they knew exactly which towns were the most lucrative markets, and they offered promotions to the best buyers, whom they knew personally.

Each day they work from 5am until 10pm. They have recently been so focused on sales that they have not had the time to replenish their inventory with new stock, so they sell goods in the morning and then use the proceeds from those sales to buy just enough shoes to still sell in the afternoon. Victor’s wife is a great salesperson, and she typically sells in the small towns and at the local festivals which occur fairly often.

They have two grown children who help sell their goods, and the family unit has maintained a strong foundation over the years. Their house is their greatest collateral. Victor will used his second loan to continue to increase the volume of shoes and clothing in stock to sell when the Riveras go to market. He is a 48 year-old with four children, who also contribute to the family business. His wife is his right hand, and he could not do anything without her. She is responsible for the finances, taking care of the house, and looking after the children.

Many years ago they lived in Victor’s mother-in-law’s home, but they saved enough money to move out on their own. Their new home was made of cane and they slept on the floor. Now, after working hard, they enjoy a house that is made of concrete, and each child has a room of his own. The Riveras are proud to have gotten out of their previous situation, which was dire poverty. Although they are still poor, they enjoy an average standard of living for the people in their sector. Their wish is to continue growing the business and open a store located next to their house.

loans.use: To invest in clothing stock

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Although Ramon is 69 years old, he must continue working in order to cover his living expenses. He owns a soda and juice stand that he runs with the help of his wife. Ramon was a construction worker and handy man most of his life, but because of his old age he cannot no longer find work in these fields. So he set up a snack and beverage stand in his home because he lives near soccer field and basketball courts. Thirsty players are great customers. He will use his second loan to buy more snack food and other basic foods to sell at his stand. His first loan was a success because it enabled him to break into selling these complimentary goods.

Ramon has 3 children who are grown and on their own. Twenty years ago, his wife and his children’s mother passed away. Ramon is remarried (his wife is in the picture) and his the income from his business supplies food and housing for this couple.

loans.use: To invest in snack inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new freezer for her business

loans.name: Zulma

texts.en:
Mrs. Zulma C. C. is 37 and lives with Mr. Celso Lopez.  They have 3 sons, 14, 12, and 4.  The first two are in the 9th and 7th grade, respectively, at the Escuela Niños Trabajadores in Caaguazú.

Mrs. Zulam works as a street vendor in Caaguazú.  She started off with very little – a mere $40 – and currently works with a capital of $400, which shows her dedication and determination to move up.  She wakes up every morning at around 5:00 to stock her merchandise. She sells her wares until 8.30 in the evening, at which time she comes back home to take care of her children.
Her husband, Celso, works in a bakery and contributes to the family's income.  It is his dream to open his own bakery some day and manage it as he sees it fit.  It is worth noting that he has been in this business since he was a boy of 12.  

Zulma is requesting the current loan to buy more goods to sell. She intends to buy undergarments and sewing notions to increase her sales.  Her loyal clientele is requesting more variety, and she is determined to meet the demand.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as undergarments, sewing thread, needles, towels, shorts, and cups.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes works selling motorbike parts. She plans on buying more parts. She has been working in this job for over fifteen years.  She's are married woman with five children.  Her husband works on a truck picking up garbage.  She buys parts from a warehouse and has an establishment.  She sells tires, tubes , oil , gas.  She is in a small community called Los Casabes.

loans.use: To buy motorbike parts for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca sells breakfast to people in her neighborhood. She shares the establishment with someone else who serves at night.  She plans on using this loan to buy a freezer and more foodstuffs.  She has been working in this business for over one year.  She is married with 4 male children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver in the city of Santo Domingo. In her menu she serves spaghetti, bananas and eggs, among other things.  She buys the foodstuffs in the local market .

loans.use: To buy a freezer and more foodstuff

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in new foods to prepare

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Florencia has dedicated herself to the sale of home products such as: pans, sheets, clothing, etc. She also sells candy to public buses' passengers. She began to work because the number members in her family grew and her husband's income alone was not enough to support them. With a small amount of cash given by her husband she started to buy and sell candies. She, then, invested the profit in the purchase of clothing and other goods and, after that, slowly her business started to grow. She works from Mondays through Saturdays, from 7:30am to 6:00pm.

Loan Investment

Mrs. Florencia wishes to receive this credit because she does not have enough money to purchase merchandise. She had a friend that would lend her money at a very high interest rate. Now, she wants to receive this credit so that she can move forward and satisfy her customer's demands, and, more importantly, be able to sell her products at a lower price so she can attract more customers.

Personal Information

Mrs. Florencia is 43 years old. She is married and has 5 young children. Her husband works with construction and uses his income to cover the family's expenses. Their home is made of brick and straw, the floor is made out of dirt. She wishes to expand her business with the credit and, with the profit, slowly build a well-constructed house. Above all, she would be able to provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La señora Florencia se dedica hace 3 años a la venta de artículos para el hogar, como ollas, sábanas, reposteros, ropa etc. También ella vende caramelos en los buses. Ella empezó a trabajar por que el número de su familia creció y no era suficiente el dinero que ganaba su esposo. Así que con un dinerito que le dio el esposo ella empezó a comprar caramelos y venderlos y con la utilidad que le generaba compró ropa y otros artículos y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:30 a 18:00.

Uso del Préstamo

Doña Florencia desea su crédito por que no tiene capital suficiente para comprar mas mercadería, ya que tenía un amigo que le prestaba el dinero pero a un interés muy alto. Por lo cual su capital disminuyo. Ahora desea tener este crédito para crecer y satisfacer la demanda que tiene de sus clientes y sobre todo vender su mercadería a un mejor precio y de esta forma captar más clientes.

Información Personal

La señora Florencia tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos menores de edad. Su esposo es albañil y con lo que gana le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su casa es mitad de cemento y mitad de caña, muy sencilla, el piso es de tierra. Ella desea hacer que su negocio crezca con los créditos y tener mayor utilidad que le permita poco a poco ir construyendo su casa. Además que poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: Necesita dinero para comprar mercaderia

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

For the last 5 years, Jose has engaged himself to selling plastic houseware goods such as: garbage bins, containers, bowls, etc. One year ago he also started selling disinfectants and bleach. He started out his own business because, since he was a teenager, he helped his father at work and he grew fond of it. Shortly after, he began to build his own clientele. His father pitched in the initial capital he needed to go on his own. His business has been growing gradually ever since. He works everyday from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm. He delivers his merchandise to a well-populated area in Guayaquil, known as Guasmo, where he is well known by his customers. He has his sister's assistance to run his business.

Loan Investment

Jose wishes to obtain the credit so that he can increase his buying budget. The demand for disinfectants has grown and he needs to stock up enough merchandise to better serve his customers.

Personal Information

Jose is 25 years old, single and he lives with his parents. He also helps support his family by helping with the expenses. His sister helps him run the business. He wishes to use this credit to expand his venture and to become a solid source of support for his family, particularly his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

José lleva 5 años dedicado a la venta de artículos plásticos para el hogar como, cestos para basura, legumbreras, ollas, etc. Además que hace 1 año empezó a vender desinfectantes y cloro. El inicio su negocio porque desde adolescente le ayudaba a su papa a trabajar y le gusto el negocio. Luego el empezó por su cuenta a captar sus propios clientes. Su papa le ayudo con el capital para que el se independice. Su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco. El trabaja todos los días de 8:00am hasta 16:00pm. El entrega su mercadería en un populoso sector de Guayaquil que es el Guasmo, donde es conocido por sus clientes. Cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana en este negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

José desea el crédito para incrementar su capital ya que la línea de venta de desinfectantes esta teniendo bastante demanda por lo que desea abastecerse de productos que le permitan darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

José tiene 25 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. El también es un soporte para su familia ya que ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana quien también le ayuda con el negocio. El aspira con este crédito ir superándose y de esta manera poder ser un soporte firme en su familia y en especial con sus padres.

loans.use: Incrementar su linea de desinfectantes

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Gutierrez and her husband own and run a hardware store and a bazaar that have been open for business for four years. Lately, both businesses have seen a rise in sales due to the construction of residencies around the sector where they are located.

Loan Investment

She wishes to expand her businesses and purchase additional merchandise to cover the many orders her customers have placed. Her goal has always been to take good care of her customers so that they will keep coming back and help her grow financially.

Personal Information

She is 24 years old and her family is united and stable. Her goal is to improve and expand her businesses locations

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora tiene una ferretería y bazar que empezó hace cuatro años , en el negocio le ayuda su esposo y últimamente su negocio esta creciendo ya que en el sector donde esta ubicada se esta realizando el plan de construcción de viviendas.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella quiere ampliar su local y comprar mas mercadería ya que sus clientes han realizado varios pedidos, siempre su meta es brindar una buena atención para de esta manera crecer junto con ellos.

Información Personal

Tiene 24 años y dos hijos su vivienda es mixta y su estabilidad familiar es buena, su meta es tener su local amplio y crecido.

loans.use: Ampliar su local y compar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Necesita comprar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new glass display cabinets

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Business Description

Don Adolfo sells fruits on a traveling cart. His wife helps with the business by selling fruit and healing herbs as well. They started this project when they emigrated from their city two years ago. They currently sell fruits and herbs.

Loan Use

He needs this credit in order to purchase tricycles so that they can more easily get to the zone where their clients are. They've also thought about selling other products that were requested by their clients, such as legumes and vegetables.

Personal Information

Don Adolfo is 30 years old and has three children, two of whom are studying. His wife is very hardworking and his main goal is to build a house, since he has already purchased a good piece of land where he is thinking about building it.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Adolfo se dedica a la venta de frutas de forma ambulante, en este negocio le ayuda su esposa que tambien vende frutas y ademas yerbas curativas. Empezaron con este proyecto cuando emigraron de su ciudad hace dos años. Actualmente continuan vendiendo sus frutas y yerbas.

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el credito para comprarse dos triciclos y asi poder trasladarse de mejor manera y llegar a la zona donde estan sus clientes. Ademas han pensado en vender otros productos que han sido solicitados por sus clientes como por ejemplo legumbres y hortalizas.

Información Personal

Don Adolfo tiene 30 años y tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian su esposa es muy trabajadora y su principal meta es de poder contruir su casa pues ya han comprado un terreno donde la piensan contruir.

loans.use: Purchase traveling tricycles

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Business Description

Don Manuel sells confectionery and candy in a traveling cart. His wife helps him sell his products too. They started this business when he was laid off. They are currently working outside a school where the authorities have allowed them to sell their product to students.

Loan Use

He needs this credit in order to purchase more merchandise since he has recently built a shop at home and he is now also selling products from his house.

Personal Information

Don Manuel is 52 years old and he has five children, two of whom are studying. His main goal is to have a stable business so that his wife doesn't have to go out to work somewhere else.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Manuel se dedica a la venta de confiteria y dulces en general de forma ambulante, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio pues tambien vende los productos. Comenzaron el negocio cuando el que desempleado. Actualmente se han radicado en las afueras de un colegio donde las autoridades les permiten que expendan sus productos a los estudiantes.

Uso del Préstamo

El necestia el credito para comprar mas merderia pues ahora ha contruido un local para en su propia casa y ya ha comenzado a vender en su domicilio sus productos.

Información Personal

el tiene 52 años y cinco hijos de los cuales dos estudian. Su principal meta es de tener un negocio estable para que asi esposa no tenga que salir a vender en otro sitio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Business Description

Sandra has been in the commerce business for six years. Her husband helped her with the initiative of putting up a shop. She used a capital of $50 to purchase merchandise such as school supplies. She conditioned part of her home to start a shop. Now she also sells toys, imitation jewelry, gifts and cosmetics. She works every day of the week from 7 a.m to 8 p.m.

Loan Use

She will invest the credit into purchasing merchandise to supply her shop. Se is also thinking about buying a display case in order to help her exhibit her products.

Personal Information

Sandra is married. She is 34 years old and has three children, all of whom are studying. Her husband is a gas fitter. Her house is made out of cane and she hopes to be able to repair it with the investment. Her wish is to have a bigger shop in order to better serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Sandra tiene una experiencia de 6 años en la actividad del comercio. Su esposo le ayudo en la iniciativa de poner un local. Con un capital de $ 50 compro mercadería como lo son: útiles escolares. Acondiciono parte de su domicilio para el local. Ahora también vende artículos como: juguetes, regalos, bisutería, cosméticos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Además piensa comprarse una vitrina donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos.

Información Personal

Sandra es casada. Tiene 34 años y tres hijos. Los que estudian Su esposo se dedica a la profesión de gasfitero. Su casita es de caña y espera con la inversión poder adecuarla. Su deseo es tener un local más grande y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es:
Business Description

Glenda has had five years of experience in the commerce business. She used to live in a different province and her sister had the initiative to start selling cosmetics. Her husband helped her with the capital. She moved to Guayaquil and set up a cosmetics and imitation jewelry shop. She's been doing really well with her business. She works every day of the week from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. She has two people that help her with sales. She works and lives in the same place, which she is currently renting.

Loan Use

She would invest the credit on purchasing more cosmetics, imitation jewelry, jewelry and gifts. Demand for her product has augmented due to the quality of her services.

Personal Information

Glenda is married. She is 30 years old and has three children. Her children are currently living with Glenda's mother in a different province. She travels every 15 days to visit them and give them what they need. Her husband is a wood salesman. He travels often to deliver the material. Glenda's wish is to be able to save in order to purchase a terrain where she can build her own house and have hew own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Glenda tiene una experiencia de 5 años en la actividad del comercio. Ella vivía en otra provincia y una hermana incentivo a vender cosméticos. Su esposo le ayudo con el capital. Vino a vivir acá donde puso un local de venta de cosméticos, bisutería. L e ha ido muy bien con su negocio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Tiene dos personas que le ayudan con las ventas de sus productos. Actualmente ella vive alquilando. Donde también tiene su local.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos, bisutería, joyas y regalos. Gracias al servicio que ella les ofrece su demanda ha aumentado.

Información Personal

Glenda es casada. Tiene 30 años y 3 hijos. Sus hijos están viviendo con su mama en otra provincia. Ella viaja cada 15 días a visitarlos y darles los que ellos necesitan. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera. Pasa viajando entregando el material. Su deseo es poder ir ahorrando. A futuro comprar un terreno donde edificar su casita y tener su propio local.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, jewelry, imitation jewelry and gifts

loans.name: Mariangela

texts.en:
Mariangela A., 33, is married to Eugenio Rojas Colman. They have two children, a 5-year-old who is in preschool and an 8-year-old who is in 3rd grade. Her husband is a car painter. Mariangela has a despensa, a small grocery store that sells a variety of products, including kitchenware, cosmetics, and toys. Her best sellers are basic products such as a bread, milk, eggs, and oil.

The store used to belong to her mother, but as her mother started to retire 15 years ago little by little, Mariangela began to take responsibility for the business. She used her first loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy a pick-up truck to transport merchandise more economically instead of traveling by taxi. Since then, the store has grown a lot. For example, today they offer a variety of products that they were not able to offer before they received their loan. Now, her store is self-sustaining. She is asking for a loan in order to buy a used car that her husband can remodel and fix up for resale. They hope this side business will increase their family income in the future.

loans.use: Purchase used car to fix and resell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 34 year old, single mother living and working in Juliaca. She has been working on her own for eight years. When she first started off, she would travel to Tacna every month to purchase clothes and bring them back to Juliaca to sell. After some time selling clothing, she decided to sell sodas and snacks on the weekends in Puerto Maldonado. Magdalena would leave on Thursday and arrive in Puerto Maldonado on Saturday, leaving her just enough time to sell at the ferias, weekly markets, on Sunday. The hectic traveling proved to be too demanding, especially with a new born.

Magdalena now has a bookstand by the Colegio Cesar Vallejo at which she works at from 6:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. during the week. On weekends and during holidays she sells pasamanerias, which are braids, ribbon, hair ties, and other goods for festivals. Magdalena is always traveling and working with her two-year-old daughter. She hopes that with a $1,200 loan she will be able to purchase a Remalladora, which she would use to produce large quantities of clothing. She hopes to be able to design, produce, and sell her own clothing in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine to produce larger quantities of clothing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, mother of two, has lived and worked in Juliaca her entire life, where she has a clothing stand in the local market, Tupac Amaru. She has operated at the same stand for twenty years now. She travels every three months to Lima to purchase clothing for her stand. When she first started her clothing business she exclusively sold clothing for adults but has recently moved into undergarments. She primarily sells underwear, socks, swimsuits, towels, and other light garments.

According to Victoria, there is less competition and a larger profit margin in undergarments. She currently uses her loans for purchasing the products she needs for her stand. With a $500 loan, she would be able to continue to expand the variety and quality of the clothing she sells.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for undergarment stand.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Twenty-five year old Raquel has run an artisan business for the past six years. Her business has been growing steadily since she first started weaving chompas (sweaters), chalecos (vests), and chullos (hats). She has moved on to placing orders and purchasing from other women in Juliaca.

Raquel travels every weekend to the border town of Desaguadero where she sells her goods to Bolivians, tourists, and wholesalers. She has recently opened an email account, which allows her customers to contact her and let them order in a simpler manner. The main problem she is facing at the moment is that her clientele is growing at a much faster rate than her capital. She is asking for a $325 loan to increase the amount of merchandise she has as well as the amount of orders she can fill.

loans.use: Increase capital to augment stock of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolasa Giménez D. P. is 39. She is married and has 2 sons, 16 and 17. Her husband, Antonio Pintos, runs a convenience store from their home. He was forced to retire early because of a heart and lung condition he developed on the job at a Yerba Mate company (Indega). Seven years ago, he decided to use his retirement money to open a convenience store in his home. Their two sons, who are currently studying at a school nearby, come home in the afternoons and help out at the store.

Nicolasa works outsiD. the house in a busy section of the city. She sells lottery tickets, quiniela tickets (a very popular game of luck in Paraguay), bingo tickets, and so on. Her stand is in a key location next to 2 clinics, next to the city’s main park, and near the city’s municipal center.

Both the convenience store and her lottery stand have a loyal clientele, so business is good. The convenience store is the only one in the neighborhood and one of the biggest in the city.

They would use the loan to restock their store. Also, they would use part of money to build a new wall around their residence for increased security.

loans.use: To restock and build a wall in their residential convenience store

loans.name: Nimia

texts.en:
Mrs. Nimia F. D. P. is 58 years old. She is married and has three grown sons, who work in diverse jobs. One is a graphic designer, another is a truck driver, and the third is a public servant. She is married to Vicente P., recently retired from his job in the customs office. Curently, her husband helps run the business from their residence. Mrs. Nimia F. sells goods from home, including clothing, ice cream, and even pizza at night. Her sons help with household expenses. Her daughter-in-law is currently in Spain working, and Mrs. Nivia's granddaughters are staying with her while her daughter-in-law is away.

She travels every couple of months to Argentina and Brazil to buy merchandise to sell from her store. She offers a large selection of undergarments and clothing that is in demand among her neighbors. Most of her clients are people from the neighborhood, but she also draws clients from around the city.

She says that the benefit of running a business from the comfort of your home is that you can have it open day and night. Her customers know that she is always a phone call away or a knock on the door away, even if they want a quick ice cream after midnight. She started this business by bringing in goods from a neighboring Argentinean city, and she has been building it up for 20 years.

She would use the loan to buy more merchandise. She will be going to Argentina soon and wants to replenish her stock of undergarments of a respected Argentinean brand.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, including underwear from Argentina.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra F. A. is 22 and married in civil law. She recently became independent from her mother and went to live with her husband. Though very young, she runs a convenience store that attracts many customers.

She sells all types of products, including drinks, meats, breads, and fruits. She also sells household goods, stationery items, and some clothing. She started her business 5 years ago with her husband. Her husband helps in the store and also sells vegetables to many other convenience stores. He uses his vehicle to deliver vegetables and to run general errands for the convenience store.

The vegetable business is going well. Her husband now delivers vegetables not only in the city but also to surrounding areas. Even though the convenience store does not yet have an established clientele, it is the biggest one in the area and attracts many customers.

She would use the loan to restock the store with beverages, including wine and beer, which are best sellers. She needs to restock because she closes the store late and has many evening customers.

loans.use: To restock the store with beverages

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeu N. is 57 years old and is a vendor selling porridge and dessert in a busy market, where she usually makes on average about $5 each day. She is a mother of 5 children, two of whom work for a local private company and the rest are students. 
Currently, one of her children would like to conduct a motor-taxi, which would enable him to make additional profits for his family. Yet recently, he has faced a financial constraint. Therefore, Mrs. Oeu N. is humbly requesting for a loan to assist him.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle to operate a business as a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun S. Thea is 26 years old. She and her husband own a small shop where they wash and clean motorcycles in their community, where they typically make about $5 each day.
This couple has one child, but he is too young to attend school. Currently Oeun S. Thea and her husband are requesting a loan to purchase an electric generator to facilitate their business. She and her family are grateful and appreciative your trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase an electric generator to help in her businees.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy P. is a 38-year-old mother of 4 children and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells ducks and chicken eggs on a roadside of her community, where she can moderately make about $5 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, is self- employed as a motor-taxi driver, whose income is a potential help for his household.

Mrs Suy P. is currently requesting for a loan to repair her house, which normally leaks during a rainy season. In the future, she would like to open a shop selling rice, food and some snacks to the people in her community.

loans.use: To repair house which normally leaks during a rainy season.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Suy Phov start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mr. Um B. is a widower and a father of 4 school-aged children. He is 42 years old and lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To support his entire family, Mr. B. works as a landlord, building different rooms and renting them to the people in his community, where he can typically earn up to $10 each day. His expenditures are mostly  for his children’s school fee and health care. Eventually, B. hopes a loan will help him to build more  rooms to meet his clients' needs as well as maximizing his family’s savings.

loans.use: To build more different rooms to meet his clients' need.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru:
У Дилрабо высшее образование и по образованию она педагог. Закончив университет она начала работать в школе простым педагогом. Постепенно она росла по карьерной лестнице и сейчас она работает директором школы. Ее школа находится в маленьком городке Шураб. Дилрабо любит свою работу и ходит на нее с радостью. Заработка преподавателя не хватает на жизнь и поэтому приходится дополнительно заниматься выращиванием домашнего скота. Этим занимается вся семья Дилрабо. Узнав про Микроинвест она пришла на консультацию. Условия предоставления займов понравились ей и она решила получить займ. На полученную сумму она прикупила несколько баранов. По ее словам это принесло дополнительную прибыль в семейный бюджет. Сейчас она собирается расшириться и получив новый займ купить еще больше баранов.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Dilrabo has a college degree in education. After graduation, she began to work as a school teacher. Gradually, Dilrabo climbed the career ladder and now she works as the school’s principle. The school is located in a small village of Shurab. Dilrabo loves her work and enjoys teaching. However, a schoolteacher’s pay is not enough to sustain oneself, and Dilrabo must do something in addition to her work in school. To earn extra income, Dilrabo and her entire family breed cattle. When Dilrabo learned of MicroInvest, she came for an appointment and liked the loan conditions. Dilrabo took a loan and bought several rams. According to Dilrabo, the purchase brought additional income into her family’s budget. Now, she asks for a new loan to purchase more rams.

loans.use: To expand the number of cattle

loans.name: Muhtassar

texts.ru:
Вот уже несколько лет Мухтассар выходит торговать на базар. Ей 41 год, она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж очень старый (ему 85 лет) и не имеет возможности работать. Мухтассар вышла замуж за него когда ей было 27 лет. С тех пор вся тяжесть семейных расходов лежит на ее плечах. Найти постоянную работу с приличным заработком в регионе невозможно и пришлось выходить на базар. Ассортимент ее товаров составляют носки, платки и другие мелкие вещи. Спрос на ее товар высокий и много постоянных клиентов. В начале ее бизнес был очень маленьким и помещался на маленьком прилавке. Постепенно бизнес расширялся и сейчас товара у Мухтассар значительно больше. Мухтассар открыла вторую торговую точку, где торгует ее старшая дочь. С Микроинвест она сотрудничает уже 1,5 года. Полученные займы внесли свой вклад в расширение бизнеса Мухтассар. Сейчас она планирует закупить летний ассортимент, для чего хочет получить новый займ.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

For a few years now, Muhtassar T. sells on a market. She is 41, married, and has 3 children. Her husband is very old (he is 85) and unable to work. Muhtassar married him, when she was 27. Since then, all the weight of providing for the family fell on her shoulders. In her region, it is impossible to find a stable job with a decent income, so Muhtassar’s only solution was to sell on a market. The assortment of her goods consists of socks, scarves, and other small items. There is a high demand for Muhtassar’s goods and she has earned many permanent customers. In the beginning, her entire business could fit on a small counter. Gradually, the volume grew, and now Muhtassar sells significantly more goods. Eventually, Muhtassar was able to open another retail spot, which is now run by her oldest daughter. Muhtassar has been a client of MicroInvest for 1.5 years. The loans that she received helped Muhtassar to grow her business. Now she asks for a loan to buy a collection of summer items.

loans.use: To purchase summer seasonal items

loans.name: Minneh

texts.en: M. is married, mother of four children who are in school. She is an active member of Rurii Mwimuto women group. She practices farming which is the only source of income. She rears 2 dairy cows on zero grazing. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. M. would like to buy a high breed dairy cow. She is applying a loan to be able to buy the cow at once and repay the loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Minneh would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is single, mother of two children whom one is in school and the other one is about to join college. She is an active member of Mother Joy women group. She has a grocery business which is the only source of income. She also practices small scale farming but for home use. She normally buys vegetables and cereals from the village and sells them to the upmarket. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. Elizabeth would like to buy varieties of cereals for her grocery due to high demand from her customers. She is applying a loan to be able to buy them at once then she will be repaying her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Sarah would like to buy cereals for her grocery shop

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married, mother of three children who are in school. She is an active member of Rurii Mwimuto women group. She has a salon business which is the only source of income and she is able to educate her children through the income she generates. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. Elizabeth would like to buy varieties of hair chemicals and makeup materials for her salon. She is applying a loan to be able to buy them at once then she will be repaying her loan on monthly basis

loans.use: Gladys would like to buy beauty and hair products for her salon

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married, mother of two children who are in school. She is an active member of Rurii Mwimuto women group. She has a salon business which is the only source of income. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. Elizabeth would like to buy varieties of hair chemicals and makeup materials for her salon. She is applying a loan to be able to buy them at once then she will be repaying her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy chemicals for her salon business

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn S. R. is 34 years old and a mother of 5 children. She operates a grocery store and earns around $2.5/day in revenue. Her husband is motor-taxi driver and makes around $2.5 each day.

Mrs. Morn S. R. is requesting a loan amount of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a motor-taxi like her husband does. The loan will enable her and her family to have another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a business.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan's family has some land to raise rice on which is enough for the family 's food. The father works as day laborer while the mother sells bread at home and raises pigs. They also take care of the grandmother (72 years old). Their 3 children are students who work as day laborers in their summer vacation to earn their school fees. The average income for the family is $15 per month per person.

Lan wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her capital for her micro-businesses. She will pay the loan back over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: increase available capital for her micro-businesses

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan's husband is a” honda driver” and she sells many kinds of cake, carrying her products on foot or using a bicycle. Their three children are in school (7th, 6th, and 3rd class); their oldest boy (13 years old) suffers from asthma. The family owe $312.50 to a bank on a loan they took out to buy the father’s motorbike. Their average income is $10 per month per person.

Thuan wants to borrow $ 50 to increase the capital available for her micro-business. She will repay it over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: increase available capital for her cake sales

loans.name: Xinh

texts.en:
