Xinh and her husband are separated. She brings her three children to her own mother’s house to be cared for while she sells fruit and soft drinks. Xinh's children are in school ( 8th, 6th, and 4th class). Her oldest daughter suffers from epilepsy. Their average income per person per month is $ 11.

Xinh wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her available capital for her micro-business. She plans to pay it back over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: expand her micro-business

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc's family has 6 members. Her husband works as day laborer and has kidney problems. Truc sells fish at a small market. They also grow green dragon plants (to produce fruit) and corn, but their profit is low because they lack sufficient water. The two younger children are in school (5th, 4th class) and the other two have stopped going to school so that they can help their parents earn a living. The average income for the family is $14 per month per person.

Truc wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her available capital for her micro-business. She plans to repay the loan over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: increase available capital for her fish-selling micro-business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum L. is 44 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Her husband is an intermediary. He buys motorcycles and resells them near an open-air market where he usually makes up to $10 each day. Mrs. Chum L. stays at home and has to take care of her eight children.

Her husband would like to increase his inventory by adding more motorcycles, but she faces financial constrains. As a result, this couple is now requesting a loan to help the growth of their business.

loans.use: Needs to increase inventory of motorcycles

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung's husband has weak kidneys; he works as a farmer, growing rice for his family’s food. Dung sells sweet soup at a small market. They raise 2 small cows to be able to save a little to continue their children's schooling. Two of their children are students in Ho Chi Minh City; they also do odd jobs to pay their expenses. Their other child has cerebral palsy. The family's average income is $10 per month per person.

Dung wants to borrow $ 75 so that they can raise more pigs. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 9 months.

loans.use: raising pigs

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung and her husband have always been good farmers: he grows rice and green dragon plants (to produce fruit) and raises pigs. Unfortunately, they were hit by insect problems and a flu epidemic. Now they have little capital, and their 3 children who are students must find extra work to pay their school fees. The oldest son stays home to help his parents earn a living. They also just heard that their 2nd daughter was in a traffic accident and they had to hurry to Ho Chi Minh City. The family's average income is $10 per month per person.

Dung wants to borrow $ 75 to raise pigs. She plans to repay it over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien's family has 4 members; the two children are still very young (4 & 2 years old). One of them suffers from malnutrition. Lien's husband works as a fisherman, and she sells fish. Their average income is $12 per month per person. Last year their house was destroyed by Typhoon Durian. Vietnam Plus and local authorities helped them to rebuild it.

Now Lien wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her available capital for her fish-selling business. She plans to repay it over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: capital for her fish-selling micro-business

loans.name: Hojaoy

texts.ru:
Абдуллоева Хочиой -38 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж в России на заработки, дети учатся в школе. Она домохозяйка. Вот уже 15 лет занимается откормом крупнорогатого скота у себя дома. Клиентом «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, тогда она откармливала только пару телят. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода, так как все заботы о семье лежат на ее плечах. Благодаря поддержке «Микроинвест», она увеличила количество скота, купила дойную корову и запасла корм на несколько месяцев вперед. В будущем планирует увеличить количество крупнорогатого скота и расширить место для присмотра своих скотов.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Hojaoy A., 38 is married and has 3 children. Her husband went to Russia to seek employment there. Her kids are in school. In addition to taking care of the household, for the last 15 years, Hojaoy A. has been breeding cattle. In 2005, she became a client of MicroInvest. Then, her livestock consisted only of a pair of calves. The cattle farm is the main source of income for Hojaoy A.’s family. With help from MicroInvest, Hojaoy A. increased the size of her livestock, purchased a milk cow, and bought a few months-worth of cattle food. With this loan, she plans to increase her livestock and expand the size of her cattle farm.

loans.use: To increase total number of livestock

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy's family has 3 members who live in the same house with her husband's sister. Her husband grows rice and green dragon plants (for fruit) but he gets low income from his farming venture because of insects.

Quy sells vegetables at a small market. They also raise 30 ducks. Their son (7 years old) attends 2nd grade at school. Their average income is $ 15 per month per person.

Quy wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her business capital. She plans to repay it over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: increase her available capital for her vegetable stand

loans.name: Sandra Cidalia

texts.pt:
Single mother of 2 children, Sandra started with FDM in 2006 with a loan of 3000 meticais, which she used to purchase beauty products for her salon. She has been able to progress, and with an additional loan of 10,000 meticais, she will be able to invest in a new business, for food and basic goods.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Mae solteria de 2 filhos, entrou para o FDM em 2006 com um emprestimo de 3.000 meticais que usou para a compra de produtos de beleza para o seu salao, ela tem estado a progredir e com os 10.000mt que tomou a 10/07/07 investiu em um novo negocio, produtos alimentares de primeira necessidade.

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods to start a new business

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy and his wife sell fish and work as day laborers to support their family. Their 3 younger children are in school. Two older children stay home to help their parents. They tend 200 green dragon plants (for fruit). Their average income is $12 per month per person. They want to borrow $50 to increase the available capital for their fish-selling micro-business. They plan to pay it back over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: increase available capital for fish selling

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es:
Business Description

Mercy has been selling lunches for one and a half years. She sells around 30 lunches a day and works from 7am – 2pm every day. She started her business because her Mother had taught her to work from an early age and this is how she learnt, and she therefore decided to start this business. Her diner is in her house.

Loan Use

Mercy wants a loan to buy a semi-industrial cooker as she does not have one and her current one does not meet her needs as there is more and more demand for her food. She also wishes to buy more tables and chairs.

Personal Information

Mercy is 25 years old, is single and lives with her Mother and sister. They have a single floor house which is made of cement and is not yet finished. Mercy and her sister make these lunches and they both help their Mom to cover the household costs. She is a very hard-working woman and she makes an effort to help her family move forward. She also wishes to, bit by bit, improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Mercy se dedica hace 1 1/2 años a la venta de almuerzos. Ella vende 30 almuerzos en el día y trabaja todos los días desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 14:00pm. Ella inicio su negocio porque su mama le ha enseñado a trabajar desde muy Pequeña y así ella fue aprendiendo y decidió empezar con el negocio. Su comedor esta ubicado en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

Mercy desea el crédito para comprar una cocina semindustrial, ya que no cuenta con una y cada vez la demanda de sus clientes es mas alta y la cocina que tiene no le permite satisfacer esta demanda. Además que desea comprar mas sillas y mesas

Información Personal

Mercy tiene 25 años de edad es soltera, vive con su mama y su hermana. La casa es de cemento de 1 piso y aun esta en construcción, ella trabaja junto a su hermana con los almuerzos y juntas sirven de soporte para su mama y ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia. Y también desea poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda.

loans.use: To buy a semi-industrial cooker/Comprar una cocina semi industrial

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
Business Description

Hernán has been selling fried onions, rice with fried fish and chicken for 10 years. He started this business with his own money and he works at it with his wife. They work from 6am – 11am. Their business is located in the centre of the city. After selling food, Hernán makes deliveries in a small car in order to earn more money.

Loan Use

Hernán needs a loan in order to buy new kitchen utensils such as plates, saucepans, spoons etc. He needs these as the utensils he has at present are now too old to use. He would like to provide a better service for his clients.

Personal Information

Hernán is 31 years old and is married to Mariana. They have children all under the age of 18, two of which are in high school and two of which are in elementary school. His 2 eldest children help a lot in the preparation of the foods. They have their own house which is made of cement but is not yet finished. They offer each other mutual support in order to keep going and therefore have a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Don Hernán lleva 10 años dedicado a esta actividad, el vende encebollado, guatita, arroz con pescado frito y seco de pollo. El inicio su negocio con capital propio. Su negocio lo atiende junto con su esposa, ellos trabajan desde las 6:00am hasta las 11:00am. El negocio esta ubicado en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad. Además don Hernán después que termina de vender su comida, en la tarde sale hacer fletes en un carrito que tiene para des esta manera generar mas ingresos para su familia.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Hernán desea el crédito para comprar nuevos utensilios de cocina, como platos, ollas, cucharones etc. Esto se debe porque los que tiene ya paso su tiempo de vida útil. Y así desea darles un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Don Hernán tiene 31 años de edad, es casado con la sra. Mariana. Tiene 4 hijos todos menores de edad, dos estudian en colegio y 2 en escuela. Sus 2 hijos mayores le ayudan en muchas ocasiones en a preparación de la comida. La vivienda en la que viven es propia, de un piso de cemento pero aun esta en construcción. Ellos se apoyan mutuamente para seguir adelante y de esta manera tener un mejor estilo de vida.

loans.use: To buy utensils, plates and other products for his diner/Comprar utensilos, platos y otros productos para su comedor

loans.name: Sonnia

texts.es:
Business description

Sonnia has been buying and selling gas cylinders for 6 months. She does this from her Mother’s house as she helps her attend to her clients. She started this business because there is no one selling gas where she lives. She had saved up some money by working part time in a warehouse, and this is how she bought the gas cylinders. She works form 7am – 8pm every day.

Loan Use

Sonnia would like a loan in order to buy more gas cylinders as her business is located near a market and she does not have enough to satisfy her clients’ needs.

Personal Information

Sonnia is 20 years old and she lives with her parents. Apart from her business, she also works in a warehouse selling electro-domestic goods, which allows her to contribute to the household costs. She hopes that with the credit that she can invest in her business so that she can generate more profit to support her parents more. She also wishes to improve their home which is not yet finished and is made of cement and wood. This is how she would like a better future for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Sonnia lleva 6 meses dedicada a la compra y venta de cilindros de gas, ella tiene el negocio en casa de su mamá quien le ayuda con la atención de sus clientes. Ella empezó este negocio porque en el sector donde ella vive no hay personas que vendan gas. Ella había ahorrado dinero porque trabaja medio tiempo en un almacén y con parte del sueldo empezó a comprar los cilindros de gas. Su negocio se atiende desde las 7:00am hasta las 8:00pm todos los días.

Uso del Préstamo

Sonnia desea el crédito para comprar más cilindros de gas ya que su negocio esta ubicado cerca de un mercado y los cilindros que tiene no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Información Personal

Sonnia tiene 20 años de edad, ella vive en casa de sus padres. Ademas del negocio, ella trabaja en un almacén de electrodomésticos, lo que le permite ayudar en los gastos de su hogar. Ella aspira con el crédito invertir en el negocio de tal forma que le genere mayor utilidad que le permita ser un buen soporte para sus padres. Además que ella desea ir mejorando su vivienda ya que esta en construcción mixta de cemento y madera. Para de esta manera tener un mejor futuro tanto ella como su familia.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders/Comprar cilindors de gas

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Бободжонова Мавлуда- 56 лет .Замужем , имеет пятерых детей и несколько внуков. Образование средне- специальное. После работы в свободное время уделяет большое внимание откорму крупнорогатого скота и свиньям ,поскольку эта деятельность является основным источником дохода семьи. И конечно же надо иметь ввиду большую поддержку мужа в этом деле. Будучи став клиентом “Микроинвест” она начала кредитоваться с 150 $. Тогда она брала займ только для покупки корма,так как в хлеву у нее откармливались пару свиней и одна корова .После системачиеского кредитования и ответственностью перед программой “Микроинвест” у нее наработался навык в сфере животноводства и конечно же увеличилось поголовье скота. В будущем планирует расширить хозяйство.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Mavluda B., 56 is married, has 5 children and several grandchildren. She has an equivalent of associate degree education. After work, she dedicates her free time to caring for her livestock—the main source of her family's income. Mavluda B.’s husband helps her run the farm. Mavluda B. began her relationship with MicroInvest with a $150 loan to purchase food for a pair of pigs and a cow. Since then, Mavluda B. earned reputation of a responsible MicroInvest client and borrower. She gained expertise in caring for livestock and was able to increase the number of animals in her farm. Mavluda B. plans to use this loan to continue expansion of her business.

loans.use: To increase total number of livestock

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Business Description

Pablo has been making and selling food for 30 years. He has a basic food store where he sells rice, oil, beans, sugar etc. He started this business when his wife died. He had his own money and decided to invest it in a business. It is open from 6.30am – 10 pm Monday – Sunday. Weekends he also sells ceviches ad encebollados from 6am – 11am.

Loan Use

Pablo would like a loan to buy more supplies such as rice, oil, sweets, diapers etc. These products are in demand in his area and he does not have enough to meet his clients’ needs.

Personal Information

Pablo is 59 years old and has been a widower for 3 years. When his wife died he was left in charge of the house. He currently lives with his 2 eldest daughters and he helps out with his grandchildren when he can. He has his own house which has 2 floors and is made of cement, although it is not yet finished. His daughters help him out with his business, especially by selling encebollado which is what they did before his wife died. They are very hard-working people despite difficulties which have meant they have had to fight to continue on together.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Don Pablo tiene 30 años de experiencia en el comercio y venta de comida. El tiene una tienda de víveres de primera necesidad, vende arroz, aceite, fréjoles, azúcar etc. El inicio el negocio de la tienda a raíz que su esposa falleció. El tenía su propio capital y decidió invertir en la tienda. Su negocio lo atiende de lunes a domingo de 6:30am hasta las 10:00pm. Además los sábados y domingos vende encebollados y ceviches, desde las 6:00am hasta las 11:00am.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Pablo desea el crédito para abastecer más su tienda de productos como arroz, aceites, confiterías, pañales, etc. Estos productos tiene bastante demanda en el sector y el no tiene para satisfacer la demanda que se le ha presentado de sus clientes.

Información Personal

Don Pablo tiene 59 años de edad, el es viudo hace 3 años. Cuando murió su esposa quedo a cargo de su casa. El vive actualmente con sus 2 hijas mayores de edad. Pero él ayuda a sus nietos en lo que el puede. La vivienda en que vive es propia, de 2 pisos de cemento y aun esta en construcción. Sus hijas lo ayudan también en el negocio de la tienda y especialmente en la venta de encebollado ya que esta actividad la tenía anteriormente su esposa y él decidió continuar con el negocio. Ellos son personas muy trabajadoras que a pesar de las situaciones presentadas luchan por salir adelante todos juntos.

loans.use: To stock his store with more products/Abastecer su tienda con mercaderia

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Mrs. Seang S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by purchasing custard-apples from a nearby plantation and reselling them to the people in their community. With this business venture, this couple can make on average about $8/day in revenue.

Currently, Mrs. Seang S. has requested a loan to purchase more custard-apples to meet her clients’ needs. She is confident to make a lot of money for the next two years.

loans.use: To purchase more custard-apples for her inventory.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Seang Savorn has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan into another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Business Description

Maria sells household objects such as presents, work books, glue, combs etc. She also sells water in cups, gallons and bottles. She has been working independently from her home for 6 years. She works every day from 7am – 8pm and thanks to the effort of her wonderful children they have kept the business afloat, selling household objects and water.

Loan Use

Maria World like a loan to buy more articles to sell in her bazaar and therefore to make more money and so that her clients will be happy with the range of products she offers. The number of clients that she has has increased so much so that she needs to increase her number of products to keep up, and this is a result of hard work each day.

Personal Information

Maria is 37 years old and she lives with her 4 children who help her with house work and her business. Their house is made of cement and is very solid. Thanks to Maria’s efforts 3 of her 4 children are studying and, despite the fact that her husband does not live with them, Maria has brought her family forward. Maria’s dream is to have a large business which will be a source of employment to people who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Maria se dedica a la venta de bisuterías como: Regalos, cuadernos, gomas, prestobarbas, etc…. Además a la venta de agua, en presentaciones de pomas, galones y botellas. Teniendo como experiencia 6 anos, trabajando independientemente en su local ubicada en su domicilio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza junto con sus bellos hijos a llegado a mantener el negocio a flote, tanto en el bazar como en la venta de agua.

Uso del Préstamo

Maria solicita el préstamo para la compra de más artículos de bazar y así tener más surtido el negocio, de tal modo que la clientela se sienta a gusto con la variedad de productos que Maria les demuestra y ofrece. Por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener y aumentar, Maria necesita incrementar su bazar de tal manera que esta obligada a cumplir con sus necesidades, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Maria tiene 37 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a sus 4 hijos, quien les ayuda con las labores del hogar y negocio, por lo cual tienen su casa de estructura de cemento, muy aseada. Gracias al esfuerzo que Maria realiza a llegado inclusive a mantener 3 de sus 4 hijos estudiando, a pesar de que esposo no vive con ella, Maria a llevado su familia a delante. Los sueños de Maria es llegar hacer una gran empresaria y generar mas fuentes de trabajo a la gente necesita del sector.

loans.use: To be able to buy more merchandise for her bazaar/Poder comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Business Description

Gloria has had her business for 10 years. She started with her own money 5 years ago, and her husband helps her to invest in cosmetics. She has also been able to sell clothes. She works weekdays 8am – 5pm.

Loan Use

She will use the loan to buy cosmetics in bulk as she receives a good discount. She is also thinking about buying clothes that her clients have asked for.

Personal Information

Gloria is 37 years old and is married with 3 children, all of whom study. Her husband is a driver for a delivery company. They have their house on credit and she would like to finish building it so that her family can live in a better environment.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Gloria tiene una experiencia de 10 años con su negocio. Se inicio con capital propio hace 5. Su esposo le ayudo con dinero para la inversión de cosméticos. Además pudo incluir venta de ropa por los pedidos que tenia. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos al por mayor. Con lo que obtendrá mayor descuento. Y también piensa invertir en ropa ya que tiene pedidos de clientes.

Información Personal

Gloria es casada. Tiene 37 años y 3 hijos. Los que estudian. Su esposo trabaja de chofer en una compañía que transporta valores. Ella con créditos que ha podido obtener esta adecuando su casita. Dándole un mejor ambiente a su familia. Su deseo es poder terminar de construirla.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk/Comprar cosmeticos al por mayor

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Business Description

Víctor started his business 3 years ago, and he sells basic foods such as vegetables, fruit and sweets. He works every day from 6am – 10pm.

Loan Use

Víctor needs a loan to invest in new and existing products. In this way he will be able to offer more variety to his clients, expand his business and offer jobs to his children.

Personal Information

Víctor is 39 years old and has 4 children, 3 of which are studying. His wife works in the business. Victor started with a few savings which he obtained working in fields. For his business he needs a rented store. His house is near his business and is made of a mixture of materials. He hopes to improve and grow along with his business so that he can give a better education to his children and show them that the best gift is education and work.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Víctor inicio su negocio hace 3 años. Los productos que vende son: Víveres de primera necesidad, legumbres, Frutas, confitería. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am-a -10pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Víctor necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de más víveres y nuevos productos. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes. Aprovechando la oportunidad de expandir su negocio y ofrecer empleo a sus hijos.

Información Personal

Víctor tiene 39años. Tiene 4 hijos 3 que están estudiando. Su esposa trabaja en el negocio. Víctor inicio con un poco de capital que logro obtener en base a los pequeños ahorros fruto del trabajo en el campo. Para su negocio ocupa un local rentado. Su casa queda cerca de su negocio es de de construcción mixta. Aspira mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y demostradles que la mejor herencia es la educación y el trabajo.

loans.use: To buy new and existing products/Comprar mas viveres y nuevos productos

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly's parents-in-law are very old (77&78 years old); their son and Ly are farmers who grow green dragon plants (for fruit) and vegetables. Their average income is $11 per month per person. Ly wants to borrow $ 75 to raise rabbits so as to get more income from their farming venture. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: raising rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her bakery/redientes para su elaboracion de panaderia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to stock up her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy's family has 5 members; her husband grows green dragon plants (for fruit) while she sells fruits at a small market. They borrowed $312.50 from a bank to buy 2 cows. Their children are in school (4th, 5th, &7th classes). Their average income is $ 12.50 per month per person. They want to borrow $ 75 to increase Thuy's capital so as to get more income from the fruit stand to be able to continue their children’s schooling. They plan to pay back the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: increase available capital for Thuy's fruit stand

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

Señora Carmen has a candy store which she opened 8 years ago with some money that she made by selling fruit around the neighborhoods in the city. Her oldest daughter helps her around the store. She also sells candy products outside various schools in the area. Lately, her business has been growing.

Loan Use

She would like to purchase more merchandise and make some improvements to her store since she wants to make sure her clients, who are mainly children, feel welcomed.

Personal Information

She is 40 years old and she has 2 children. She lives comfortably in a house made out of reed. She would like to one day expand her clientele so that she can increase her sales and improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Carmen tiene una confitería que empezó hace 8 años con un capital producto de la venta de frutas que recorría por varios sectores de la ciudad, en el negocio le ayuda su hija mayor, ella también vende estos productos en diferentes planteles educativos del sector, pues últimamente su negocio esta creciendo.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere comprar mas mercadería y realizar cierta adecuación en su local ya que quiere brindar una comodidad a sus clientes que en su mayoría son niños del sector.

Información Personal

Tiene 40 años y dos hijos su estabilidad familiar es considerable su vivienda es de caña y siempre quiere tener mas clientes para de esta manera poder mejor su situación económica.

loans.use: To make improvements & to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic cooking ingredients

loans.name: Loi

texts.en:
Loi and her husband are separated. She sells fruit at a small market to support her family. She borrowed $375 from a bank for the poor to build her house. Her two children are in school. Their average income is $ 12.50 per person per month.

Now Loi wants to borrow $ 75 to increase her available capital to get more income from her fruit stand so that she can encourage her children’s schooling. She plans to pay back this loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: expand her fruit stand

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung's two grandchildren have lived with her since their father died and their mother got married again. They are in school. Dung sells groceries at her home. Their average income is $10 per month per person.

Dung wants to borrow $ 75 to increase her available capital for her little grocery store so as to get more income to support her grandchildren. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: expand her micro-business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Business Description

Señora Nancy started her business about 3 years ago with some money that her husband received selling ice-cream throughout the city. She has a mini-mart where she sells basic food supplies. Her husband helps her to run the business which is notably growing.

Loan Use

She would like to purchase more merchandise to stock up her store because she wants to make sure her clients are satisfied since her store is one of the 3 best stores in town.

Personal Information

She is 33 years old and she has 4 children. Three of the children are in school. She lives in a house made out of reed. Her goal is to keep her business growing so that she and her family can move ahead!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Nancy empezó su negocio hace tres años con un capital que lo obtuvo de su esposo gracias a la venta de helados en varios lugares del sector , ella tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad , en el negocio le ayuda su esposo y es notable su crecimiento.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella quiere comprar mercadería para surtir su tienda y tener a sus clientes satisfechos ya que es una de las tres mejores tiendas del sector.

Información Personal

Tiene 33 años y cuatro hijos de los cuales tres estudian, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es crecer en su negocio y de esta manera poder sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en: Tâm lives in the same house with her 6 children(12-34 years old) and a nephew (7 years old). They care for 500 green dragon plants (grown for their fruit) and she also works as a tailor. Their average income is $12 per month per person. The two younger children are in school; one of them got a Vietnam Plus scholarship last year. Tâm wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their green dragon plants. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: growing green dragon (fruit) plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and perfumes

loans.name: Narciza

texts.es:
Ms Narciza has a business selling ice cream and cooked viscera. She has had this business for ten years, and it has grown noticeably. She started with little capital, and today she has three employees who help her with the distribution of ice cream. Her husband and son also help her.

She hopes to purchase two tricycles for the distribution of ice cream, especially since her customers continue to grow and she is the only provider in the area.

She is 32 years old with 2 children. Her goal is to grow her business and have her own place from which to sell her ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Narciza tiene un negocio de venta de Vísceras cocidas también vende helados, en este negocio tiene diez años, ella empezó con un capital pequeño hoy tiene tres empleados que le ayudan con la distribución de los helados también le ayuda su esposo y su hijo, es notable su crecimiento.

Quiere comprar dos triciclos para la distribución de los helados , ya que sus clientes crecen y en el sector solo ellos son los proveedores.

Tiene 32 años y 2 hijos su vivienda es de caña y su meta es crecer y tener su propio local de distribución de helados.

loans.use: To purchase two carts/tricycles for greater sales

loans.name: Nhiem

texts.en:
Nhiem's family has 7 members; she and her husband grow rice and cassava and work as day laborers. Their land is far from their house so they bought a motorbike for transportation. They borrowed $ 321.50 from a bank for the poor for their farm. The children are all in school, except the youngest child who is 2 years old. One of their children (Anh) got a Viet Nam Plus scholarship last year. Their average income is $ 12 per month per person.

Nhiem wants to borrow $75 to invest in their cassava plants. She intends to pay back the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: planting cassava

loans.name: Vui

texts.en: Vui's family has 3 members. The parents are very old (73 & 72 years old). Their daughter, Vui,  is 34 and works as a day laborer. They have a debt of $250 with a bank for the poor for their cow. Their average income is $10 per month per person. Vui wants to borrow $ 75 to sell green dragon fruit to get more income to support her family. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: selling green dragon fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise at discount prices

loans.name: Nghan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghan C. is 46 years old and a mother of 3 children. She owns a small booth in front of a factory selling some grocery products and typically earns around $4 each day. Her husband (pictured here) is a motor-taxi driver, whose income is a potential benefit for his household. Moreover, two of her children work as a motor-taxi drivers like their father, but the rest of them are enrolled school.

Mrs. Nghan C. is humbly requesting a loan amount of $300 to purchase more grocery products to fulfill her clients’ demands.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her inventory.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Nghan Chantha for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang's son, 18 years old, works as a day laborer to take care of his mother who is 64. They borrowed $250 from a bank for the poor to buy a cow. Their average income is $16 per month per person. Sang wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their livestock. Sang plans to repay the loan over the space of  5 months.

loans.use: expand their livestock

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao's family has four members. The two children are in school and their parents work as day laborers. Their average income is $11 per month per person. Now Dao wants to borrow $ 75 to raise pigs. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: raising pigs

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Thang's family has 5 members; the parents and the oldest son work as day laborers.The two younger children are in school.
They also raise chickens financed by a loan of $321.50 from a bank for the poor.  Their average income is $11 per month per person. Thang wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their poultry. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: expand their poultry micro-business

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 51 and works as a day laborer. She also raises chickens and she borrowed $312.50 to grow 200 green dragon plants (for fruit). Phuong's children are in school. One is a student in higher education and other is in the 6th class. Their average income is $12 per month per person.

Phuong wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in her poultry micro-business so that she can get more income from it to pay for her children's schooling. She plans to repay the loan over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: raising chickens

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en:
Nhi and her husband do many different jobs to support their family such as day laborer, growing green dragon plants, and raising goats. Their 3 children are in school. They borrowed $250 from a bank for the poor to raise goats. Their average income is $10 per month per person.

Now Nhi wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their livestock micro-business. She plans to repay the loan over the period of 5 months.

loans.use: raising goats

loans.name: Romao Anibal

texts.pt:
A reformed official, Romao asked for an initial loan of approx. 225 dollars in 2007 for the construction of an aviary. He is married with 5 children, and he is starting a poultry business with his wife. The loan of 375 dollars is to purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medicine.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Funcionario reformado, tomou o 1. emprestimo em 2007 para construcao de um aviario no valor de 6.000mts , e casado com 5 filhos e esta a iniciar o negocio de frangos para a sua esposa, que depois se tornara nossa cliente. Tomou dia 17/07/07, 10.000mts para a compra de pintos, racao e medicamentos.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medicine

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en: Mr. Rafig is an IDP from the occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993 and started his private business in the same year. He is 28 and married. There is a great demand in the animal breeding business. That's why he applied for the loan of $450 from Normicro Baku branch. Using this loan, he plans to buy another cow to raise.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Joao Francisco

texts.pt:
Joao is married with 5 children. He joined FDM in 2006, and with his initial loan of approx. 225 dollars, he purchased chicken coops for the production of eggs. With preceding loans, he built one more coop for the raising of hens and started the construction of his home in the city of Maputo. He asks for a loan of 800 dollars to purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medicine for his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Casado, com 5 filhos, entrou para o programa em 2006, com um emprestimo de 6.000mts, comprou poedeiras para producao de ovos, com os emprestimos seguintes contruiu mais um pavilhao para a criacao de frangos e iniciou a construcao de uma residencia na cidade de Maputo. No dia 10/08/07 pretende tomar um emprestimo de 20.000mts, para compra de pintos, racao e medicamentos para o seu negocio.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and medicine for his poultry business

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en: Mr. Ilkin is an IDP from the occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is 27 and single. Ilkin started his own business in 2006. He received two loans (in 2006-$300, in 2007 - $600) from Normicro Baku branch and used these loans to open a shop and purchase merchandise.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Anabela

texts.pt:
Anabela is married with 3 children. She joined FDM in November of 2006. With an initial loan of approx. 400 dollars, she purchased products for her grocery store. Her business grew, and she started helping her husband purchasing agricultural supplies and practicing horticulture. She asks for a three-month loan of 1,175 dollars to invest in groceries, increasing her stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada, mae de 3 filhos, entrou para o programa em Novembro de 2006, com um emprestimo de 10.000mts, para a compra de produtos para a mercearia, foi desenvolvendo e comecou a ajudar o seu marido na compra de insumos para agricultura,produzindo horticolas. pretende tomar a 06/08/07, 30.000mts, num prazo de 3 meses, para investir na mercearia, aumentando o seu stock.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Lidia Da Graca

texts.pt:
Lidia is single, and she joined FDM in the early part of 2007. With her first loan of approx. 200 dollars, she expanded her salon and purchased products. She asks for a second loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products and jewels.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Solteira, entrou para o programa no inicio de 2007, com o primeiro emprestimo de 5.000, ampliou o salao e comprou produtos, recebeu o 2. emprestimo a 10/07/07, que investiu na compra de produtos de beleza e joias.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and jewels for sale in salon

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Mr. Vusal is an IDP from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993 and started his private business the same year. He is 28 and single. He had a very low income before and decided to apply for a $550 loan from Normicro Baku branch to solve his problems.  With his next loan he plans to buy a modern electronic scale for his shop.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Valina Joao

texts.pt:
Valina is married with 3 children. Her husband started a business, and they invested their initial loan of approx. 250 dollars. Her husband found work elsewhere, and she continues with the business. She became a member of FDM, and she asks for a loan of 575 dollars to invest in her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Vive maritalmente, tem 3 filhos, o marido e que comecou o negocio e tomou o primeiro emprestimo de 6.000mts, que os ajudou a investir no negocio, ele arranjou emprego fora e ela continua com o negocio tendo passado a ser cliente do FDM, tomou no dia 10/07/07, um emprestimo de 15.000mts que investiu no negocio, no futuro deseja ampliar a sua casa.

loans.use: To purchase product

loans.name: Clara Salvador

texts.pt:
Clara is married with 2 children. She joined FDM in October of 2006. With an initial loan of approx. 125 dollars, her business grew, and with the profits, she is purchasing conventional material for the construction of a house. She now asks for a loan of 575 dollars to invest in the purchase of clothing.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Vive maritalmente, tem 2 filhos, entrou para o FDM em Outubro de 2006, com um emprestimo de 3.000mts, o seu negocio foi desenvolvendo e com os lucros esta a comprar material convencional para a construcao de uma casa. Tomou um emprestimo de 15.000mts, em 10/07/07.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothing

loans.name: Sandra

texts.pt:
Sandra is married with 2 children, one being her own. Her initial loan of approx. 225 dollars to purchase vegetables in bulk allowed her business to grow. She now employs 4 people. To further grow her business, she is asking for a loan of 450 dollars to purchase used clothing for sale. In the future, she looks forward to expanding her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada com 2 filhos, seu 1. emprestimo foi de 6.000mts, para compra de vegetais a grosso, o negocio esta a crescer, ja tem 4 empregados,para ampliar o seu negocio tomou 12.000mts, a 12/07/07, para compra de roupa usada para revenda. No futuro pensa ampliar a sua casa.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing

loans.name: Gultekin

texts.en: Ms. Gultekin is an IDP from the occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is 38 and single. She started her private business in 2005. To increase her selling, she needed to be funded. The only source of credit at that time in the location she worked was Normicro LLC. In 2006, she applied for a $300 loan and after repaying it she applied for a second loan of $600 in 2007. Now she plans to get a third loan of $700 to buy a new cash register.

loans.use: Buy a new cash register

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.en:
Mr. Fidencio N. is 43 years old and has three kids aged 10, 6, and 5. He lives with Teresa Gimenez who is a housewife and also helps out Mr. N. every now and then at the job. Mr. N. works as a charcoal salesman and has been at it for over 4 years now. He works from his residence and employs three workers who are not family members to help him carry out his chores.

He works as a middleman, buying “carbon” (a kind of charcoal, frequently used as cooking fuel because it is cheaper than natural gas) and then selling it to various outposts in the country. He delivers to most convenience stores and is in high demand this season because of the unprecedented cold that swept the country.

He limits his sales to nearby areas since he currently doesn’t have the assistance of a vehicle due to monetary restraints. However, he delivers all his goods in a small cart fit to transport such merchandise. He wakes up every morning at 6 to sort out his merchandise and doesn’t stop working until 6 in the evening. Even with such a strenuous schedule, he sometimes finds himself working overtime to make sure not to lose customers in this very competitive business.

He started off with very little, as little as 500 kg of charcoal, and now handles over 15,000 kgs of charcoal monthly. He is a natural-born merchant and lived in Argentina for 7 years before where he sold clothing items. He has worked his way up and his place boasts a huge potential to be exploited. He requires this loan to be able to purchase more charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Mr. Pedro C. is 74 years old, is married and has 3 children, all grown. The oldest works at Camping 44, a weapons retailer store. The other two work together selling pharmaceuticals. His wife, Leónida Rosa, works with him and they both are in the trade of “carbon” (a kind of charcoal, frequently used as cooking fuel because it is cheaper than natural gas). They employ one other person in their work place as well as have one of their nieces helps them out too.

Mr. C. has been in the trade for almost 29 years now. They both work from their residence and, as a matter of fact, they built their residence with their job in mind. That is, their yard is built in such a way to make the work easier and to accommodate the tools necessary for his job.

They started off with very little, with 500 kg of charcoal, and they grew to such a point that now they are handling over 6000 kg of charcoal weekly. They have a regular set of customers who come to their workplace to pick up the charcoal. They deliver as well with the help of a vehicle which they were able to purchase with help of previous loans. They are the ones who supply charcoal to most convenience stores in the city.

They require the loan to restock themselves with more charcoal because they were confronting difficulties lately due to the fact that there was a charcoal shortage. Charcoal is really sought good during winter, the current season, because of its use as a fuel for fire as well as for cooking. Due to the lack of charcoal during this season, they were forced to reduce their price to be more appealing to the customers and to be able to fight off the competition.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Mr. Silvestres C. C. is 38 years old, lives with his common-law spouse, and has one son aged 4. His spouse sells fish just like him. He makes a living out of the trade of fish, both buying and selling it as a walking salesman. He works from the banks of the River Paraguay where he lives and has his own canoe to facilitate the fishing.

He’s been working on this job for over 15 years now and humbly states that he started with very little since financing entities would not finance him since he had no commercial references. He thus started building his own net and getting fish out of the River to make a capital out of it.

Before that, he used to work on a ship and he learned the trade from this job as he watched fishermen. He now proudly says that he has a fixed clientele (as opposed to his rustic beginning) thanks to the help given to him by the Fundación Paraguaya who decided to finance him.

That way, he started growing and he now boasts a varied clientele which includes people from outside the city.

loans.use: To buy fish  like “surubí” and “dorado”.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en: Priscillah is 27 years old. She is married with 4 children. Priscillah is a member of Anglican Church. She is a strong religious person who believes in helping others. Priscillah is the assistant secretary of Olkiret Women group.  She has attended adult learning at least she has education basics.She has been participating in community work such as building of water tank, planting of trees and growing of family foods by advocating the importance of kitchen gardening. As a member of Olekiret women group, she has applied for a loan of USD 750 to enable her buy 6 steers. She intends to graze the cows for 8 months and sell them after rearing them for eight months. The proceeds will go to pay the entire loan and pay her children’s school fees. She will repay all her loan after selling her cows  in a period of 8 monthsat lumpsum.

loans.use: Priscillah would like to buy Steers

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is 35 years old. She is married and has 9 children. Nena’s children are in primary school.  Nena is a member of Olkiret women group. She has been involved in all the group’s communal projects such as building water tanks for water harvesting, planting trees. Nena’s economic activity is beadworks and rearing of steers. Nena sells her beadworks to the visitors who visit the country club. The profit she gets from her work enables her to pay her loans. Nena’s group has come up with a plan of buying steers for sale. Since Nena’s family has enough grazing land, she has applied for a loan of USD 750. She will buy 6 steers. She will sell the steers after 8 months. Nena will pay her loan in lump sum after the 8th month.

loans.use: Nena would like to buy steers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 60 years old. She has 8 children. 4 of her children are in secondary school while 1 is studying in a local University. Esther is the oldest member of Olkiret women group and has been a good advisor of the young mothers. Esther encourages the young women to work hard. She advocates for group discipline and sets a good example by keeping to the group rules. She too is involved with the communal projects of tree planting and water harvesting. Esther’s group has come up with a plan of buying steers for sale. This is what Esther had to say…” It’s a good thing that the group has assessed the members needs. Since we have enough grazing land, the steers will not go hungry. After selling off the steers, my profit will assist my family with the education fees.” Esther has applied for USD 750 to purchase 6 steers. The repayment will be made in lump sum after 8 months.

loans.use: Esther intends to buy steers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 59 years old. She is married and has 5 children. 2 of her children are in secondary school. Elizabeth is the assistant treasurer in Olokiret women group. Being an older member she has been a good example to the young mothers. Elizabeth greatly appreciates the work that has been accomplished through the women groups. This is what she says….” Before we started the group work, we never undertook projects like tree planting. Visitors from different organizations and agencies have come to our groups. We have been trained on numerous issues and the most striking has been environmental degradation. We now take tree planting as a very serious thing. I have my own trees and I am proud to be one of the people who are working towards improving the environment. Elizabeth has applied for a loan of USD 750 to buy 6 steers. This has been approved by her group. She too will rear the steers for 8 months and will repay the lump sum loan amount after selling of her steers. She will use her profits to pay school fees and apart of it will be used to buy tree seedlings for planting.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy Steers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 65 years old. She is a widow. She has 6 children. 3 of her children are still in school. Grace joined Olokiret women group after the group chairlady explained to her of the need of the women joining hands so as to solve some of the community problems. Like her colleagues, Grace has planted trees and is happy to be a member of Olokiret women group. Grace has this to say of the group…” before this groups came up, one could keep her problems to herself. Now we work together and we are able to come up with solutions to some of the problems.” When the group decided to buy steers for grazing, Grace was very happy. She says this..” I have only 2 steers. If I can get some more, I would be very happy. I will look forward to a better future after a few months.” Grace has applied for USD 750. This will go to buy 6 steers. She will graze them for 8 months after which she will sell and pay the loan in lump sum. The profits will be used to buy steers. She plans to increase the herd she grazes per period.

loans.use: Grace intends to buy Steers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 60 years old. She is married and has 8 children. 3 of her children are in secondary school. Susan loves making ornaments. She has visited many towns to sell her beadworks. Susan laments the poor prices offered by the middlemen for her ornaments. She believes that when the women are able to sell their beadworks direct to the users, they will have a big breakthrough. Though Susan never went to school, she is very enlightened and is able to study the market trends. She was instrumental in having the group members buy the steers and building the stock. Asked why it was so important for her and her group members to start this project, Susan had this to say…” The Government has revived the KENYA Meat Commission. This is not far from us. We need to take advantage of this market. Since we have enough grazing land, and the weather has been good, its important for us to do the much we can.” Susan has applied for a loan of USD 750. She too will repay the loan in lump sum after the 8 months grazing period.

loans.use: Susan would like to buy 6 Steers

loans.name: Bella Luz

texts.es:
Bella Luz is 44 years old. She is originally from Oaxaca, and now she lives in in a place called Montemorelos, Nuevo León. She moved there in search of better opportunities for her family. She is married and she has three children. The desire to progress and to give her children a good education motivated her to start her own business five years ago selling quesadillas. This is a popular product in Southern Mexico, and she has found much acceptance among her clientele. With the help of her husband and her children, she has made this business grow very quickly.

At the moment, Bella is requesting a loan for $925, which she will use to remodel her location, which is made of wood with a sheet metal roof. The structure needs to be improved and painted. In this way, Bella hopes to continue growing and to offer better service to her customers. Be an important part of the development of this business by deciding to support Bella. Thank you very much.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Bella Luz tiene 44 años de edad, es originaria de Oaxaca y vive en la localidad de Montemorelos, Nuevo León, se mudó buscando mejores oportunidades para su familia, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, el deseo de progresar y darle una buena educación a sus hijos la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio hace cinco años vendiendo quesadillas, este es un producto muy consumido en el sur del México y ha tenido mucha aceptación entre sus clientes, con la ayuda de su esposo y de sus hijos ha hecho crecer su negocio muy rápido.

En estos momentos Bella está solicitando un crédito de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local, que está construido de madera y con techo de lámina y necesita mejorar la estructura y pintar, con esto Bella espera continuar creciendo y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a Bella, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Anibal Amilkar

texts.es:
In a place called San Juanito, Chihuahua, lives Anibal. He is married and has two little daughters, one two years old and the youngest just seven months. After the death of his father, Anibal took charge of his business, where he sold grilled chicken. Little by little the demand for his products has grown. He remodeled his location and increased the variety of foods he offers to his customers. Thanks to this good service, he and his wife have succeeded in making their business grow.

Now, in order to meet the demand, he has help from five employees, and he wants to continue growing, which is why he is requesting a loan for $925, which will be used for the purchase of ingredients. With these he hopes to increase his production. He promises to repay this amount in 6 months. Play an important part in the successful development of this business. Anibal and his family thank you very much for the support you offer.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

En la localidad de San Juanito, en Chihuahua vive Anibal, es casado y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, una de 2 años y la menor sólo de 7 meses de edad. Al morir su padre, Anibal se hizo cargo de su negocio en el que vendía pollo asado, poco a poco se fue aumentando la demanda por sus productos, acondicionó mejor el local e incrementó la variedad de comidas que ofrece a sus clientes, y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece junto con su esposa han logrado hacer crecer el negocio.

Ahora para cubrir su demanda cuenta con la ayuda de cinco empleados y desea continuar creciendo para lo que solicita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos, con lo que espera incrementar su producción, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo exitoso de este negocio, Anibal y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: César Omar

texts.es:
Due to a lack of resources, César had to drop out of school and start working in his father's electrical shop eight years ago. Little by little, he learned the trade and helped his father to expand the business. Today César is married and has a little son, to whom he wants to offer a good education so he will have a better future. This is what motivates him to exert himself more and more each day.

At the moment, César needs a loan for $250, which will be used to remodel his workshop, installing tile to improve the working conditions and improve the quality of service they offer. He promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Your help can improve the life of this family by contributing to the growth of their business. They are grateful for your support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ante la falta de recursos César no pudo continuar estudiando y empezó a trabajar en el taller eléctrico de su padre hace ocho años, poco a poco fue aprendiendo el oficio y ayudando a su padre a crecer más con su negocio. Ahora César está casado y tiene un pequeño hijo al que desea poder ofrecerle una buena educación para que tenga un mejor futuro, esto es lo que lo motiva a esforzase más cada día.

En estos momentos César necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la remodelación de su taller, instalando un tejaban para mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y mejorar la calidad de servicio que ofrecen, él se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Juan Ángel

texts.es:
Juan Ángel is originally from San Juanito, Chihuahua, in Northern Mexico. He is married and has two children ages 10 and 3. The lack of employment in his area and the necessity of obtaining income to cover the expenses of his household motivated him to start his own business making rustic furniture three years ago. He started with some capital supplied by one of his customers. Little by little he has acquired tools and supplies to fabricate the furniture.

In order to improve the quality of his products and increase his production, now he is requesting a loan for $475, which he will use to buy a power saw, which will be very useful in his business. He promises to repay this amount in just three months. You can contribute to the growth of this business and improve the quality of life for Juan and his family. They are very grateful for your confidence and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Juan Ángel es originario de San Juanito, Chihuahua, en el norte de México, es casado y tiene dos hijo de 10 y 3 años de edad. La falta de empleo en su localidad y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para solventar los gastos de su hogar lo motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio elaborando muebles rústicos hace tres años, empezó con el capital que le había financiado uno de sus clientes, poco a poco fue adquiriendo herramientas y más material para elaborar los muebles.

En busca de mejorar la calidad de sus trabajos e incrementar su producción ahora está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de una motosierra que será de gran utilidad en su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo tres meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, y mejorar la calidad de vida de Juan y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola is married and has two daughters, ages 2 and 17. Her husband is a laborer and the salary he receives is too little to cover the basic necessities of the family and the education expenses of the older daughter. This is the reason why Fabiola started her own business selling groceries one year ago. The good service she offers and the good quality of the products she sells have helped increase the number of her customers and made her business grow.

With the increased demand, now Fabiola needs a loan for $925, which she will will use to remodel her store to have a bigger space and to offer better service to her customers. She promises to repay this amount in 6 months. Be an important part of the growth of this business by deciding to support Fabiola.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Fabiola es casada y tiene dos hijas, de 2 y 17 años de edad. Su esposo es obrero y el salario que recibe es muy poco para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y los gastos de la educación de su hija mayor, esta es la razón por la que Fabiola inició su propio negocio con al venta de abarrotes hace un año, el buen servicio que ofrece y la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa le han ayudado a incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Con el incremento en la demanda que ha tenido, ahora Fabiola necesita de un préstamo de $925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su tienda para tener un lugar más amplio y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudar a Fabiola.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio is married and he has three children. Formerly, he worked in the United States, but the desire to be with his family motivated him to return to Mexico. To obtain the necessary resources for his wife and children, because of the lack of employment, he decided to start his own business one year ago. He rented a location and started offering his services repairing and painting cars. Little by little he became better-known and the high quality of his work has helped him increase the number of his customers and expand his business.

Now Ignacio is requesting a loan for $325, which will be used for remodeling his location, changing the electric fixtures and improving the look of his business to offer better service to his customers. He agrees to repay this loan in 4 months. Please decide to support Ignacio and his family by contributing to the growth of his business. They are sincerely grateful for your confidence and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ignacio es casado y tiene tres hijos, anteriormente trabajaba en Estados Unidos pero el deseo de estar con su familia lo motivó a regresar a México. Para obtener los recursos necesarios para su esposa e hijos, ante la falta de empleo, decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace un año, rentó un local en donde comenzó a ofrecer sus servicios de carrocería y pintura, poco a poco se fue dando a conocer y la buena calidad de trabajo que realiza le ha ayudado a incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora Ignacio está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local, cambiando las instalaciones eléctricas y mejorando el aspecto de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Ignacio y su familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Jesús Ignacio

texts.es:
Jesús is married and has three children. In observing the needs of his neighborhood, five years ago he started his own business selling groceries, in order to improve his family's quality of life and offer his children a good education. He started out selling basic necessities and little by little he has added more variety to his business. Today he has a wide variety of products and he has made his business grow with the help of his wife and children.

In order to improve the quality of service and meet the demands of his customers, he is now soliciting a loan for $475, which he will use to purchase merchandise. He agrees to repay this amount in 5 months. Please help this family improve their life by contributing to the growth of their business. They are sincerely grateful for your support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Jesús es casado y tiene tres hijos, observando las necesidades de su colonia, desde hace cinco años, inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecerle a sus hijos una buena educación, empezó vendiendo productos de primera necesidad y poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor su negocio, hoy tiene un amplio surtido de productos y ha hecho crecer su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos.

Para mejora la calidad de su servicio y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Ayuda a esta familia a mejorar su vida contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is married and has two daughters, one of whom is studying at the university. With the salary her husband receives as a driver, it's very difficult to cover all the necessities of the family, which is why for the last 25 years Irma has worked making and selling food. Now the expenses of her family have increased, and she wants to expand her business in order to be able to offer her daughter the opportunity to continue with her studies.

The high quality of her products has helped her stay in business for such a long time. Now Irma wants to be able to offer her products at various locations, so she is requesting a loan for $475, which she will use to purchase a cart she can use to sell her products in places where there is a higher demand, and in that way expand her business. She agrees to repay this amount in 6 months. Be a part of this dream and help this family improve and expand their business. They thank you sincerely.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Irma es casada y tiene dos hijas, una de ellas está estudiado en la universidad y con el salario que su esposo recibe como chofer es muy difícil cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que desde hace 25 años Irma se dedica a elaborar y vender comidas, ahora que los gastos de su familia se han incrementado Irma quiere que su negocio crezca para poder darle a su hija la oportunidad de continuar estudiando.

La buena calidad de los productos que elabora le han ayudado a mantenerse en el negocio durante tanto tiempo, ahora Irma desea poder ofrece sus productos en varios lugares para lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de un carrito con el que podrá ubicarse en lugares donde tenga una mejor demanda y hará crecer su negocio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de este sueño y ayuda a esta familia a mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy a food cart

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
I am a widow and I live by myself, but I work all day long. The problem I have is that in my house I don't have a window in the kitchen, and thus it seals in a lot of heat. I'd like to tear down part of the wall and put in a window as well as a grating. I request $1,000 to put in a window with its grille.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Yo soy viuda y vivo sola pero trabajo todo el día, el problema que tengo en mi vivienda es que no tengo ventana en la cocina así es que se encierra mucho el calor, me gustaría tumbar una parte de la pared y poner una ventana así como tambien la reja”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner una ventana con su reja.

loans.use: Put in a window and grille - Poner ventana y reja

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
"Last year I started to build a second story for my house but due to a family problem was forced to stop. I would like to finish it since my children are growing and we need more space. I'm applying for $1,200 to finish my contruction."

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

“El año pasado empecé a construir en la planta alta de mi vivienda, pero debido a un problema familiar tuve que parar la construcción, me gustaría terminarla ya que mis hijos están creciendo y necesitamos más espacio. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción."

loans.use: Finish construction

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma has one daughter, age 24, and two sons, ages 9 and 22. Since she separated from her husband, she has had to work hard and start her own business selling food in order to get ahead with her family as a single woman. Because of the necessities of the household, her older son went to work temporarily in the United States, and her daughter helps her with the business. Together they have made the business grow, thanks also to living close to factories and stores which order more and more of their products, creating a sure demand.

Norma wants to continue expanding in order to offer a better quality of life to her family and so that her son can return to Mexico. She is requesting a loan for $650 which will be used to remodel their location to offer better service and increase their production capacity. Norma and her family are very grateful for your confidence and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Norma tiene una hija de 24 años de edad y dos hijos, de 9 y 22 años. Desde que se separó de su esposo ha tenido que esforzarse mucho e iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de comidas para sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, ante las necesidades por las que pasaban su hijo mayor se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar temporalmente y su hija le ayuda en el negocio, juntas lo han hecho crecer y gracias a que viven cerca de fábricas y almacenes tienen una demanda segura que les solicita cada vez más de sus productos.

Norma desea continuar creciendo para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y que su hijo pueda regresar a México, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que destinará a la remodelación de su local para ofrecer un mejor servicio y poder ampliar su capacidad de producción, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Norma y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina is 50 years old, married and has two children. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she sells all types of basic goods such as sugar, medicinal herbs, oil, meat, etc. Also, with the help of her husband she prepares "chipa" to sell on the street (a typical Paraguayan food made of starch, eggs and cheese). She has done this for more than 20 years.

Adelina tells us there have been very difficult periods, when sales in the store were low and they had to make and sell "chipas." Her husband would go selling in the streets, especially by the soccer fields, and she by the church. They did this for at least two years and again stocked up their store, Adelina returning to manage it. Thanks to their honest work and sacrifice, today their children study, work and help to cover household expenses.

Adelina has previously applied for loans and has developed a good payment history. Today she wants to apply for a $500 loan to buy flour, eggs, milk, candy and oil, amongst other goods, in order to build up her inventory and that way increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelina tiene 50 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Ella es dueña de una despensa donde vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, yerba, aceite, carne, etc., además con la ayuda de su marido, Don Amancio, ella prepara chipa (una comida típica de Paraguaya hecho a base de almidón, huevo y queso) para venderla de forma ambulante.

Se dedican a esta actividad hace más de 20 años, Adelina nos cuenta que pasaron momentos muy difíciles, dónde las ventas en la despensa eran muy bajas por lo que tuvieron que fabricar chipas y venderlas, su marido salía a vender de forma ambulante especialmente en las canchas de futbol y ella cerca de la iglesia, hasta que pasaron por lo menos 2 años y nuevamente volvieron a surtir su despensa y Adelina volvió a quedar al mando de la despensa. Gracias a su noble trabajo y sacrificio hoy día sus hijos estudian, trabajan y ayudan para cubrir los gastos de la casa.

Adelina ya ha solicitado créditos con anterioridad, y ha adquirido una buena referencia de pagos, hoy día ella desea solicitar $ 500 para comprar harina, huevos, leche, golosinas, aceite entre otros para surtir el stock de su mercadería y así poder ampliar las ventas de su despensa.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, milk, snacks and oil

loans.name: Carina Flora

texts.es:
Carina is 29 years old, married with six children. She opened a business from her house where she sells all types of women's and men's garments. For more than three years she has worked in this area. Her business is located right in the center of Piribebuy, which is one of the busiest areas and allows for a good amount of sales.

Apart from watching over her business, Carina is responsible for raising her six children. She states that it's not an easy job; you have to keep watch over the kids' education and check up on their homework in high school.

Carina is a dynamic, active and creative woman, as she is always looking to add more products to sell in her business. She recently started to sell shoes, which has generated good profits for her since the first month, she tells us. She invested her previous loans from Fundación Paraguaya in winter clothes and shoes. Now she would like to continue adding more products and variety to her business, thus she is asking for a loan to obtain school supplies to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carina tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Ella abrió un negocio en su casa donde vende todo tipo de prendas para damas y caballeros, se dedica a este ramo hace mas de 3 años y su negocio está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Piribebuy que es una de las zonas de mayor concurrencia, y que le permite tener un buen movimiento de ventas. La señora Carina además de atender el negocio tiene la responsabilidad de cuidar de sus seis hijos, ella manifiesta que es una tarea difícil, pues debe velar por los estudios de sus hijos y controlar las tareas del colegio. Carina, es una señora muy dinámica, activa y creativa, ya que en todo momento busca incorporar más productos para la venta en su negocio, hace poco empezó a vender zapatos, que según nos cuenta ya le ha generado buenas ganancias desde el primer mes. Los préstamos obtenidos de la Fundación Paraguaya con anterioridad los invirtió en la compra de ropas para invierno y zapatos; hoy día desea seguir incorporando nuevos productos y seguir variando su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito para adquirir útiles escolares para vender.

loans.use: To buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, pens, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is 52 years old, married and father of six children. He is a carpenter with more than 30 years of experience. This trade was passed down from his father, who during his time was one of the most reknowed carpenters in the city.

Francisco tells us that despite there being tough competition nowadays from factories that make metal furniture, he has a good amount of demand for his products. Among his clients are large furniture stores from nearby cities such as Piribebuy and Paraguarí (two cities located just kilometers from the city where he lives), furniture stores in central Caacupé, and individual clients who come to his workshop and make special orders. Among the furniture he makes we can list: cribs, bedframes, tables, chairs and kitchen furniture.

With previous loans from Fundación Paraguaya he has invested in the purchase of wood to manufacture a greater quantity of furniture. A month ago he landed a new client, a new furniture store that opened up in the city's center, and they have asked him for a lot of work. To carry this out he needs to buy a large amount of wood, thus he is asking for a $500 loan to get the wood for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Francisco tiene 52 años, está casado y es padre de 6 hijos; el es carpintero y se dedica a este rubro hace más ya de 30 años. Adquirió el oficio de su padre, quien en su época fue uno de los carpinteros más renombrados de la ciudad. Francisco nos cuenta que a pesar de que en estos tiempos hay una gran competencia con las fábricas que realizan muebles de metal, él tiene una buena cantidad de demanda por los productos que realiza. Entre sus clientes se encuentran grandes mueblerías de distintas ciudades cercanas como Piribebuy y Paraguarí (dos ciudades que quedan a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad donde él vive) así como también mueblerías del centro de Caacupé, y clientes particulares que se acercan hasta su taller a solicitar la fabricación de algún mueble en especial. Entre los muebles que fabrica podemos citar: cunas, camas, mesas, sillas y muebles de cocina. Los préstamos obtenidos anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya los ha invertido en la compra de maderas para fabricar en mayor cantidad de número sus muebles.
