Hace un mes adquirió un nuevo cliente, una mueblería nueva que se abrió en el centro de la ciudad y le ha solicitado una gran cantidad de trabajo, para poder realizarlo necesita comprar maderas en grandes cantidades para ello el solicita un crédito de $ 500 con los que adquirirá la madera para su trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Gerardo Ramón

texts.es:
Mr. Gerardo is 57 years old, married and has three children. Their children are students and they help their parents taking care of the cows that they have, of which they sell their milk in the neighborhood of their house. They've dedicated themselves to this activity for more than 10 years. Thanks to his effort and that of his wife they were able to maintain the house and the schooling of their children. To be able to have greater income, Gerardo also runs a kiosk that is situated very close to the crossroads denominated Pribebuy branch. His principal clientele are the "chiperas" stationed near his business that are more or less some 15 saleswomen of chips (a very typical snack of our country), and so these are also the travelling salespeople in the area. Gerardo is a highly respected man in his community due to his honest work and his great worth as a person; he forms a part of various community groups with the aims of growing and bettering his neighborhood. The loans previously obtained from la Fundacion Paraguaya he has invested in the purchase of merchandise to stock his kiosk such as sodas, beer, sweets, etc.. He wishes to solicit a new credit that he will invest in the purchase of sweets, sodas, dairy products and snacks since the demand for these products is on the rise and the purchase of these products at wholesale will generate greater discounts that will augment his revenue. He wishes further on to be able to enlarge his dairy buying more cows with the savings that he is amassing thanks to the profits generated by his kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gerardo tiene 57 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. Sus hijos son estudiantes y le ayuda a sus padres cuidando de las vacas que tienen y de las cuales venden su leche en el barrio de su casa, se dedican a esta actividad hace ya más de 10 años, gracias a su esfuerzo y la de su esposa pudieron mantener la casa y el estudio de sus hijos. Para poder tener mayores ingresos, Gerardo también administra un kiosco, que se encuentra muy cerca del cruce denominado ramal Piribebuy, sus principales clientes son las chiperas apostada cerca de su negocio que son más o menos unas 15 señoras vendedoras de chipas (una comida muy típica de nuestro país); como a si también lo son los vendedores ambulantes de la zona. Gerardo, es un señor muy respetado en su comunidad por su trabajo honesto y sus grandes valores como persona; el forma parte de varios grupos comunitarios, con finalidades de crecimiento y mejoramiento de su barrio. Los préstamos obtenidos anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya lo ha invertido en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su kiosco tales como gaseosas, cerveza, golosinas, etc.. Desea solicitar un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, productos lácteos y snacks pues la demanda de estos productos están en alzas y la compra al por mayor de estos productos le generarán mayores descuentos que aumentarán sus ganancias; él desea más adelante poder ampliar su tambo comprando más vacas con los ahorros que está juntando gracias a las ganancias generadas en su kiosco.

loans.use: purchase of sweets, sodas, dairy products and snacks - golosinas, gaseosas, productos lácteos y snacks

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is 30 years old, single and the mother of 2 children. She is a humble woman but very hardworking, and thanks to her sacrifices she has been able to raise her children, acting as both mother and father.

Hermelinda is the owner of a business where she sells fast food like empanadas, sweet pies and salads, fruit juice and soft drinks. Thanks to previous loans she was able to start her business. One of her children helps her prepare the food and run her business, work that begins in the early morning.

Her main customers work in a soap factory that is a block away from her store. She prepares both breakfast and lunch for them.

Hermelinda hopes to take out a new loan to buy tables and chairs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Hermelinda tiene 30 años, es soltera y madre de 2 hijos, ella es una persona muy humildes, pero muy trabajadora, y gracias a su sacrificio ha podido sacar adelanta a su hijos, cumpliendo el rol de madre y padre a la vez.

Hermelinda es dueña de un negocio donde se dedica a la venta comidas rápidas tales como empanadas, tartas dulces y saladas, jugos de frutas y gaseosas. Gracias a créditos solicitados anteriormente ella pudo montar su negocio; una de sus hijas la acompaña en la actividad diaria que lo inician a muy tempranas horas de la madrugada.

Sus principales clientes son los empleados de un fabrica de jabones que queda a una cuadra de su negocio, a quienes ella también prepara el desayuno y el almuerzo.

Hermelinda desea adquirir un nuevo crédito que lo utilizará para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
I need to build a room since my house is very small and we are a family of six. The space that we have is greatly reduced since there are only two rooms, the kitchen and the bath. I request $1,000 for the construction.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito construir un cuarto ya que mi casa en muy pequeña y somos 6 de familia, el espacio que tenemos es muy reducido ya que solo son 2 cuartos, la cocina y el baño”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción.

loans.use: Building a room - Construcion de loza y un cuarto

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Some months ago I began the construction of a bathroom but I've not been able to finish it. I would like to finish it now since what we have is not very hygienic for my family. I request $1,000 to finish the construction of a bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace algunos meses empecé la construcción de un baño pero no he podido terminarlo, quisiera terminarlo ahora ya que el que tenemos no es muy higiénico para mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de un baño.

loans.use: To finish the construction of a bathroom - Terminar la construcción de un baño

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
I want to build a room and cover it in a tile floor, as well as a small thicket fence since I have some of the material purchased but I have to buy more and pay the labor only that I don't now have the complete amount. I request $1,200 for the construction of the room, to put in the floor and have the fence.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Quiero construir un cuarto y ponerle vitropiso, así como hacer una barda pequeña ya que tengo algo de material que he comprado pero tengo que comprar más y pagar la mano de obra solo que no cuento ahora con la cantidad completa”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción del cuarto, poner el piso y hacer la barda.

loans.use: Construction of a room, floor and fence - Construcción de un cuarto, piso y barda

loans.name: Flabio

texts.es:
My house is deteriorating a lot due to the strong rains; there is a lot of humidity in the walls so I have to stretch out my arms and paint so that they don't deteriorate further and perhaps fall in I also need to waterproof since when it rains there gets to be a lagoon in the roof. Due to the humidity, I have already lost to ruins some furniture. I ask for $1,200 to waterproof my home and paint it.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi casa se esta deteriorando mucho debido a las fuertes lluvias, hay mucha humedad en las paredes así es que tengo que enjarrar y pintar para que no se vayan a deteriorar más y se caigan también necesito impermeabilizar ya que cuando llueve se hace una laguna en el techo, ya se me han echado a perder algunos muebles debido a la humedad”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para impermeabilizar mi vivienda y pintarla.

loans.use: Waterproof and paint the house - Impermeabilizar, enjarrar y pintar

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
I am the proprietor of a carpentry shop. Two months ago a power plane I had broke and I have missed it greatly since it makes my work agile; I urgently need to buy one because without it my sales have dropped considerably. I request $1,000 to buy a power plane.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Yo soy propietario de un taller de carpintería, hace 2 meses se me quebró un cepillo electrónico que tenia y me ha hecho mucha falta ya que agiliza mi trabajo tengo la necesidad urgente de comprarla ya debido a que mis ventas han bajado considerablemente”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar un cepillo electrónico.

loans.use: To buy and power plane - Comprar un cepillo electrónico

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is a 20-year-old, hardworking young man. He is not married and lives with his parents. Three years ago, he graduated from school and started to work in a collective farm. Usually collective farmers are not paid enough in cash to live on, so the collective farm allocates sites with apricot trees to its workers. The crop from these trees is processed, dried, and by selling the dried apricots, people can make cash. Besides the apricots from the site allocated to him, Shukhrat buys apricots from his neighbors. This brings additional profit for his micro-business.

Having learned about MicroInvest, Shukhrat became a client and received a loan to buy an apricot orchard. At the moment, the season for drying apricots is in full swing, so Shukhrat is requesting a second loan to buy more apricots. In the picture, you can see Shukrat’s family harvesting apricots.

loans.use: buying apricots to dry and resell

loans.name: Narziboy

texts.en:
Narziboy works on a collective farm. As he has not been able to find a good job, Narziboy has to stay on the collective farm where the work is very hard and agricultural workers are paid very little. He is 32, married, and has a child.

Every day Narziboy goes to work early in the morning and comes back home late in the evening. Every year in July and August, the season of drying apricots comes. Narziboy and his family also dry apricots; it is the main source of income for the family.

The process of drying apricots consists in the following steps. Narziboy first buys apricots. At home he washes them, processes them with sulphur to maintain their color, and spreads them out under the sun for two days. Then all the apricots are separated from their pits (you can see this process in the picture) and spread out in the sun again.

After several days, the dried apricots are collected, put into bags, and stored till the moment when they can bring in a high price. The difference between the price he pays for the fresh apricots and what he receives for the dried apricots is Narziboy’s profit.

Narziboy already got one loan from MicroInvest to buy apricots. That loan helped him to buy more apricots and make more profit. Now Narziboy is requesting a loan of $500 to be repaid over a period of 8 months, so that he can further expand his micro-business.

loans.use: to expand his activities

loans.name: Ilkhomjon

texts.en:
Ilkhomjon is a teacher. He works at the secondary school in a place called Khonobod. Besides this, Ilkhomjon knows a lot about cattle and has a business buying and selling them. Ilkhomjon buys a cow at the market and after a week, he resells it for a better price. Thus he makes a profit. Ilkhomjon has also opened a small grocery shop near his house; his wife works there.

Ilkhomjon has been a client of MicroInvest for 9 months and has received 2 loans during this period. He affirms that every loan he has received from MicroInvest has allowed him to make a good profit. At the moment Ilkhomjon is hoping to recieve a third loan for the further expansion of his business.

loans.use: further expansion of his livestock business

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza’s husband is away working in Russia right now. He was compelled to leave as he could not find a permanent job where they live. He left his business selling paint, varnish, and finishing materials to his wife Dilfuza to run.

In spite of her age (she is only 19), Dilfuza has managed to continue the business successfully. There is a high demand for these products and they make a good profit. Dilfuza has one child; her mother-in-law looks after him while she works.

As the business is capital-intensive, it needs more financial investments. Dilfuza received a loan from MicroInvest and expanded the assortment of products she sells. Now it is a good season for sales as many people are repairing their houses. That is why Dilfuza is requesting a second loan to further expand her inventory.

loans.use: expand her inventory

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer is 27 years old and single. He lives in Khachmaz town.  This young man has his own glass shop where he works with his father. You can see his father in the picture. They buy glass and then they cut the glass into different forms, as required by their clients. Now they need a loan of $825 to buy more glass so they can increase their number of  clients and get more income.

loans.use: To buy glass

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda has been in business for 8 years. She lives with her 3 children. Her husband has been away working in Russia for several years and sends money from there to support his family.

Mavluda has her own business selling children's wear and shoes. When she started the business, she had an inventory worth $150. Gradually she has expanded and now she has goods totaling $350.

When Mavluda received a loan from MicroInvest she increased her assortment of children's shoes. Now Mavluda would like to get a new loan to buy school uniforms. Soon the school season will start and selling school clothes will be very profitable.

loans.use: buying school uniforms for her children's clothing inventory

loans.name: Sitara

texts.en: Sitara is a mother of 4 children. You can see Sitara and her husband in the picture. They live in Khachmaz region, Hadjilar village. This 43-year-old woman has 6 years of experience with cattle breeding. Now the family needs a loan of $1200 to buy 4 calves so they can grow their business

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ruhangiz

texts.en:
Ruhangiz is a mother of one child. She is 30 years old and lives in Khachmaz region, Shaklar village. She has had her own grocery store for three years.
Now she would  like a loan of $1200 to buy more food items and to  expand the area of her store.

loans.use: To buy food items

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Mrs. Ann P. is 42 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their 4 children. She works as a grocer, earning $2.50/day, and also with her husband selling rubber, a business that gives them $5/day. This income is enough to send all four of their children to school.

The requested loan will be used to purchase a car so that her husband can transport the rubber to new markets. In the future, they would like to expand their rubber business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for transporting rubber

payments.comment: Congratulations to Ann Phoeun for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: This single man is 31 years old. He lives in Khachmaz town. Zaur  has had his own auto-repair business since 2004. Now he needs a loan of  $1100  to buy spare parts so he is able to offer a better service to his clients and to attract more new clients, too.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeun S. P. is 41 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and their three children.  Mrs. Chhoeun sells coffee to the local villagers, earning about $2/day.  Her husband is a taxi driver, who earns about $5/day.  This loan will be used to purchase a car for the taxi business.  Ownership of the car will help to drive down the family's costs in the long run.

loans.use: To purchase a car for a taxi business

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: Mrs. Horm N. is 36 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province.  She works as a vendor at the market, earning about $6/day in revenues.  She is married to a farmer, and together they are raising 4 children.  This loan will be used for the family to purchase a horse to help on their farm.

loans.use: To purchase a horse to help on the farm

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim S. is a 33 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province.  She lives with her mother and her two children. Mrs. Sim works in a garment factory and also sells dessert on the roadside.  Her work gives her a total daily income of $5/day.  This loan will be used for her to purchase more tools, a fruit blender, and utensils for her business.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: To purchase a fruit blender and more utensils for her business

loans.name: Djafar

texts.en: Djafar has a fruit orchard which he has been tending for 6 years. This  51-year-old  man is married, has 2 children and lives in Khachmaz region, Godakli village. Now Djafar needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer and weed control products for his orchard.

loans.use: To buy weed control and fertilizer

loans.name: Gulbag

texts.en: Gulbag has run his orchard for five years. He is 51 years old,  married, has 2 children and lives in Khachmaz town. Now this man applies for a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer, pest control and other products for his orchard

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pest control

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Mrs. Houn L. S. is 27 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband, their 2 children, and her mother.  Mrs. Houn sells Khmer cake and earns $0.70/day.  Her husband is a horse-cart driver and he can earn $3/day.  This loan will be used to purchase one more horse for her husband's business and the rest will be used to purchase tools for making cake.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and more tools for her business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Houn Leang Srean has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Mammadrza

texts.en:
Mammadrza was born in 1948. He is married, has 4 children and lives in Khachmaz town. He has been in the cattle breeding business for 10 years. 
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy 3 calves. By having more calves, he can increase his business.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mr. So S. is a 63 year old teacher who earns $1/day.  He lives in Kampong Cham Province with his wife (pictured here) and their 7 children.  His wife is a farmer and earns $0.80/day, two of his children are hairdressers, one is a policeman, and the rest are students.  This loan will be used to purchase tools for the hairdressing shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his children's hairdressing shop

payments.comment: Congratulations to So Savath for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Sarkhan

texts.en:
Sarkhan was born in 1985. He is single and lives in Khachmaz region, Gusarchay village. He started his farming business two years ago.
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer to improve his business and generate more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Malakhat

texts.en: Malakhat is a mother of 4 children. She is 46 years old and lives in Khachmaz region, Murshud -Oba village. She has a plot of land which she bought seven years ago to improve her family's living condition. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer so that she can produce even more fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyet was born in 1984. Because her husband left her for another woman, now she lives with her daughter, 2 years old. Mrs. Nguyet sells fruits and the family income is $12 per person/month. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to run her fruit shop. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Fruit selling

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Mr. Marciano Ruiz is 64 years old, married, and has 6 sons, all grown up.  All of his sons are working: amongst them there is a blacksmith, a shoe salesman, a brick layer, and a constructor.  All of them contribute to the family's income, even though they no longer live with their father. Marciano's wife, Serafina Villalba, is a saleswoman and runs a convenience store.  

Mr. Marciano Ruiz is a shoes salesman. At his shop he sells everything from soccer cleats and slippers to bags and dress shoes.  He has been in the business for 14 years now and has been continuously expanding his business with the help of loans.  

In the past, Marciano used to only have a wooden stand on the sidewalk, whereas now he is proud to own a shoe salon which he has been slowly expanding. In addition to other customers, Marciano also has a stable clientele. The shoe store is situated in one of the most popular streets in the city, which helps Marciano's shoe-sale business. Still, he needs a loan of US$600 to be able to replenish the stock of shoes in his store by adding a new line of shoes.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for a shoe store

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Mrs. Joaquina G. V. is 39 years old, single, and has 2 sons, 22 and 19 years old. The eldest son is currently studying in a local university, while the other one is finishing high school. Mrs. Joaquina is currently working as the main cook and as a fresh fish saleswoman in a co-owned restaurant near the Paraguay River. She has been in the business for over a year now, and the business is slowly growing. Mrs. Joaquina says that the restaurant is more decorated now, and she attends to more customers, including a defined lunch-time clientele. The restaurant's clientele mostly consists of people with a refined taste for fish from around the city. People from the city's surrounding areas also frequent her restaurant.    
Mrs. Joaquina is asking for a loan of US$400 to be able to fish better by acquiring better fishing materials. She plans on investing in a new canoe as well as a new net. Likewise, she plans to spend some of the money for buying fish such as the surubí and dorado that are very popular among her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of a new canoe as well as materials for a new net

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita F. D. B. is 39 years old, married, and has 3 young sons.  All three are studying at a school close to their residence. Her husband, Milder César B., is a renowned shoe salesman of the area.  
Margarita works as a clothing saleswoman at her own store - she sells clothes, crochets, scarves, bags, as well as dresses of ao poi, a traditional Paraguayan cloth. In addition, she also works with crafts which she then sells. 
Initially, Margarita's store was very small. Over time it went through a lot of remodeling to get to its present state. Margarita has been continuously purchasing more merchandise as well as furniture to make her store more appealing. Now, she can proudly say that she has a fixed and stable clientele which helps her sales. Her relationship with most of her clientele is a long-lasting one.
Previously, Margarita owned a food stand, but she left it for her present job to be able to work less and spend more time with crafts, one of her hobbies.  
Currently, she exports some of her clothing products to Buenos Aires where Paraguayan cloth is in high demand. Also her professionalism and refined work help her get customers.    
Margarita now has to work overtime and close at later hours, since her mom is sick and has been hospitalized. This produces not only stress in the family but also a heavy economic burden. Margarita therefore needs a loan of US$400 to replenish and increase the stock at her shop to maximize the profit, so that she would be able to pay the hospital bill.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for a store

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Mr. Richard M. is 32 years old and has an 8-year-old son who is currently studying at a nearby elementary school. His wife is Mariza Librada - she also works at the convenience store which they both built at their residence. Mr. M. mostly sells and distributes candy and eggs to various convenience stores and businesses around the city. He is able to do so because of his recently-purchased vehicle which helps him increase the sales volume.  
Mr. M. and his wife started the business 8 years ago with the help of  Fundación Paraguaya. The business slowly started to grow and evolved into  a place where people also go to play billiard and gamble using slot machines. The store today offers all types of products such as cleaning items and edibles. The store's patio serves as a reunion place for friends from around the neighborhood. 
Their store is the biggest in the neighborhood and is frequently attended by its already fixed clientele. Mr. M., however, needs a loan of US$800 to be able to purchase a greater variety of products for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk supply of candy, soda, coke and beer

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto, his wife, and his young son live in the home of his parents, on Achocalla Street in the Llojeta district of the city of La Paz. He manufactures clothing, and with his first loan from IMPRO he bought a sewing machine with an overlock. His wife began using that machine as well, and they went into the shirt-making business. Today they tailor shirts to order for boys from 10 to 15 years of age.

Their goal is to set up a shop and manufacture shirts in bulk for adults so that they can increase profits. Modesto would use this new loan to buy an industrial machine made by the Recta Company and also to buy fabric wholesale so that they can reduce outlay. His previous loan has been repaid in full.

His payment history makes him an excellent candidate for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Modesto vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa y su hijo pequeño en la calle Achocalla de la zona alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la costura, y ayudado con el primer crédito otorgado por Impro compro una maquina overlock con la cual su esposa también empezó a coser y vieron la forma de confeccionar camisas. Actualmente ellos producen a pedido camisas de niños de 10 a 15 años de edad. Su objetivo es instalar un taller y poder confeccionar camisas para adultos y hacerlo en más cantidad para poder mejorar sus ingresos. Este nuevo crédito que Modesto solicita será para la compra de un maquina Industrial Recta y tela en cantidad (para rebajar el costo). El préstamo anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, lo califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her second-hand clothes business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 43 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband works in a food shop. Rosa makes and sells bread in her house. She is part of the group 10 of April 3. With the loan, she hopes to be able to put a small bread maker for her house, and buy the utensils that will allow her to make more bread and grow her business

ROSA, tiene 43 años, casada con 3 hijos , su esposo es empleado en una tienda de comestibles. Ella hace y vende pan en su casa , pertenece al grupo 10 de Abril 3 , con el préstamo espera poder colocar una pequeña amasandería en su casa y comprar utensilios que le permitan aumentar la producción de pan .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: sales of bread

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is 30 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a chauffeur. Candelaria buys clothing in a town called Mesilla, on the border with Guatemala, where she travels one or two times a month and then sells her clothing from house to house to the people in her community and the surrounding areas. With this loan, she hopes to buy larger quantities of clothing and reduce the number of trips she needs to make. She is part of a group with Maria Antonia Vasquez Moreno, who sells tamales and dishes typical of the area, who would like to use her part of the loan to invest in cooking utensils which will improve the preparation of her tamales.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes.

CANDELARIA tiene 30 años , 3 hijos , su esposo trabaja como chofer .Ella compra ropa en la Mesilla ( frontera con Guatemala ) donde viaja una o dos veces al mes y posteriormente vende su ropa de casa en casa entre las personas de su comunidad y de los alrededores, con el préstamo espera comprar mas cantidad de ropa y así disminuir la cantidad de viajes Pertenece al grupo 10 de Abril 3 junto con doña MARIA ANTONIA VASQUEZ MORENO (vende tamales alimentos típicos de la zona) ella con su parte del préstamo espera invertir en implementos de cocina para la mejor preparación de sus tamales

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es:
Rosalva is 43 years old and has 5 children. She is currently separated from her husband. She is part of the group 10 de Abril 8 (10th of April 8). She sells nutritional products from her house to other women who live in her neighborhood. With the loan, she hopes to invest in more quantity and variety of products and be able to go to other nearby communities to sell them.

ROSALVA, tiene 43 años, separada con 5 hijos, pertenece al grupo 10 de Abril 8. Vende en su casa productos alimenticios energéticos a las mujeres que viven en su comunidad. Con el préstamo espera invertir comprando mas cantidad y variedad de productos y poder así salir a vender también a comunidades cercanas a su domicilio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: sales of nutritional products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 39 years old and is separated from her husband. She has three children. She works selling healthfood, as well as cosmetics which she sells to the people in her community both by request as well as offering them door to door. She belongs to a group 10 of April 8, together with Micaela Moshan Gomez, an artist who makes makes special embroidered blouses and table clothes, and also Yesenia Vianey Lopez Roman, who sells cosmetics. With the loan, they all would like to invest in their businesses - Maria and Yesenia will buy more products to build their sales, and Micaela will buy silk and cloth to make more blouses, and be able to bring them to artists markets to sell.

MARIA, tiene 39 años, separada, tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos Alimenticios energéticos y también a la venta de cosméticos distribuyéndolos entre las personas de su comunidad, algunas veces a pedido y también ofreciéndolas casa por casa. Ella pertenece al grupo 10 de Abril 8.junto con doña MICAELA MOSHAN GOMEZ (artesana que confecciona blusas y servilletas de manta y luego las borda) Y doña YESENIA VIANEY LOPEZ ROMAN (vende cosméticos) Todas esperan con el préstamo invertir en sus negocios, doña Maria y doña Yesenia compraran mas productos para aumentar de esta forma sus ventas , en cambio doña Micaela comprará hilos de seda y manta para tener mayor cantidad de blusas que vender y poder llevarlas al mercado de artesanías a ofrecerlas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Selling food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his second-hand clothing business.

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.es:
"I don't feel safe in my house because I don't have protection around so I would like to build a wall in the front for my family's security." I'm asking for $1,200 to build a wall.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“No me siento segura en mi casa ya que no tengo protecciones alrededor asi es que me gustaría levantar una barda al frente para la seguridad de mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para levantar una barda

loans.use: Build a wall.

loans.name: Juan Agustin Francis

texts.es:
"I have a store that I built myself and I would like to invest in a small taco restaurant, but I lack capital; I think that it would be a good business because there are no food businesses nearby." I'm asking for $1,200 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un local que yo mismo hice y me gustaría invertir para poner un restaurante chico de tacos, pero me falta capital pienso que seria buen negocio debido a que cerca de aquí no hay ningún negocio de comida”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio

loans.use: Invest in my business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished construction project that I would like to finish so that I can make my house bigger and more comfortable for my family, something that's needed because space is becoming more and more limited." I'm asking for $1,000 to finish the construction.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar y me gustaría terminarla, así como poner el piso, esto hará más amplia mi casa y más cómoda para mi familia ya que el espacio es cada vez más reducido”. Solicito $ 1.000.00 dlls para terminar la construcción y poner el piso.

loans.use: Finish house construction.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
"I need to build a room because my house is very small and space is very limited; I also need to install security bars because the neighborhood is not very safe and I worry about the safety of my children." I'm asking for $1,000 to build a room and install security bars.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito construir un cuarto ya que mi casa es muy pequeña, el espacio que tenemos es muy reducido y también necesito poner rejas ya que el barrio no es muy seguro y me preocupa la seguridad de mi hijos”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto y la instalación de rejas.

loans.use: Build a room and install security bars.

loans.name: Juventino

texts.es:
"I need to build a room on my house so that it will be more comfortable for my family because they made these houses with only 2 bedrooms, a kitchen and bathroom and we can no longer fit. In fact, one of my kids has to sleep on a couch because there's no space to put another bed." I'm asking for $1,000 to build a room.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito construir un cuarto en mi casa para que sea más cómoda para mi familia ya que esas casas las hicieron solo con 2 recamaras, la cocina y el baño y en realidad no cabemos de echo 1 de mis hijos tiene que dormir en un sillón por que no hay espacio para poner una cama más”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
"I would like to invest in the purchase of another public-transit vehicle; I think that my family and I would be able to earn more if we put another vehicle to work." I'm asking for $1,200 to buy a public-transit vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

"Me gustaría invertir en la compra de otra unidad de transporte público, pienso que podría irme a mi y a mi familia mucho mejor si ponemos a trabajar otro vehículo más y así obtener más ganancias” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar una unidad de transporte público.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of a public-transit vehicle.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
“My house has very little protection and I would like to build a wall and install extra protection all around, for the security of my children more than anything, but also to keep anyone from coming in to steal.” I’m asking for $1,000 to build a wall and install extra protection.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi casa esta muy desprotegida y me gustaría construir una barda y poner protecciones alrededor más que nada por la seguridad de mis hijos y para evitar que alguien pueda entrar a robar”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para levantar una barda y poner protecciones.

loans.use: Build a wall and install extra protection.

loans.name: Candida Concepción

texts.en:
Mrs. Candida Concepción M. is 23 years old and lives with her partner. She has been working in recycling for over 5 years now. She buys and sells recycling materials which she does with the help of a small cart that she pulls herself. Specifically, she generally works with aluminum, cardboard, metals, and plastics. Her partner also works in this trade.

Thanks to her savings in the job, she was recently able to purchase a small terrain where the couple built their house. She has had recent complications with her job due to pregnancy complications where she miscarried. In addition to that, she has been having trouble recently doing her job because it is the rainy season and she works in the outdoors which hinders her efficiency.

They would like to get a loan to build a storage shed where they can keep their recycled materials. Likewise, they would like to purchase a horse to help them in their job. Currently, she only uses a cart which she herself pulls and stresses that her job depends a lot on mobility.

She is a part of a group of 17 women who take a part in the Committee of Enterprising Women in Paraguay.

loans.use: To build a storage shed where she can keep the  recycled materials.

loans.name: Simona Dolores

texts.es:
Mrs. T. has more than two decades of experience running a brick-manufacturing business. She is married and has four children. One of her children takes over for her when she is not in charge. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy raw materials used in the manufacture of bricks, including sand, cement, lime, crushed rock, and so on. She hopes this loan will help her increase sales and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

La Sra. T. tiene más de 2 décadas de administrar su negocio de fabricación de bloques, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio cuando ella no está al mando. En la actualidad está solicitando el crédito para comprar los materiales con los cuales elabora sus bloques, entre estos materiales están: arena, cemento, cal, piedrín, etc. Con el crédito piensa elevar sus ventas y mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familiares.

loans.use: To buy raw materials used in the manufacture of bricks

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we could not verify that Ms. Torrez was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you and we hope you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Mr. M. owns a brickworks located in a densely populated district of Managua called Mirna Ugarte. He is married and has two children. He would use the loan to buy raw materials used in the manufacture of bricks so that he can fill a large order placed by one his best clients. The loan would let him take advantage of this excellent business opportunity and thereby increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

El Sr. M. es propietario de una bloquera situadad en un populoso barrio de managua llamado Mirna Ugarte, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. En la actualidad está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para elaborar más productos y cubrir con un pedido grande que le está haciendo uno de sus mejores clientes. El crédito le permitirá provechar esta gran oportunidad de negocio y le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos, mejorando así las condiciones de vida de sus familiares.

loans.use: To buy raw materials used in the manufacture of bricks.

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were unable to verify that Mr. Molina was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and we hope you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.es:
Yonatan is married and lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo León. Due to a lack of employment opportunities in his local area and his need for an income to maintain his family, Yonatan started his own business selling clothes from a catalogue a year and a half ago. His love of sales and his industrious nature have helped his business to grow rapidly and his client base has increased.

He now needs a loan of $475 which he will use to buy merchandise to meet his cleints’ needs and to improve his service. He promises to repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Be a part of the growth of this business. Yonatan and his family thank you very much for the opportunity that you can give them to improve and expand this business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Yonatan es casado y vive en la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León. Ante la falta de empleo en su localidad y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para sostener a su familia, Yonatan inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado por catálogo desde hace un año y medio, su gusto por las ventas y su carácter emprendedor le ha ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio rápidamente e incrementar su clientela.

Ahora necesita de un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Yonatan y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a single mother with a 16 year old daughter and a 6 year old son. They have been her motivation for starting her own business selling tamales, which she started doing 2 years ago. When her daughter went to secondary school her household costs went up considerably, and in order for her daughter to continue to study, she started her own business. It has gone very well thanks to the good quality of her products and her client base has therefore grown.

Now Yolanda needs a loan of $925 to buy some bigger steamers and more ingredients to make tamales. This will help her to increase her production and meet her clients’ demands. She will repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Be a part of the growth of her business. You can help to improve this family’s life. Yolanda sincerely thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Yolanda es madre soltera de una joven de 16 años de edad y un pequeño de 6 años, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de tamales hace dos años, cuando su hija entró a estudiar la preparatoria los gastos de su hogar se incrementaron considerablemente y para que su hija continuara estudiando decidió emprender este negocio, donde le ha ido muy bien y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado incrementar su clientela.

En estos momentos Yolanda necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de unas vaporeras más grandes e insumos para la elaboración de los tamales, esto le permitirá incrementar su producción y cubrir la creciente demanda que tiene, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, tu puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, Yolanda agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy steamers/Compra de vaporeras

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín is married and has 2 young kids. His salary used to be very low did not cover their basic household needs. He therefore decided to work for himself and started to rent a taxi in order to work. When he had saved up enough money he bought his own taxi. He works hard every day for the wellbeing of his family and for his children’s education.

Right now Benjamín would like a loan of $475 which he will use for the repairs and maintenance of his taxi so that he can offer a better and safer service to his clients. He will repay this loan in 6 months. Benjamin thanks you for your support and for the opportunity that you can give him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Benjamín está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, el salario que recibía como empleado era muy poco y no podía cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia así es que decidió trabajar por su cuenta y comenzó a rentar taxis para trabajar, pronto comenzó a ahorrar y logró adquirir su propio taxi. El bienestar de su familia y el deseo que sus hijos puedan continuar estudiando es lo que lo motiva a trabajar y esforzarse más cada día.

En estos momentos Benjamín está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la reparación y mantenimiento de su taxi, para ofrecer un mejor servicio y mas seguridad a sus clientes, él promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Benjamín agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair/Mantenimiento y reparación

loans.name: Alma Sonia

texts.es:
Alma is single and has a 7 year old son. She has never had any help with his upbringing so she has had to work very hard. Her son was her motivation for starting her own business offering beauty services and she has gradually improved her techniques and services. Alma wants her son to have a good education and to improve his quality of life and this is why she wants her business to grow.

Alma would now like a loan of $475 which she will use to help advertise her business so that more people know about it so that her client base can grow and she will therefore be able to pay this loan back over a period of 6 months. Be an important part of the growth of this business, help this family. They thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Alma es soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad, nunca ha tenido el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a su hijo por lo que se ha esforzado mucho, su hijo fue el motivo por el cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista, poco a poco ha ido acondicionando mejor su estética y mejorando los servicios que ofrece. Alma desea que su hijo pueda tener una buena educación y mejorar su calidad de vida, es por esto que quiere que su negocio pueda crecer.

En estos momentos, Alma necesita un crédito de $ 475 dólares que empleará en publicidad para su negocio con el objetivo que más personas conozcan su estética, ella espera de esta manera incrementar sus clientes y continuar creciendo y devolverá este préstamo en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de ese negocio, ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Advertising/Publicidad

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia lives in San Nicolás in Nuevo León. She is married with 3 kids. Her husband’s salary is very low and did not cover their basic family needs. As Leticia is a very industrious woman, 4 years ago she decided to start her own business selling tamales. She started selling to neighbors and family members, but thanks to the good quality of her products she has more and more clients and her business has grown.

Now, in order to meet her clients’ needs Leticia needs a loan of $250 to buy ingredients so that she can increase the quality and production of her products. She will repay this amount over a period of 4 months. Be part of the growth of this business and decide to help this family improve their quality of life. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de San Nicolás, Nuevo León vive Leticia, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos. El salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo y no podía cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, pero como Leticia es una mujer emprendedora hace cuatro años inició su negocio con la venta de tamales, vendiendo primero a sus vecinos y familiares, pero gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora pronto ha logrado ganar más clientes y crecer con su negocio.

Ahora para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Alma necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, ella espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y regresará esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte en este crecimiento y decídete a ayudar a esta familia a mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana Celia is married and has five kids. In order to earn some more money so that her kids could continue studying Ana decided to start her own business 6 years ago. She sells second hand clothes in markets and with the help of her husband her merchandise has increased and her service improved. Her love for her children and promise to her husband keep her going everyday.

In order for her business to grow and to increase the amount of products that she offers, Ana would like a loan of $250 which she will pay back over a period of 4 months. Your help is much appreciated in the development of this business. Help this family to improve their lives. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Celia es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra que les permitiera a sus hijos continuar estudiando desde hace seis años Ana inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada, con el apoyo de su esposo realiza sus ventas en los mercados y poco a poco han ido incrementando la mercancía que ofrece y mejorando su servicio. El amor hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo la motivan a esforzarse más cada día.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio y ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece Ana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 4 meses. Tu ayuda es de gran utilidad en el desarrollo de este negocio, apoya a esta familia a mejorar su vida, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely is married and lives in San Nicolás in Nuevo León. A year ago Aracely decided to start selling clothes from catalogues in order to help her husband to build a better future for their children and to offer them economic stability. She started selling to neighbors and family members but soon had many more clients thanks to her good service and her easy going personality.

Araceli is now asking for a loan of $475 which she will use to buy merchandise in order to meet her clients’ demands and to offer them a better service. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 6 months. You can be an important part in the growth of this business. Aracely thanks you for the opportunity that you can offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Aracely es casada y vive en la localidad de San Nicolás en Nuevo León. Para ayudar a su esposo a construir un patrimonio para sus futuros hijos y ofrecerles una estabilidad económica, desde hace un año Aracely se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo, comenzó vendiendo entre sus vecinos y familiares pero pronto ha logrado ganar más clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y a su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con las personas.

Ahora Aracely está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para surtir los pedidos que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Aracely agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is from Apodaca, Nuevo León. She is married with 3 kids. In order to earn extra money for her kids’ education and to improve their quality of life, Celia decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. She started in her own house selling form a catalogue but thanks to the good quality of her products and the easy payment options the demand has grown rapidly.

Right now Celia needs your help so that her business can grow. She would like a loan of $250 so that she can meet her clients’ needs and offer them a better service. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 3 months. You can be a part of the growth of this business. Celia and her family thank you for your help and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Celia es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra que les permitiera a sus hijos continuar estudiando y mejorar su calida de vida Celia comenzó su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, inició en su propia casa con dos catálogos pero gracias a la calidad de los productos que comercializa y a las facilidades de pagos que ofrece sus pedidos se han incrementado rápidamente.

En estos momentos celia necesita de tu ayuda para hacer crecer su negocio, ella necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que le permitan surtir los pedidos que tiene y poder brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte en el crecimiento de este negocio, Celia y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Yannette

texts.es:
A year ago Yannette started her own business selling snacks and soft drinks. She started her business aiming to earn extra income to help her husband with the household expenses. The couple has two children, 6 and 9 years old, both of whom are still in school. To give her chidren everything they need while still being personally taking care of them, Yannette set up her business in her home. Thanks to the good quality of the products she sells she has successfully grown her clientele.

To continue growing, Yannette is applying for a loan of $200. She'll use the loan to buy merchandise which will increase the variety of products she offers and thereby the quality of the service she offers her clients. She agrees to repay the loan in 3 months. You can help this family. No need to think further: decide to support them. They sincerely appreciate your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace un año Yannette inició su propio negocio con la venta de botanas, comenzó para obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, tienen dos hijos de 6 y 9 años que están estudiando, para poder darles todo lo necesario y cuidar de ellos, Yannette instaló su negocio en su propia casa y gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que vende ha logrado incrementar su clientela.

Para continuar creciendo Yannette está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar la variedad de productos que vende y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella esta dispuesta a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes ayudar mucho a esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlos, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is married with 2 children, 7 and 11 years old. He is an electrician who, after losing his job, decided to start his own business to earn the income he needed to support his family. He offers his services as an electrician. When he started out he had very few tools, which limited his ability to do some of the jobs he was offered, but little by little he has made himself known and thanks to the good service he offers he has succeeded in rapidly growing his clientele.

Francisco is eager to continue growing his business and offering a good service. As a result he is applying for a loan of $200 to use in the purchase of the tools that will allow him to offer additional repairs and to work in a more efficient and rapid manner. He commits to repaying the loan in only 3 months. Be a part of the development of this business. Your help is extremely valuable to Francisco and he sincerely appreciates your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco es casado y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 11 años de edad, él es técnico electricista y al quedar desempleado, para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera obtener lo necesario para su familia, decidió emprender su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de electricista, comenzó con muy poca herramienta lo que lo limitaba a realizar solo algunos trabajos, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y gracias a la buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado ampliar rápidamente su clientela.

Francisco desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y ofrecer un buen servicio para lo que esta solicitando un crédito de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramienta que le permita ofrecer otras opciones de reparación y hacerlos de una manera más rápida y eficiente, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Se parte del desarrollo de este negocio, tu ayuda es de gran utilidad para Francisco y agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy tools which will allow him to take on additional repairs, and complete them more efficiently and rapidly

loans.name: Pedro Marcos

texts.es:
Pedro is a young entrepreneur who started his own business selling tacos four years ago as a way to help his mother. With hard work and a lot of effort he has succeeded in growing his business, thanks to daily improvement in the good quality of the service and products he offers his clients.. Pedro is now married and has 2 small sons. They have been his motivation for continuing to improve and grow his business.

To cover current demand from his clients, Pedro is requesting a loan of $375 which he commits to repay within 6 months. He will use the $375 to buy the furniture and utensils he needs for his business. With your help, Pedro will improve the quality of the service he offers his clients and will continue to grow his business. He appreciates the opportunity your support offers him.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro es un joven emprendedor que inició su propio negocio con la venta de tacos hace cuatro años, ayudado de su madre y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y hacerlo crecer, gracias a la buena calidad del servicio y productos que ofrece cada día su clientela es mayor. Ahora Pedro está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, ellos han sido su motivo para continuar mejorando y creciendo con su negocio.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Pedro está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, los empleará en la compra de muebles y utensilios que necesita para su negocio. Con tu ayuda Pedro mejorara la calidad del servicio que ofrece y continuara creciendo, él agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda.

loans.use: Remodel his taco stand

loans.name: Veronia De San Martí

texts.es:
Veronia lives with her partner and their three year old son. Three years ago, wanting to contribute to paying the family's expenses and eager to improve their quality of life, Veronia started her business selling cosmetics. When she started out, she sold very little. Later, she began to offer her products on credit , an offer that was enthusiastically accepted by her clients and led to a considerable increase in orders. The well being of her young son motivates her to put more effort into growing her business every day.

At the moment Veronia is applying for a loan of $375 which she will use to purchase merchandise she will then offer to her clients on credit. She commits to repaying the loan in 6 months. Be an important part of the growth of this business and help this family. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Veronia vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Para contribuir con los gastos del hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Veronia inició su negocio con la venta de cosméticos hace tres años, comenzó vendiendo muy pocos productos pero después ofreció sus productos a crédito y obtuvo mucha aceptación de sus clientes, incrementando considerablemente sus pedidos. El bienestar de su pequeño hijo la motivan a esforzarse mas cada día y a hacer crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Veronia solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecerlo a sus clientes a crédito, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Mauricia

texts.es:
Maria Mauricia is a native of the town of Apodaca in Nuevo León. She is married with 2 small children. Her husband works as a skilled laborer. His salary is very low, however, and now that they have purchased a home, their mortgage payments have greatly reduced the family's budget. Maria is an enterprising woman, however, and decided to launch her own business selling cosmetics in order to help her husband and offer better quality of life to her children.

Maria now needs a loan of $475, which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. She hopes to increase her sales and further grow her business by incorporating shoe sales into her business. She is offering to repay the loan in 6 months. Decide to support this family. They very much appreciate the opportunity you are offering them to improve their lives and move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Mauricia es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Su esposo trabaja como operario pero el sueldo que recibe es muy bajo y como han adquirido una casa, el pago de las hipotecas reducía mucho el ingreso familiar, pero Maria es una mujer emprendedora y decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos para ayudar a su esposo y poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora Maria necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía y también quiere incorporar la venta de zapatos, con lo que espera incrementar sus ventas y hacer crecer su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely is an enterprising and optimistic woman. She is married with two children, 10 and 12 years old. Her husband works as an electrical technician. However, his salary is very low and doesn't cover the family's expenses. Two years ago, facing this financial situation, Aracely decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. Little by little she has grown her business.

At the moment, Aracely is applying for a loan of $375, which she will use to buy merchandise to cover her existing orders and to expand the range of products that she offers her clients. She agrees to repay the loan in 6 months. Aracely and her family very much appreciate the opportunity to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Aracely es una mujer emprendedora y optimista, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como técnico electricista, sin embargo, el salario que obtiene es muy poco y no puede cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante esta situación Aracely decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de cosméticos hace dos años, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos, Aracely está solicitando un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene y ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Aracely y su familia te agradecen mucho la oportunidad de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Lucero Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lucero is married with four children, aged 3, 9, 11 and 16. Two years ago, her husband was lost his job and found it very difficult to find another. To cover the family's debts and buy the family's necessities, Lucero and her husband decided to start their own business selling groceries. Little by little, they have added more items and a wider variety of items to the store's offerings, and they have succeeded in growing their business.

To be able to continue developing her business Lucero is applying for a loan of $925. She will use the loan to remodel her store, enlarging it in order to have more working space and better accommodate her products. She proposes to repay the loan in a period of 6 months. Contribute to the growth of this business. Lucero and her family sincerely appreciate whatever support you are able to offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Lucero es casada y tiene cuatro hijos de 3, 9, 11 y 16 años de edad. Hace dos años su esposo se quedó sin empleo y le fue muy difícil encontrar otro trabajo, para poder cubrir sus deudas y obtener lo necesario para su familia Lucero y su esposo decidieron iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, poco a poco han ido surtiendo mejor el negocio e incrementando la variedad de productos que ofrecen, y han hecho crecer su negocio.

Para poder continuar con el desarrollo de su negocio ahora Lucero está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación de su tienda, ampliando el lugar para tener una mayor espacio y acomodar mejor sus productos, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye la crecimiento de este negocio, Lucero y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: Remodel her grocery store

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia has been running her beauty salon for 2 years. Before becoming involved in this type of work, she was a seamstress who knitted bags and purses. After finding a job as an assistant in a beauty salon, she stopped her work as a seamstress. Today she runs her own beauty salon, which she took over from a sister-in-law who moved to the US. The business is a supplementary source of income in her household of 2 children. Her husband is a taxi driver.

She received a loan several months ago which she used to buy a manicurist's table and a foot massager for pedicures. These tools helped her provide improved services to the clients. She also began selling cosmetics and other products. She will use a second loan to buy a glass case to display these products to her clients.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and other complimentary products for her store, as well as a glass display case for her products

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina first took out a microfinance loan a year ago when she began selling fruit and chocolate out of her home. The wife of a gold miner and mother of five children, her customers were her neighbors and miners on their way to work. Being based in her house is also helpful because at the age of 57, it is becoming more difficult for Marcelina to travel, and she would be able to save money by working from home.

Since her home is in a prime location near the mines she is requesting a $500 loan to open a store in her home and increase the quantity and types of food she sells. Several of her adult children continue to live with her and work as bricklayers or help her out with her business.

She hopes to save some of the money from this business for her grandchildren’s education. One of her greatest regrets is not being able to afford education for all of her children. Hopefully, as a result of her plans to open a store, her grandchildren will have some opportunities that their parents and grandparents never had.

loans.use: Open a store to sell food out of her home.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison has a workshop where he makes beds and bedroom furniture. He has been in this type of business for about ten years. He learned the ins and outs of the trade when he was an assistant for his uncle. While he was an assistant, he saved up enough money to buy second-hand machinery. His business now consists of making the beds and frames for most furniture. He sends his product to a furniture retailer who adds the color and finishing touches to his product. He makes about 12 complete bedroom sets a month with the help of his 4 employees.

Edison needs the loan because he wants to invest in wood. He received a loan several months ago, before the rainy season, that he also used to buy wood. It helped because the in the months following his loan, wood became much more expensive. Although the prices of wood are back to normal, it is still beneficial to buy in bulk. He also hopes to invest in other necessary materials such as nails and glue.

Edison is 28 years old and he is single. He lives right next to his mother in a home made out of bamboo-like wood. His goal is to improve his mother’s home and to continue improving his business.

loans.use: Buy wood and other materials

loans.name: Catalina Amparo

texts.en:
Catalina is a 41 year old, single mother of two. She has two sons: one has just started his college career at La Universidad Andina and he younger is attending high school at La Escuela Militar. A few years ago, Catalina was married and had a business with her husband. The business failed and they went bankrupt. Catalina’s husband left her and her two sons for a younger woman. Before coming to PRISMA, she would have described herself as depressed and agitated at life. She is now much more relaxed and happy. She currently has three jobs and is also attending school.

She has been working with Unique, a cosmetics and jewelry mail order company, for seven years now. Unique incentivizes sales by offering gifts for every goal the seller achieves. Catalina is such a good saleswoman that she is now receiving doubles of gifts. She largely purchases according to her orders, but will occasionally buy in bulk when there are special offers. She averages around 400 orders a month. Catalina has also been working with Herbalife selling protein shakes and other products. She has been with them for four months now and prefers their incentives which are often cash bonuses. She has also been working part-time at a local NGO as a secretary. Catalina hopes that with the $650 loan she will be able to purchase more goods at a lower cost and be able to sell in much larger quantities. By dealing in bulk Catalina has a chance to reach up to 75% commission as opposed to the current 25%.

loans.use: Purchase products in larger quantities to receive greater commission.

loans.name: Catalina Amparo

texts.en:
Catalina is a 41 year old, single mother of two. She has two sons: one has just started his college career at La Universidad Andina and the younger is attending high school at La Escuela Militar. A few years ago, Catalina was married and had a business with her husband. The business failed and they went bankrupt. Catalina’s husband left her and her two sons for a younger woman. Before coming to PRISMA, she would have described herself as depressed and anxious. She is now much more relaxed and happy. She currently has three jobs and is also attending school.

She has been working with Unique, a cosmetics and jewelry mail order company, for seven years now. Unique incentivizes sales by offering gifts for every goal the seller achieves. Catalina is such a good saleswoman that she is now receiving doubles of gifts. She largely purchases according to her orders, but will occasionally buy in bulk when there are special offers. She averages around 400 orders a month. Catalina has also been working with Herbalife selling protein shakes and other products. She has been with them for four months now and prefers their incentives which are often cash bonuses. She has also been working part-time at a local NGO as a secretary. Catalina hopes that with the $650 loan she will be able to purchase more goods at a lower cost and be able to sell in much larger quantities. By dealing in bulk Catalina has a chance to reach up to 75% commission as opposed to the current 25%.

loans.use: Purchase products in larger quantities to receive greater commission.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue diversifying her product line

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is a 38 year-old single mother of three. Lucila started her woodshop business in partnership with others who owned a circular saw for two years. She then moved on and began her own business with the help of her children. She currently produces and sells beds, chests, cabinets, chairs and other wooden products. She sells her products all throughout the Puno region including Ayaviri, Azangaro, Puno, and Ilave. She travels once a week to each region and often sells her products on credit. She often works from 7:00am untill12:00 midnight. She’s been working in the wood business for the past nine years. She hopes to be able to increase her raw materials, wood, in order to produce in greater quantities.

loans.use: Purchase more wood to increase number of furniture produced.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a mother to three young children, 9, 6 and 4 years old. She currently sews and sells skirts and other traditional dance attire with the help of her husband. Her husband makes the cuts and Delia sews the pieces together. To diversify her business, Delia also buys and sells traditional colorful parade skirts, polleras, from Bolivia.

She does not have a set location where she sells her products. On Mondays, she sells near the Santa Juana cafeteria. On Saturdays she sells in the Plaza Cerro Colorado and on Sundays she sells along Av. Normal. During the week she sews about 15-20 skirts and 15 centerpieces with the two sewing machines she owns. She hopes that with a loan of $325 she will be able to purchase more sewing machines and materials to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase more sewing machines to increase production of skirts.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Thirty-two year old Belinda is a single mother living and working in Juliaca. Her daughter, Cinthya, is 13 and entering her second year of high school. She currently sells juices and chicken sandwiches from a cart in the Plaza de San Juan. Her juices are made of all sorts of fruits and vegetables. The big seller is called the Jugo Especial, which consists of milk, dark beer, egg, aloe, and a great variety of vegetables. Very Tasty!

She works seven days a week from 6:00 am to 3:00pm during the summer and from 8:00am during the winter. Mondays, which are the busiest days at the plaza, Belinda works from 4:00am until 7:00pm. She currently has four blenders and two juice extractors. She hopes that with her $425 loan she will be able to expand her business to a small snack and juice bar in the mercado.

loans.use: Expand juice business to a full snack bar at the mercado

loans.name: Luzmelia

texts.en:
Luzmelia is a Juliacan single mother. Her daughter, thirteen year old Kattia Lucero, is currently attending high school. Up until recently Luzmelia would sell food on the streets around the Plaza San Jose, some of the busiest streets in Juliaca. Luzmelia worked from 6:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the evening. As her sales continued to increase she opened her own restaurant “Restaurante Lucero”, naming it after her daughter who she considers the most important person in her life.

She currently does not prepare food at night because she does not have enough personnel. She plans to use the $500 loan towards renovating of a few tables and purchasing more silverware to be able to meet her increased demand. She hopes that with time and a lot of hard work, she will be able to open other locations in which she can continue to sell food. Her dream is to one day own her own restaurant chain not only in Juliaca, but also in cities like Puno that are fairly close.

loans.use: Expand restaurant capabilities by purchasing more silverware and repairing tables.

loans.name: Mario Jesus

texts.es:
The work on my house never ends. I need to build a concrete roof to be able to use a new room because my family needs more space and the house is really small. I am asking for a loan of $1000 to build a concrete roof.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar, me hace falta poner el techo de concreto para poder habitar el cuarto ya que a mi familia le hace falta más espacio debido a que la casa es muy pequeña ”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción del techo de concreto

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: Pabla

texts.en: Pabla L. Q. is a 41 year-old single mother of two. She currently has a business where she sells foreign clothing, primarily American clothing. She sells both new and used clothing. She purchases her clothing in bulk and sells at the mercado San Jose. She has been selling clothing for ten years now. Pabla usually works twelve hours a day, every day of the week. With a $275 loan, she would like to diversify her products as well as increase her quantities in order to be able to improve the daily lives of her family.

loans.use: Diversify and increase clothing selection.

loans.name: Nelly Gladys

texts.en: Nelly is a 31 year-old mother of two, Jhon Jesus, 11, and Thalia Daysi, 8. Nelly currently has a grocery store and a snack cart. She has had her business for five years now. She sells caramels and other snacks from her cart throughout the city's many plazas from 5:00am to 3:00pm. After that she tends to her bodega until about midnight. Nelly hopes that with a $250 loan she will be able to purchase in bulk and increase her profits per product.

loans.use: Purchase goods in bulk and increase her profits per product.

loans.name: Leticia Mayela

texts.es:
I need to buy 2 air conditioning units because the heat is unbearable and it is worse when we are sleeping because of the mosquitoes. I would like my children to be able to sleep calmly and comfortably. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to by two air conditioning units.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de comprar 2 aparatos de aire debido a que el calor es insoportable y en las noches se siente más a la hora de dormir por los moscos, me gustaría que mis hijos duerman tranquilos y cómodos”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar 2 aparatos de aire

loans.use: To purchase two air conditioning units
