loans.name: Angela Gabriela

texts.en:
Angela is a 43 year-old mother of three. She has two boys Jhohan and Harold and a 6 year-old daughter, Marycruz. She rents a post in a very busy part of town where she has set up a repair shop for bicycles and tricycles, which are some of the most used means of transportation amongst the city's population. She employs her two sons and a nephew who have helped her out for several years. Even though she sometimes does minor tasks such as fixing chains or a flat tire, she spends most of her time administering her business and selling spare parts.

With her $275 loan, Angela will be able to purchase more spare parts which she can sell at her shop. In the future she hopes to save enough money and have enough capital to change businesses to some other commercial activity because her current business is quite wearing on her physically. She is also sure that sometime in the future her sons will move on to their own businesses leaving her without knowledgeable repairers.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of spare parts.

loans.name: Dominga Fausta

texts.en:
Dominga is a 44 year-old mother with three boys. The two younger boys are still in school and the eldest recently got a job as a graphic designer with a local company. She has lived most of her life in the countrysiD. and can to live to Juliaca about 15 years ago. Having lived significant parts of her life in both rural and urban areas, she believes that it is very important that all the members of the family support the home economically.

She has a small bodega where she sells woven goods and other artisans goods the majority of her business is to wholesalers. She plans to use her $175 loan to increase her sales at her bodega buy purchasing a greater variety of goods. She hopes that with in addition to her husband’s income as a tricycle taxi she will be able to afford a good education for her other two sons. She hopes that they will go to the university and be professionals.

loans.use: Increase variety of goods at her bodega.

loans.name: Jany Marilin

texts.en: Jany studied to be an obstetrician but before finishing her degree she realized that that would not be the job for her and found a job selling tickets for an airline, AeroContinente.  When AeroContinente folded she got a job at a local travel agency which she loved because she got to meet new and interesting people daily. However, the travel agency often did not pay her on time and nine years ago she decided to quit and open her own travel agency with her sister. They have since incorporated another owner and are very successful, in large part because of Jany´s love for the business and her experience and connections within the industry. She and her partners would like to expand in two manners- they want to purchase another computer to be able to serve more clients at once (they currently only have one computer) and they also eventually want to open another branch of their office, this time in Cusco, the tourist hub of Peru and only 6 hours by bus from Juliaca.

loans.use: Expand travel agency business.

loans.name: Delia Ana

texts.en: Deila, a young Juliaqueña, sells artesania she makes in order to support herself. She began as a little girl in her mothers store and from there learned various crafts including weaving. Now she has her own store in which she sells mainly woven goods but also a variety of other hand-crafted artesania. She hopes to save enough money within the next two years to enter the University of the Andes in Juliaca, where she wants to study accounting so that she can eventually work in a bank such as PRISMA helping other women who need microlaons. She is asking for a loan of $275 to buy a different type of loom to weave new types of material on. This would help her reach her goal of entering the university within two years.

loans.use: To purchase a new loom.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan T. is 37 years old, mother of 3 children, and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, T. sells a kind of dessert to the people in her community, while her husband works as a farmer. Together they make on average around $6 per day in income. This loan will be used to purchase a plot of land to grow more crops; the remainder will go to buy to buy tools and some utensils for her store.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to grow more crops; the remainder of the money is to buy tools and utensils for her store.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim K. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and her two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia
Mrs. K. is a laborer, while her husband works as a construction foreman. Together they earn approximately $6 each day. This loan  will be used to purchase a motorcycle for her husband because it would be better for him not to spend so much each day on public transport.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to to use go to work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang K. is 45 years old, mother of 4 children, and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To help in financing her household, Neang K. works collecting palm or coconut leaves, makes them into roofing and sells them to retailers. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Two of her children work at construction, and the other two are enrolled in school. Neang and her family members can make approximately $7 each day.

This loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle for Neang's husband to use to operate a business ( motor-taxi).

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to operate a motor-taxi

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Your Kiva loan has been paid back early.

Thanks to your support of entrepreneurs like Neang Kak, small businesses around the world have access to low-interest loans that help their business.

We hope you will continue loaning through Kiva and CREDIT MFI.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang
Kiva Fellow,
Cambodia

loans.name: Chien

texts.en: Mrs. Chien is 47 years old and her husband is 9 years older. They have 3 children who are laborers and are between 16 and 29 years old. She catches fish daily on a small canal. She can’t expand her activity as she doesn't have a boat. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to purchase a small boat. At the moment, their family income is $7 per person/month. Mrs. Chien will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To purchase a small boat in order to catch fish in a canal

loans.name: Not

texts.en: Mrs. Not S. is 31 years old, mother of 3 children, and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a simple store at home selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area, and she can make about $4 each day. Her husband works as a recycler and a farmer; his income is a potential help in financing his household's needs. Mrs. Not S. has recently requested a loan to purchase more recyclable products for her husband’s inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more recyclable products

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Mrs. Nam was born in 1974. Her husband, a motor taxi driver, was born in 1971. 
They have 2 children aged 9 and 13. Everyday in the morning, she sells fish at the local market. Their income is $12 per person/month. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to purchase equipment and fish. Mrs. Nam will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To sell fish

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng H. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a market vendor selling Prahouk ( a kind of fermented fish, whose flavor is very popular with Cambodians), while her husband works in a farm planting crops and raising pigs. Together, they generally make up to $7 each day. This loan will be used to purchase more Prahouk for her inventory; any remainder of the money will be used to buy pigs and feed to supplement their livestock raising micro-business.

loans.use: To purchase more Prahouk (fermented fish), pigs, and feed for her livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun S. is 51 years old, mother of five children, and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is employed in a garment factory, while her husband is a farmer planting rice and various kinds of vegetables. Together, they earn approximately $6 each day. Mrs. Sun S. has currently requested a loan to purchase a motorcycle, so that it can be used to reduce expenses for her family's transportation. This is a picture of two of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to facilitate her family's transportation

loans.name: But

texts.en: Mrs. But S. V. is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 2 preschool-aged children in PreyVeng province, Cambodia. She runs a small grocery store at home generating around $2 each day, while her husband makes approximately $3 per day working as a motor-taxi driver. This couple would like to repair their house and they are requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to help them make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair their house which normally leaks during rainy season.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mudassir

texts.ru:
Mudassir used to sell women’s shawls and other small products. As her business expanded she transitioned to selling women’s fabrics. She selects her fabric inventory based on the coming season. Right now she sells light summer fabrics. She is single and lives with her parents. The profits from her business go to family expenditures. Mudassir is very hardworking and carefully attends all markets that occur everyday in different villages. Therefore, everyday is a workday for her. Once a week she travels to the wholesale market, 170 km away from her home, to purchase goods.

Mudassir has been working with MicroInvest for 1.5 years. During this time she has received several loans and carefully repaid them. She will use this loan to purchase a new selection of fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мудассир раньше продавала женские платки и разные мелкие товары. С развитием бизнеса она постепенно перешла на торговлю женскими тканями. Ассортимент тканей она подбирает по наступающему сезону. Сейчас она продает легкие летние ткани. Она незамужем и живет со своими родителями. Прибыль от торговли идет на семейные расходы. Мудассир очень трудолюбива и старательно посещает все базары, которые проходят каждый день по разным деревням. Таким образом каждый день для нее является рабочим. Раз в неделю она ездит за товаром на оптовый рынок в 170 км. от ее дома. С Микроинвест Мудассир сотрудничает уже 1,5 года. За это время она несколько раз получала займы и старательно погашала. Сейчас она планирует получить новый займ для закупки нового ассортимента тканей.

loans.use: For purchase of new assortment of fabrics

loans.name: Ashurhon

texts.ru:
Ashurhon purchases and sells dried fruits in the markets of Isfara. She is an assertive and happy woman. She has a big family, her husband is in Russia earning money and her children help her with managing the household.

Ashurhon purchases dried fruits at local markets and in Kyrgyzstan. Sometimes she purchases dried apricots of low quality and then brings them home, sorts them by quality level and takes them out to sell. Her children help her with this. Ashurhon has been a MicroInvest client for 1.5 years. During this time her business has expanded noticeably and she has purchased a color television and DVD player for her home. She would like to use this loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ашурхон занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов на базарах Исфары. По характеру она бойкая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ее семья большая, муж находится в России на заработках, а ее дети помогают матери по хозяйству. Ашурхон покупает сухофрукты как на местных рынках, так и в соседнем Кыргызстане. Иногда она покупает сушеный абрикос низкого качества и тогда, привезя его домой, она перебирает его и, разделив по сортам выносит продавать. Таким образом, ее дети помогают ей. В Микроинвест Ашурхон кредитуется в течении 1,5 лет. За это время она заметно расширила свой бизнес, купила для дома цветной телевизор и DVD проигрыватель. Сейчас она собирается получить займ для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Sale and purchase of dried fruits

loans.name: Sakinahon

texts.ru:
Sakinahon sells chocolate and caramel candies. Her place of business is located in the central market of Isfara. Candy sales are going well and bring steady profits. Sakinahon is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is in Russia and sends money to support the family. Profits from sales supplement Sakinahon’s family budget.

Sakinahon’s workday starts early in the morning and continues through late evening. She works without weekends. Early on her business was small and fit on a small counter. Now her business has grown and takes up a large counter. Half a year ago Sakinahon got a loan from MLF MicroInvest and increased her selection of caramels. Now Sakinahon would like to get a new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Ассортимент товаров Сакины составляют конфеты – шоколадные и карамели. Ее торговое место расположено на центральном рынке города Исфары. Торговля конфетами идет хорошо и приносит стабильную прибыль. Сакина замужем, ей 39 лет и у нее трое детей. Муж находится в России и присылает денег для содержания семьи. Прибыль от торговли дополняет семейный бюджет Сакины. Ее рабочий день начинается рано утром и продолжается до позднего вечера, и работает она без выходных. Раньше ее бизнес был маленьким и помещался на маленьком прилавке. Сейчас бизнес развился и занимает большой прилавок. Полгода назад Сакина получила займ в Микроинвест и увеличила ассортимент карамелей. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ.

loans.use: For the further expansion of business

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru:
In Ahliddin’s region there are a lot of apricot trees. The residents of the region dry apricots every year in July and August and then send them to Russia for sales. Apricots are separated from their pits and spread out under the sun, creating dried apricots “kuraga” known locally as “kaisa.” The pits are sold separately. They are split and create another product called “magz,” which you can see in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

A large number of people are involved in the processing of apricots and pits and Ahliddin’s family is also involved. Last year Ahliddin took a loan from MLF MicroInvest for the processing of apricots. The resulting profits allowed Ahliddin’s family to make several family expenditures. Ahliddin got his next loan for the purchase of dried apricots. Today, Ahliddin wants to get another loan for the purchase and storage of apricots. В регионе где проживает Ахлиддин очень много абрикосовых деревьев. Население региона каждый год в июле и августе месяце сушит абрикосы, которые затем отправляются в Россию на продажу. Абрикосы отделяются от косточек apricots are separated from clingstone and spread under the sun, и таким образом, получается готовый продукт «курага» или по местному «кайса», а косточки продаются отдельно. Далее косточки раскалываются и получается еще один продукт называемый «магз». На фото Вы видите «магз». В процесс переработки абрикосов и косточек от них вовлечено огромное количество людей и семья Ахлиддина занимается этим тоже. В прошлом году Ахлиддин взял займ в Микроинвест на переработку абрикосов. Полученная прибыль позволила семье Ахлиддина совершить много семейных расходов. Следующий займ Ахлиддин получил на куплю продажу готовых сушеных абрикосов. Сейчас Ахлиддин хочет получить очередной займ на покупку и хранение сушеных абрикосов.

loans.use: Purchase and storage of dried fruits

loans.name: Abdumubin

texts.ru:
Abdumubin is a young man who never feels down and always looks to the future. When he was little and in school he took his father’s bulls and cows out to pasture. Huge bulls and cows listened to the little boy. While the herd grazed Abdumubin did his homework and read books. In the evening he brought the herd home. That is why he developed a love of animals from childhood. According to his father, since childhood Abdumubin wanted to build a farm that fed livestock. He is also a butcher.

Today, Abdumubin has his own family – a wife and 3 children. The youngest is not yet one. Abdumubin lives with his family in his parents’ home, since he is the youngest child in the family. The dream of his childhood – the feeding of livestock has become his sole source of income. Sometimes he earns extra income by working as a taxi driver using his old car. During this time his wife and father look after the livestock at home. To expand his livestock Abdumubin turned to MLF MicroInvest and after getting a loan of $950 purchased four small bulls. The loan assisted him in earning extra profits. Abdumubin keeps all records of the business – revenues, cost and profits – in a special notebook. Profits from feeding livestock are good right now, because upkeep is cheaper in the summer. Abdumubin will use the new loan to continue his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Абдумубин молодой человек, никогда не унывающий, стремящийся только вперед. Еще маленьким когда он учился в школе он выводил пастись на поле коров и быков своего отца. Огромные быки и коровы слушались маленького мальчика Пока стадо паслось он готовил домашние задание школы и читал книжки. Вечером гнал стадо домой. Поэтому любовь к домашним животным была у Абдумубина с детства. По словам его отца он с детства мечтал построить ферму по откорму крупного рогатого скота. Также у него есть профессия мясничества. Сейчас у Абдумубина своя семья – жена и трое детей. Маленькому сыну нету еще и года. Живет со своей семьей в родительском доме, так он младший сын в семье. Мечта его детства – откорм скота стало для Абдумубина единственным источником семейного дохода. Еще иногда он подрабатывает таксистом на своем стареньком автомобиле. В это время его жена и отец ухаживают за скотом дома. Для увеличения количества скота Абдумубин обратился в Микроинвест и получив займ в размере $950 купил четырех маленьких бычков. Полученный займ способствовал получению дополнительной прибыли. Все записи по бизнесу – приход, расходы и прибыль ведет в особой тетради. Прибыль от откорма скота сейчас хорошая, так как его содержание обходится дешевле в летнее время. Абдумубин хочет получить новый займ, чтобы продолжить свою деятельность.

loans.use: for the further expansion of business

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat has been in business for a relatively short period of time, 2 years. She needed to start trading in the market because she did not have a permanent job or source of income. Muhabbat is 39 years old and married, her husband is in Russia earning money.

Muhabbat sells children’s clothing, her business is small but earns a profit. She travels to wholesale markets herself to purchase inventory. She recently got a loan from MLF MicroInvest and used it to expand her product line. Muhabbat plans to use the new loan to purchase school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Мухаббат начала заниматься бизнесом сравнительно недавно. Ее стаж всего 2 года. Выйти на базар торговать она была вынуждена, так как постоянной работы и источника дохода для нее не было. Мухаббат 39 лет, она замужем, ее муж находится в России на заработках. Она продает детские вещи, бизнес небольшой, но позволяет получить прибыль. За товаром она ездит сама на оптовые рынки. В Микроинвест она получила займ недавно и потратила его на расширение ассортимента. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ и планирует закупить школьную форму.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms for sale

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say K. is 26 years old, mother of two school-aged children, and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To help support her family, Say K. sells soft drinks and coconuts near Angkor Wat temple where many tourists pass by. Her husband is employed as a security guard near the temple. Say and her husband can typically make on average about $3 each day. This loan will be used to increase Say's inventory so that she can meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her inventory

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Say Kung start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chorn S. is 27 years old and is a street-vendor, selling men's and women's clothes near Ta Prum temple, where many tourists and local people pass by. With this business activity, Chorn S. can typically make up to $10 each day, while her husband works for a tourist company and earns around $6 a day. Chorn S. has recently requested a loan that will allow her to increase her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to satisfy her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her inventory to meet her clients' demands

loans.name: Saidahon

texts.ru:
Hakima has an unusual profession for her age – she embroiders with gold thread. People call her profession “gold seamstress.” The process of sewing is difficult and requires special effort. Hakima learned this skill as soon as she finished school by becoming an apprentice to one of the masters of the neighborhood. Her persistant character helped Hakima to quickly learn the profession and she can now embroider complicated patterns independently. She makes women’s cardigans, national Tajik hats, pillows, etc. Demand for her goods is very strong and she earns good profits.

A year ago, after having learned about MLF MicroInvest, Hakima came with her mother and after studying the loan terms decided to take a loan to expand her business. She used the loan to get supplies. Since then she has regularly taken loans and has expanded her business substantially. Recently, she bough an extra sewing machine and grew her production of finished goods. She would like to use the new loan to get additional supplies.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Хакима занимается необычным для ее возраста делом - она вышивает золотыми нитями. В народе ее профессия так и называется «золотошвея». Процесс шитья сложный и требует особого старания. Хакима научилась этому сразу же после окончания школы поступив в ученики к одной из мастериц района. Хваткий характер позволил Хакиме быстро научится этой профессии и сейчас она самостоятельно вышивает сложные узоры. Наименование изделий несколько – женские кофты, национальные таджикские тюбетейки, подушки и т.д. Спрос на ее изделия очень хороший и Хакима получает от этого занятия хорошую прибыль. Год назад узнав о Микроинвест она пришла вместе с матерью и изучив условия кредитования решила взять займ на расширение своего бизнеса. Займ она потратила на приобретение сырья для своих изделий. С тех пор регулярно получая займы она значительно расширила свой бизнес. Недавно она купила дополнительную швейную машинку и выход готовых изделий возрос намного. Новый займ она опять хочет потратить на приобретение сырья.

loans.use: for the further expansion of business

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Mrs. Phuong is 52 years old and her husband is 2 years older. They have 3 children, aged 19, 23, and 26, who stopped going to school to make money. They have no land apart from their house and the food shop. Mrs. Phuong has a breakfast shop. The income from the breakfast shop and from the children is $7 per person/month. Now she hopes to receive a loan of $75 to run her shop. She will repay the loan on a monthL. basis.

loans.use: To run a breakfast shop

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong S. (on the left with the blue shirt) is 26 years old  and sells mangos to the people in her community. She can generate about $2 per day in profit, while her husband makes on average around $3.30 a day by plowing other people's rice paddies, using his own tractor. This loan will be used to repair their house in order to keep it from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair their house which often leaks during the rainy season.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Hong Srey start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Sing

texts.en: Mrs. Sing K. S. is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 3 school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work in construction and can typically make up to $8 each day. In order to have additional income, Sing is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase rubber trees from someone’s plantation and resell them at a profit.

loans.use: to purchase rubber trees from a plantation and resell them at a profit

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana M. has been engaged in business for over 3 years. She is the mother of a beautiful girl. Her husband is in Russia. He is there as a worker and sends money for Svetlana. But it is not enough for today's living conditions, and Svetlana wants to earn money for her family, too.

Svetlana decided to buy seeds from the wholesale market and sell them at a bus-stop last year. She rented a little place near the soft-drink stall. Svetlana’s three brothers are in Russia, too, so Svetlana lives with her mother now. Her mother helps her to sell seeds. .

Svetlana became a client of MicroInvest in February 2007. Her first loan was about US$ 100. She used it to expand her inventory. Gradually she included several kinds of chewing gum and candies like Chupa-Chups to her business. She noticed that such products are in high demand at the bus-stop where she has her stall.

Now Svetlana wants to purchase 40 kg of seeds, five boxes of chewing gum, and three boxes of Chupa-Chups for the month of August. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to be repaid over a period of 6 months.

P.S The lady in the photo is Svetlana’s mother.

loans.use: Purchase 40 kg of seeds, five boxes of chewing gum, and three boxes of Chupa-Chups

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Ramona Aguillera D. G. loves in the "Centro" neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa. She is 53 years old and married to Mr. Leoncio G.. They have 5 children, of which two are teachers who help their parents with the household expenses. Her husband is a bricklayer (housing construction), and he too helps out in the restaurant. At this moment, only one of her children lives at home, the rest have formed their own families and lives on themselves.

After getting married, many years ago, Ramona moved from a small village to the city to look for better job opportunities. In the beginning, life was difficult, but when time passed, the young couple was able to save some money and buy some land to build their own house, where they currently live.

In order to increase their income, they started selling "panchos" (hot dogs) and soft drinks on the sidewalk of their home. Later, with the profits, they were able to build a small booth and nowadays they have a well equipped restaurant where more than 20 persons come to eat every day.

Ramona tells us proudly that everything they have achieved, they have done honestly. She wants to continue expanding her business, and therefore she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to sell, like soft drinks, juices, candies, and beer, as this is what is most in demand by her customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La Sra Ramona A. D. G. resiD. en el barrio Centro D. la ciudad D. Villa Elisa, la misma tiene 53 años está casada con el sr Leoncio G. tienen 5 hijos D. los cuales 2 son docentes y ayudan a sus padres con los gastos D. la casa; su esposo se dedica a la albañilería (construcción D. casas) y también ayuda en el comedor con su apoyo. Actualmente sólo uno D. sus hijos vive con ella, ya que todos han formado sus familias y tienen ya sus casas propias.

Varios años atrás y luego D. casarse, Ramona, emigro D. un pueblo pequeño hasta la ciudad, en busca D. mejores oportunidades laborales. En el principio fue difícil, pero con el correr del tiempo la joven pareja pudo ahorrar y comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa, donD. viven actualmente.

Para poder aumentar los ingresos, ellos empezaron a vender panchos (hot dogs) y gaseosas en la vereda D. su casa, luego con las ganancias pudieron montar una casilla y hoy día ya tienen un comedor bien equipado donD. dan D. comer a mas D. 20 personas por día.

Ramona cuenta orgullosa que todo lo que lograron hasta ahora lo hicieron D. forma honesta. Ella desea seguir expandiendo su negocio, por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar más mercaderías para la venta, como gaseosas, jugos, golosinas y cerveza, pues estas son las D. mayor demanda por los clientes.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, juices, candies, and beer.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristina S. lives in the Las Mercedes neighborhood in the city of Luque. She is 63 years old, and has been a widow for 9 years. She has 5 children: a 33 years old daughter, and four sons of respectively 43, 40, 30, and 27 years old. Of them, only the youngest lives with her. The rest are already married and have families of their own.

Mrs. Cristina has had a flower stand in front of the East Cemetery since 1973. She sell all kinds of natural flowers, like roses, daisies, lilacs, etc., but also candelabras, crosses made of fabric, and candles.

Cristina has her own nursery at home, where she grows different flowering plants which is principally run by her oldest son. She wants to grow larger quantities of flowers, and for this she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds of different types of flowers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La Sra. Cristina S. reside en el Barrio las Mercedes de la ciudad de Luque, la misma tiene 63 años es viuda hace 9 años, tiene 5 hijos, una de mujer de 33 años y cuatro varones de 43, 40, 30 y 27 años respectivamente. De los cuales solamente el menor vive con ella ya que los demás están casados y tienen sus familias ya formadas.

La Sra. Cristina tiene un puesto de ventas de flores frente al Cementerio del Este desde el año 1973 , donde vende toda clases de flores naturales como rosas, margaritas, lilas, etc.; así como también candelabros , cruces de tela y velas.

Cristina posee su propia huerta en su casa, donde planta distintas variedades de flores que es atendido principalmente por su hijo mayor. Ella desea seguir produciendo estas flores en mayor cantidad, por lo que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de semillas de flores de distintas variedades.

loans.use: purchase of varied flower seeds

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
We have very little left to buy for our house. We only need to buy gratings and a door for our house because my husband works all day and I stay home alone with my son and we need them for our safety. We are asking for a loan of $700.00 to install these safety measures.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tenemos poco que adquirimos la vivienda. Solo que nos esta haciendo falta las protecciones ya que todo el día trabajo mi esposo y nos quedamos solos el niño y yo, por seguridad necesitamos poner las rejas y portón a la casa. Solicitamos un préstamo de $ 700.00 Dlls. Para la colocación de protecciones.

loans.use: Safety measures

loans.name: Lidia Concepción

texts.es:
Lidia L. is single and lives with her parents. She is a pharmacist and helps her parents with the income and expenses of the household.

Lidia worked for 3 years in one of the well-known pharmacy chains in the city. With the experience she gained and with her knowledge of the working of the most important products, she decided to become independent and open her own pharmacy.

The name of her pharmacy is "Poha Renda" (which means "Medicine Place" in Guaraní, one of the two official languages in Paraguay). It is located in one of the main streets of the city. She decided to open her business there because there are no other pharmacies in the neighborhood and it is close to the local health clinic.

Her initial loan from Fundación Paraguaya was invested in the purchase of medicines for her pharmacy. Her business grew little by little and now, she would like to request a new loan to invest in the purchase of cosmetics, perfumes, and body creams. This way she can continue to broaden her sales network and diversify her products.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original loan description in Spanish:

Lidia L. es soltera y vive con sus padres; ella es farmacéutica y ayuda a sus padres con los ingresos y gastos de la casa.

Lidia trabajó durante 3 años en una de las cadenas de farmacias importantes de la ciudad; Teniendo en cuenta su experiencia y su conocimiento sobre los principales productos y sus representantes decidió independizarse y abrir su propia farmacia.

El nombre de la farmacia es ''Poha Renda'' (que significa “Lugar de los remedios” en el idioma guaraní, uno de los dos idiomas oficiales de Paraguay) la misma está ubicada sobre una de las avenidas principales de la cuidad; comenta que decidió habilitar su local en esa zona porque no existen otras farmacias en la zona y se encuentra en las cercanías del Centro de Salud Local.

Sus primeros créditos obtenidos de la Fundación Paraguaya los invirtió en la compra de medicamentos para la venta en su farmacia, poco a poco fue expandiéndose y hoy día desea solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes y cremas corporales así de esta forma poder seguir ampliando su red de ventas y diversificar sus productos.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfumes, and body creams

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
We are asking for a loan to start building a room because we did not have much when we got married and we are still renting. Now we would like to have our own house. Since God quickly blessed us by making us parents, we want our son to have a safe place to live. We need a loan of $1,000.00 to build a room.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Estamos solicitando un préstamo para empezar a construir un cuarto tenemos poco que nos casamos y estamos pagando renta ,ya queremos tener nuestra propia casa. Ya que dios nos dio la bendición de pronto ser padres queremos que nuestro hijo tengo un lugar seguro donde vivir. Necesitamos la cantidad de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This is a test.

loans.name: Iliana Olivia

texts.es:
The work on my house never ends. I need to build a concrete roof to be able to use a new room because my family needs more space and the house is really small with only two bedrooms, a kitchen and a bathroom. I am asking for a loan of $1000 to build a concrete roof.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

“Mi construcción esta sin terminar, me hace falta poner el techo de concreto para poder habitar el cuarto ya que a mi familia le hace falta más espacio debido a que la casa es muy pequeña solo son 2 recamaras, la cocina y el baño ”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción del techo de concreto.

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma Martínez is finishing her house and she is asking for a loan of $1,000.00 to finish the exterior and to install doors and windows. "I am a single mother and I have three children. I am asking for a loan because I want to finish building my house so that I won't have to pay rent and so that my children will be safer because I work all day and they stay home alone."

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Irma Martínez esta terminando su casa ella esta solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para los acabados y colocación de puertas y ventanas. Soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijos. Estoy solicitando el préstamo porque quiero terminar ya mi casa para dejar de pagar renta y así estar más seguros mis hijos ya que yo trabajo todo el día y ellos se quedan solos.

loans.use: To finish the exterior of her house and to install doors and windows

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es:
I petitioned social security for a house and they granted me one but now I would like to install security measures to prevent people from robbing it and above for my family's safety. I am asking for a loan of $800.00 to install security measures in my house.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

“Solicite una casa de interés social y me la acaban de entregar solo que me gustaría poner protecciones para evitar que alguien pueda entrar a robar pero más que nada por la seguridad de mi familia” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para poner protecciones en mi vivienda.

loans.use: To install security measures

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M. D. I., 55, is married and a mother of three children. Her children are 33, 29, and 19. They are currently unemployed but used to work for the government. Angelina started her store four years ago when she moved to Itá from Asuncion. She used to have a kiosk in Asuncion where she sold empanadas and other food items.

Angelina and her husband work at their store located at their house every day from 7 am until 9 pm, but usually later in the summer. She also started selling hot plates of food at her store. She plans to purchase coal and pasta with the loan that she hopes to receive in order to increase her income. She will use the coal to cook her hot dishes.

Angelina is a member of a group of 20 women that practices group lending where members proviD. collateral through a group repayment pledge and the incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members will be responsible for making up the payment amount. She works together with her group in activities such as selling sobrecamas, a typical bedspread in Paraguay, and hosting San Juan Festivals in order to raise money.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal and pasta.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
I have run a grocery store for more than 15 years. This store is my family's source of income and my wife, one of our children and I work in it. We hope to expand our business and buy a refrigerator so that we can sell meat. We are asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to by a refrigerator.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 15 años en el negocio de venta de abarrotes. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposo y un hijo queremos agrandar mas el negocio y comprar un refrigerador para la venta de carne. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de un refrigerador.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola is 22 years old and is married with two children. Her husband works in the countryside harvesting sugar cane. Fabiola has a food stand or taqueria, together with Maria Hortensia Moreno Gonzalez. They operate this business every day in their local market, offering tacos, chicken and pork to their customers. She forms part of the group called San Isidro 1, along with Dorisela Guillen L., who sells fabrics, Esperanza Munoz Jaurez, who has a grocery shop, and Maria Hortensia Moreno Gonzalez, who runs the food stand with Fabiola. With this loan, they would like to grow their businesses, buying more fabric, more non perishable items for the grocery shop and be able to improve the the stand where they sell their tacos.

Fabiola tiene 22 años, casada, dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la cosecha de caña, Ella tiene una taqueria junto con doña María Hortensia Moreno González, este negocio se encuentra funcionando todos los días en el mercado de su localidad, en donde se ofrecen tacos de: pollo, res, puerco. Ella forma parte del grupo solidario llamado san Isidro 1 la integran: Dorisela Guillen López (venta de telas), Esperanza Muñoz Juárez (tienda de abarrotes), y doña Maria Hortensia Moreno González (taqueria en asociación con Fabiola López M.). Con el préstamo quieren hacer crecer sus negocios, comprando telas., alimentos no perecibles para la tienda de abarrotes y acondicionaran el lugar donde venden los tacos .

Translated by Kiva volunteer Emily Charnes

loans.use: food stall vendor

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is 28 years old, married with three children. Her husband works in the countryside harvesting sugar cane. Adela works selling such items as cold drinks, crackers, sugar, rice, and cooking oil, from her house. With this loan, she will be able to buy more inventory to sell. She is part of a group called San Isidro 2, together with Gregoria Gonzales Martinez, who sells refreshments/cold drinks, and Trinidad Velasco Garcia, who sells perfumes and cosmetics, and Sofia de los Angeles Gomes M., who raises lambs. With this loan, Gregoria and Trinidad will invest in greater quantities of inventory to improve their business, and Sofia will use her part of the loan to buy more animals to raise.

Adela tiene 28 años, casada, tres hijos, su esposo trabaja de campesino en la cosecha de la caña, Ella se dedica a la venta de : refrescos, galletas, azúcar, arroz, aceite de cocina, en su casa .Con el préstamo aumentara la compra de su mercancía para abastecer mejor su local. Forma parte del grupo llamado san Isidro 2, junto con: doña Gregoria González Martínez (venta de refrescos), Trinidad Velasco García (venta de perfumes y cosméticos), Sofía de los Ángeles Gomes M. (crianza de borregos) , las cuales con el prestamo Gregoria y Trinidad invertirán comprando mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer sus negocios y Sofía comprará con la parte su préstamo mas animales para la crianza.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Grocery store

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia M. D. S., 58 and her husband Cirilo S., 62, run a despensa (grocery store) at their home. Patrocinia, a retired professor, is a mother of two daughters, ages 26 and 19. The elder daughter is a professor and the other is a student, both of whom still live with her.

Patrocinia and her husband started the store over 7 years ago. Her husband wakes up at 5:30 in the morning to open the store every day and they work until 9 at night. They buy their merchandise from Mercado Itá, downtown Asuncion, and from vendors that pass by and sell to their store. They sell a variety of items at their store, such as notebooks, cleaning products, a huge selection of snacks, and bags.

Products that are sold most frequently are drinks and edible items. Usually, she sells more drinks in the summer when it is hotter than in the wintertime. Recently they introduced a new type of gummy candy to their store, which has been a huge favorite amongst the children in the neighborhood and is selling very quickly. Cirilo and Patrocinia are hoping to receive a loan in order to invest in their business, in particular to purchase a larger variety of products for their store. They would like to buy more of the gummy candy that all the children are demanding from their store.

loans.use: Purchase candy and drinks.

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es:
Laura is 25 years old, married with two children. Her husband works in the countryside, harvesting sugar cane. She raises pigs, and with the loan she would like to buy more animals, as well as more food for them as they grow, as well as medicine to avoid illnesses and diseases among the animals. She is part of the group called Tierra Nueva 2 (new land 2), together with Maria Rita Mendez Montoya, who has a grocery shop, and Dalia Montoya Solano, who sells clothing. They would like to invest their parts of the loan, one to buy more stock for the grocery store and the other, more clothing to grow her sales.

Laura tiene 25 años, casada, dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo (siembra de la caña). Ella se dedica a la crianza de puercos, con el préstamo quiere aumentar la compra de animales, también alimento para su crecimiento, medicamentos para evitar plagas y enfermedades entre los animales. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Tierra Nueva 2 junto con: doña Maria Rita Méndez Montoya (tienda de abarrotes), Dalia Montoya Solano (venta de ropa). Ellas invertirán la parte su préstamo comprando una de ellas mercadería para abastecer mejor su negocio y la otra ropa en mayor cantidad para aumentar sus ventas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Maria G. esta solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 para los acabados interior de su casa.

Estoy terminando ya mi casa nada mas que por problemas de salud no le he podido terminar ya que con el accidente que tuve me descapitalice económica mente así que decidimos pedir el préstamo para terminar ya la casa y así estar mas cómodos y mejor en la vivienda.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. Luz Maria Gomez is seeking a loan of $1200 to finish the interior of her house.

I cannot finish my house any more because of health problems. That is, the accident that I had has left me with little money, so we have decided to seek a loan to finish the house to be more comfortable.

loans.use: The interior finishings of the house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 27 years old, married with three children. Her husband works in the countryside harvesting sugar cane. Teresa works selling fruits and vegetables to the people of her community. She does not have a shop, but carries her produce around with her to sell around the town. With this loan, she will be able to install a place in her house from where she can sell her produce. She is part of the group called Tierra Nueva 2 (New Land 2), together with Zenaida Solano Molina, who raises pigs, and Maria Trinidad M. Solano, who has a grocery shop. They would like to increase their inventory with the loan, enabling them to increase their sales and earnings.

Teresa tiene 27 años, casada, tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la cosecha de la caña. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como vendedor ambulante entre los habitantes de su comunidad, con el préstamo quiere instalar un local en su casa. Forma parte del grupo llamado Tierra Nueva 2, junto con: doña Zenaida Solano Molina (crianza de puercos), María Trinidad M. Solano (tienda de abarrotes). Ellas quieren aumentar el abastecimiento de sus negocios con el préstamo y así aumentar las ventas y las ganancias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Sales of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
After many years of working with her mother, Diana R. Correa now works on her own after her mother retired. She has taken over her mother's job and has been working as a butcher for many years now. This business has always been a family business for over 45 years now. Diana is 23-years old and single and has a stand at Mercado Ita, a small market in the city of Ita, where she prepares meat to sell. She is a hard worker and works from Mondays to Saturdays from 6 am until 6 pm.

Everyday she purchases the meat from Itagua, a city nearby, and brings it to her stand where she prepares and separates the different cuts of meat. None of the meat goes to waste and every part can be sold to different clients for various purposes. For example, she sells horns that are used to make cups for terrere, a typical Paraguayan drink. Also, she sells parts that can be further processed to make carbon. On average, she has about 10 customers per day.

Diana is grateful for being able to receive such a stable business from her mother. She is searching for a loan in order to have more capital to use when she purchases meat every morning.

loans.use: Purchase meat.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
After working for another mechanic for 8 years, Francisco Banitez J. decided to start his own business three years ago in the hope of gaining more money. He is 37 years old, married, and a father of two sons. His elder son, who is 16 years old, helps him at his mechanic shop. His other son is 10 years old and is studying at school.

Francisco mainly works on fixing large trucks and pick-up trucks. He works from Mondays to Saturdays all day long, starting at 7 in the morning and usually working until late at night when he finishes his work for the day.

After opening his own shop, he has accumulated a large group of his own clients that always seek his services. With his previous loan, he was able to purchase machinery that cost $900 to elevate the trucks. He is very grateful for the loan he received previously because the machine he purchased has helped him a lot in minimizing manual labor. Now he is seeking a loan to purchase more parts for a truck that he is working on.

loans.use: Purchase parts for a truck.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is the leader of the group Communal Las Rosas Association and a member of Pro Mujer for 7 years. Ms Beatriz M. distributes meat and groceries to markets and fairs of the southern zone of the city of La Paz. Her specialty is in fine cuts, such as fillet and others of high price. Beatriz used her first loan with Pro Mujer in 1999 to increase her capital in order to be able to supply groceries, like sugar, flour, olive oil and other household goods. Currently, Ms M. asks for a loan to invest in capital to open a grocery store at her residence where she lives with her husband and her two school-aged children.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Es Jefa de Grupo de la Asociación Comunal Las Rosas, y socia de Pro Mujer hace 7 años, la señora Beatriz M., se encarga de distribuir carne de res y víveres a los mercados y friales de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, su especialidad son los cortes especiales como ser filete y otros de alto costo. Beatriz ingresa a Pro Mujer en el año de 1999 y con su primer desembolso logra incrementar su capital para poder abastecerse de víveres, como ser azúcar, harina, aceite y otros productos de la canasta familiar. En la actualidad, la señora M. precisa de capital para lograr la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes que se ubicaría en su domicilio, donde vive en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos, ambos en edad escolar.

loans.use: To invest in the opening of a grocery store at her residence

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda R. R., 45, is a mother of 5 children. One of her children is married and the other four still live with her and are also working. She started her store four years ago selling a variety of merchandise at her store that includes edible items, drinks, and household items. She also owns farm animals, in particular has five pigs and one cow. Currently she is not selling any of the milk from her cow, but plans to sell the milk in the future.

Before she started her store four years ago at her house, she used to sell products such as herbs in the streets. Now, when her children are not helping her at her store, they go out around the city selling herbs in the streets. With the loan that she receives from Fundacion Paraguaya, Hermelinda gives part of it to her children to invest in their own business. They use it as capital to purchase merchandise to sell on the streets.

Hermelinda uses the loan to purchase her merchandise from the markets in San Lorenzo, Itagúa, and Itá (different cities of Paraguay). She is in need of a loan in order to purchase more merchandise, such as beer and snacks, for her store and also to take care of her farm animals that she recently bought.

loans.use: Purchase beer, snacks, and to invest in her farm animals.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen S. Carrillo is a mother of two school-aged children. She is married and lives on Kollasuyo Avenue in the city of El Alto. Six years ago she started selling compact discs, movies, and music at the 16th of July fair. She is a member of Pro Mujer and a part of the Comunal Las Rosas Association. With her first loan, she purchased merchandise, like MP3 discs, that she sold at the city fairs. This allowed her to provide for her children, who were very young then, and to help her husband with the househould income. Currently, Carmen is the owner of 4 booths at the 16th of July fair where she sells DVD movies, MP3 music, etc. However, this business has a very short life span. This is why Carmen asks for a loan to invest capital in a new product and obtain a booth at the Huyustus market in the city of La Paz where she will sell computer accessories, recorders, as well as compact discs, disketes, and DVDs. This will allow her to forward her family, principally her two young children and herself, a very young and determined woman.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen S. Carrillo es madre de dos niños en edad escolar, casada, vive en la Av. Kollasuyo de la ciudad de El Alto. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de discos compactos, películas y música, en la Feria 16 de Julio de esa ciudad. Es socia de Pro Mujer, pertenece a la asociación Comunal Las Rosas, y con su primer desembolso logro la compra de mercadería consistente en discos de música MP3, con los cuales deambulaba por las Ferias de la ciudad, intentando dar sustento a sus niños, que en ese entonces eran muy pequeños, y el esposo carecía de fuente de trabajo. Actualmente Carmen es dueña de 4 puestos de venta en la Feria 16 de Julio, donde se dedica a la venta de películas en formato DVD, música MP3 y otros, pero es conciente que este negocio tiene poco tiempo de vida. A tal efecto, Carmen necesita de capital para poder cambiar de rubro, y lograr la compra de un puesto en el mercado Huyustus de la ciudad de La Paz, donde se dedicará a la venta de accesorios para computación, y soportes de grabación, como ser discos compactos, disketes, y DVD’s, de esta forma no quedarse sin fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia, principalmente a sus dos hijos que son muy pequeños y ella una mujer muy joven y decidida.

loans.use: To invest capital in a new booth and additional product

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Tengo ya mas de 5 años construyendo y solo me esta asiendo falta los acabados y ventanas. El problema es cuando llueve que el agua se mete por las ventanas. Como mi esposa y yo trabajamos todo el día la casa esta sola. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. para las protecciones y acabados de exterior de la casa.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

I have already done construction more than 5 years and I only need to do the exterior finishings and windows. The problem is that when it rains the water comes in through the windows. My wife and I work all day so the house is empty. We are seeking a loan of $1200 for shelter and to finish the exterior of the house.

loans.use: Finish the exterior, doors, and windows of the house

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena C. is a part of the Fe y Alegria Association of Pro Mujer. She is married with 5 children. She is a manufacturer of skirts (women's dresses), and sells them at the 16th of July and Tiawanacu fairs in the city of El Alto. She started helping her mother, from whom she learned this trade, at a young age. Seven years ago, she solicited her first loan, with which she increased her capital to start her own business. Currently, Filomena desires to open her own skirt stand in the Garita de Lima zone in the city of La Paz. This would help her improve her own way of life, especially since she currently lives with her 5 children and her husband in her grandfather's house.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomena C. pertenece a la Asociación Fe y Alegría de Pro Mujer, casada y con 5 hijos se dedica a la confección artesanal de polleras (vestidos de chola) y deambula por las ferias 16 de Julio y Tiawanacu de la ciudad de El Alto. Comenzó muy joven, ayudando a su madre, de quien aprendió todo el arte de la confección. Hace 7 años solicitó su primer crédito, con el cual incrementó su capital para iniciar ella su propio negocio. En la actualidad, Filomena quiere abrir su propia tienda de venta de polleras en la zona Garita de Lima de la ciudad de La Paz para de esta forma poder mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que en la actualidad ella vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposo en casa de su abuelo.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a stand/booth in the Garita de Lima zone in the city of La Paz

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Ms Primitiva A. de Tarqui (known by her friends as Ms Primi) has a vegetable stand in the Rodriguez Market in the city of La Paz. However, her principal business is the picking and selling of walnuts. She is one of the principal distributors of this product. A large range of important restaurants, sweetshops, and supermarkets of the city of La Paz purchase her product. Right now, Ms Primi is a member of Pro Mujer, and she asks for a loan to be able to strengthen her distribution of walnuts, including the export of this product. She already has necessary contacts to accomplish this. With this investment, she can further the life of her husband and her child.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Primitiva Álvarez de Tarqui (Doña Primi para sus amigos), tiene un puesto de verduras en el Mercado Rodríguez de la ciudad de La Paz, pero su principal negocio es la cosecha y venta de la nuez. Ella es una de las principales distribuidoras de este producto, ya que grandes cadenas de restaurantes, confiterías y supermercados muy importantes de la ciudad de La Paz compran este producto. En la actualidad Doña Primi, es socia de Pro Mujer, y precisa de una inversión de dinero para poder consolidar una distribuidora de nuez, e incluso incursionar a la exportación de este producto, puesto que ya cuenta con los contactos necesarios para este fin. De esta manera podrá salir adelante en compañía de su esposo y de su hija.

loans.use: To invest in the strengthening of her distribution of walnuts, including expanding the business to export

loans.name: Pasesa

texts.es:
Pasesa is married with three children. She produces cheeses, an art she learned from her mother who owns and raises 6 cattle. The cattle produce an average of 6 cheeses per day, four days a week. In charge of her own products, Pasesa goes door-to-door to her nieghbors of Ciudadela Ferroviaria, Chijini, and some zones of the city of El Alto. She asks for a loan to be able to install a stand dedicated to the sale of milk and its by-products in the city of El Alto. This would allow her to help her husband in providing for the household and the education of their children, as well as giving her own mother the life she deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada con un ayudante de albañil y madre de tres hijos, la señora Pasesa Gutiérrez Calle, se dedica a la elaboración de quesos; arte que aprendió de su madre, la que es propietaria de 6 crías de ganado vacuno, con los que producen un promedio de 6 quesos diarios, cuatro días a la semana. Cargada de sus productos, Pasesa, recorre a pie y puerta a puerta las casas de los vecinos de la Ciudadela Ferroviaria, Chijini, y algunas zonas de la ciudad de El Alto. A la fecha ella necesita de dinero para poder instalar una tienda dedicada a la venta de lácteos y sus derivados en la ciudad de El Alto, de esta forma colaborar a su marido para el sustento de su casa y la educación de sus niños y darle a su madre la vejez que ella merece.

loans.use: To invest in the installment of a stand dedicated to the sale of milk and its by-products

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara's first loan through Pro Mujer allowed her to stock up on some groceries for her door-to-door sales. Ms Genara S. has 13 years of experience in this field of work, which has allowed the business to prosper significantly. Currently, Genara is a mother of two children who attend the university and owns a well-located grocery store in the 16th of July zone in the city of El Alto. Genara intends to maintain this store, but she also wants to open another type of business. Her friends have told her that the import of auto parts and automobiles yields a great income. To accomplish this, Genara asks for a loan for capital to travel overseas and purchase the necessary merchandise. This will help her create a more diverse business and improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El primer crédito desembolsado por Pro Mujer, le permitió abastecer con algunos víveres su puesto de ventas ambulante. La señora Genara S. tiene una antigüedad de 13 años en la organización, lo que le permitió prosperar de manera significativa. En la actualidad Genara es madre de dos hijos universitarios, y dueña de un almacén de abarrotes muy bien surtido en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. La intención de Genara es mantener su almacén, pero incursionar en otro tipo de negocio, que según sus compañeras, reditúa mucho mas, y consiste en la importación de autopartes y automóviles. Para este fin, Genara necesita de capital para poder realizar viajes al exterior, y comprar la mercadería necesaria, de esta manera dar un giro en el rubro de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To invest capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Alongside her husband, Carmen managed a small text transcription office, which was her only form of income. Unfortunately, one morning it was discovered that the hard drive on her only computer on to which they saved their work had crashed. Desperate, she gathered some pots and food, and she went to the door of banquet halls to sell food, and in this way, she came to generate an income for her household. Through some friends, she came to know Pro Mujer and decided to become a member. Her first loan of 100 dollars allowed her to replace her hard drive and continue her small business, always alongside her husband. Since, Carmen Q. has obtained an office for her work and now owns two computers and necessary equipment. Along with this business, Carmen has developed a talent for cooking. She prepares national dishes, by request or contract, for parties, weddings, etc., which represents an important part of her income. Carmen intends to open a restaurant, particularly for lunches, strengthening her business so that she can collaborate with her husband and secure the well-being of her soon-to-be-born children.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Junto a su esposo, se encargaba de una pequeña oficina de transcripciones de textos, que era su único medio de sustento. Lastimosamente una mañana descubren que el disco duro de la única computadora y herramienta de trabajo que poseían, se había quemado. Desesperada, cogió algunas ollas, algunos alimentos y se fue a la puerta de los salones de fiesta para vender comida y de esa forma ver la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar. Por comentarios de algunas amistades, ella conoce Pro Mujer y decide ser socia, accediendo a su primer desembolso, consistente en 100 dólares, mismos que le sirvieron para reponer el disco duro averiado, y de esta manera retomar su pequeña empresa, siempre al lado de su esposo. En la actualidad, Carmen Q. ha logrado establecer una oficina de transcripciones de textos y ya cuanta con dos computadoras y el equipamiento necesario. Pero paralelo a esto, Carmen ha descubierto una aptitud gastronómica, y se dedica a la preparación de platos de la comida nacional, atendiendo a pedido y contrato, fiestas, matrimonios, y otros, que le representan un importante ingreso, y avizoran una empresa prospera. La intención de Carmen es la apertura de un restaurante para la atención de almuerzos, de esta manera consolidar su empresa para colaborar a su esposo, y asegurar el bienestar de los hijos que están por venir.

loans.use: To invest capital in the opening of a restaurant

loans.name: Evergista

texts.es:
Evergista sold office envelopes and paper products produced by her husband at a printing press established with his brother. She sold these products door-to-door to help provide for her entire family. Despite her efforts, her income was not enough to pay for her children's education. For this reason, Evergista decides to start her own business with the help of Pro Mujer. She hopes to purchase a case of olive oil cans so she can sell them to the markets and fairs of the city of La Paz. Right now, Ms Evergista is one of the most solicited providers of these products in the the Garita de Lima, Huyustus, and Eloy Salmon zone, allowing her to dream of one day opening a distribution of wholesale supplies. This would allow her to help her husband and alleviate his work.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Vendía sobres y papelería de escritorio, productos elaborados por su marido en una imprenta que había instalado con su hermano. Evergista T. Condori, se dedicaba a deambular vendiendo estos productos para el sustento de toda su familia. Pese a los esfuerzos, los ingresos no alcanzaban para pagar los estudios de sus dos hijos Por tal motivo, Evergista decide emprender por su cuenta otro negocio, con la ayuda de Pro Mujer. De esta manera logra comprar un cajón de bidones de aceite, y deambular por los mercados y ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. En la actualidad, la señora Evergista, es una de las proveedoras más solicitadas en la zona Garita de Lima, Huyustus y Eloy Salmón, lo que le permite soñar y pensar en que algun día podrá lograr la apertura de una distribuidora de víveres al por mayor, de esta manera colaborar a su esposo y aliviar el sacrificado trabajo de su esposo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena Huanco de Silva has been a member of Pro Mujer for 14 years making her one of the longest-standing members. She used her first loan, 200 Bolivars, to buy vicuña wool. With profits from it's sale, she bought candy to sell in front of a school in El Alto. At this time she owns a grocery store in front of the San Vicente School. With proceeds from the business she supports her husband and four children. At this time she would like to buy a van to use for public transportation, so that she can continue to support her children.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Filomena H. de Silva es una de las socias más antiguas de Pro Mujer, tiene una permanencia de 14 años dentro de la organización. Su primer desembolso fue de 200 Bs. con lo que decide comprar algunos kilos de lana de vicuña para poder realizar la reventa y así generar algunos ingresos. Con las ganancias de la venta de la lana de vicuña, Filomena invierte en la compra de dulces y golosinas, para instalarse frente a un colegio de la zona de El Alto. En la actualidad la señora Filomena es propietaria de un almacén y tienda de abarrotes frente al colegio San Vicente, negocio que le permitió salir adelante junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella necesita de inversión de capital para lograr la compra de un minibús, para incursionar en el transporte público, de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy a van to be used for public transportation.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica C. is married with four children. She serves as treasurer of the "April 20th" local chapter of Pro Mujer in Villa Adela in El Alto. She began selling candy and snack foods at stalls in various schools in El Alto. She makes hamburgers, hotdogs, turnovers and other snacks. At this time Angélica has acquired the franchise on a food stall in the Jesús Obrero School in El Alto where she sells french fries, crackers, sandwiches and other snacks popular with the students. Angélica plans to rent bookstalls in the school. To expand her business and imporove her quality of life she needs these funds to stock the stall with books and school supplies.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Angélica C., casada y con 4 hijos, es tesorera de la asociación comunal 20 de Abril de Pro Mujer en la zona de Villa Adela de El Alto. Hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas y comida rápida en los kioscos de varios colegios de la zona de El Alto. Ella se encarga de la preparación de hamburguesas, hot dog, rellenos y otros que vende precisamente en estos recintos. En la actualidad Angélica tiene a su cargo la administración del kiosco del colegio Jesús Obrero de la ciudad de El Alto mismo que se encuentra en alquiler, pero que no le ha impedido progresar y ha ampliado su menú y ofertas, produciendo papas fritas, galletas, sándwiches, y más que tienen gran aceptación en los alumnos del mencionado colegio. La intención de la señora Angélica es tomar en alquiler los kioscos destinados a ser librerías dentro del colegio. Para esto necesita de capital para poder abastecer de materiales y libros dichos kioscos, de esta manera ampliar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To rent a book stand in a school and stock it with books and school supplies.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es:
Tengo una construcción sin terminar, me falta el techo de concreto y enjarrar esto hará más amplia mi casa y más cómoda para mi familia ya que el espacio es cada vez más reducido. Solicito $ 1.000.00 dlls para terminar la construcción y enjarrar.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

I have some unfinished construction. I’m missing the concrete roof and plastering it will make my house larger and more comfortable for my family since the space each time is reduced. I am seeking $1000 to finish the construction and to plaster it.

loans.use: To finish construction

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina Baltasar de Quispe is married and has five children. She is a member of the seven-year-old local association Zaragoza and runs a restaurant in the Cosmos 79 neighborhood. There used to be a bus stop outside her restaurant which brought in many customers, but the bus stop has now moved, taking a lot of business with it, so Josefina joined Pro Mujer hoping to increase her capital and replace the lost income. At this time, she needs to borrow money to remodel and expand her restaurant.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Josefina Baltasar de Quispe, casada, madre de 5 hijos y perteneciente a las asociación comunal Zaragoza, con una antigüedad de 7 años, se dedica a la atención de un restaurante en la zona de Cosmos 79. Anteriormente, el lugar donde Josefina tiene su negocio, era una parada de transporte público, lo que le permitió tener una masiva clientela. A sus 35 años, ingresa a Pro Mujer, buscando la forma de inyectar capital a su negocio, que a raíz del traslado de la parada de transporte público, provocó un fuerte descenso en sus ventas y de forma inherente a sus ingresos. Actualmente, Josefina necesita remodelar su restaurante para poder cabida a la clientela que se da cita, remodelando y ampliando su negocio, y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida

loans.use: To expand and remodel a restaurant.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel C. has hawked groceries door to door in her neighborhood for many years. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven years. She used her first loan to expand her product line and boost sales. At this time she has made the contacts necessary to set herself up making and selling macrame crafts, and important trade in her city. She needs start-up capital to buy materials. Making and selling handicrafts will help her round out the income from her other business and support her large family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Isabel C. se dedica a la venta de víveres en el mercado de su zona, comenzó hace muchos años, vendiendo de puerta en puerta y de puesto en puesto según los pedidos que le hacían. Es socia de Pro Mujer hace 7 años, con su primer desembolso logro capitalizarse y variar su mercadería, incrementando la cantidad de pedidos y mejorando sus ingresos. En la actualidad, Isabel tiene la firme intención de capacitarse en la elaboración de artesanías con macramé, rubro que tiene gran acogida en algunos sectores de la ciudad, y que prácticamente ya ha iniciado los contactos necesarios para la introducción en ese mercado. Isabel necesita de capital para emprender este negocio, tanto para su capacitación, como para la compra de materiales necesarios para el inicio de estas artesanías. De esta forma y con ayuda de su otro negocio, sustentar a toda su familia que es muy numerosa.

loans.use: To buy materials for macrame.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Q. is married with five children. Her husband works as a driver. She has served as president of the "Ever Joyful" local chapter of Pro Mujer. She has two lines of business.. One is selling fruit juice and other drinks on Bolivia Avenue in Villa Adela in El Alto and the other is wholesaling rice she brings from Caranavi in the Yungas of La Paz and from Santa Cruz. She has sold rice for 15 years and uses loans from Pro Mujer to purchase in bulk. At this time she would like to open a grocery store and is asking for a loan to stock up on sugar, flour, oil and especially bulk rice. Increasing her sales will help her improve her quality of life.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Madre de 5 hijos y casada con su esposo de ocupación chofer, la señora Rosa Q. es socia de Pro Mujer, y presidenta de la asociación comunal Siempre Alegres, con una antigüedad de más de 5 años, Rosa se dedica a dos actividades, la primera es la atención de un puesto de jugos y refrescos en la Av. Bolivia de la zona de Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto, y la segunda es el comercio del grano de arroz, que trae de las localidades de Caranavi en los Yungas de La Paz, y de Santa Cruz. La venta del grano de arroz es una actividad que Rosa lleva adelante por más de 15 años. Cuando ingresa a Pro Mujer, invierte su crédito en la compra de mayor cantidad, convirtiéndose en proveedora mayorista de este grano. En la actualidad la señora Rosa necesita de dinero para poder consolidar la apertura de un almacén de abarrotes y víveres, donde podrá vender azúcar, harina, aceite y principalmente arroz al por mayor, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos, permitiéndose mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To open a grocery store, stocking flour, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam V. works making and selling crafts made from pressed boxes in the city of Cochabamba. At night, she works as an announcer calling out stops on public transportation. As the mother of 4 children, Miriam joined the group Pro Mujer (pro woman) looking for a way to strengthen her business, because there have been occasiones when the demand was so high, but she could not buy the materials to meet it. At this time, Miriam would like to be able to make clothing for sports, but this will require capital to buy the machinery and the materials to sew. She could start to distribute the clothing in the markets of her city. Even though her work on public transportation and her sales of arts and crafts have allowed her to improve the conditions of her life today, she is still forced to live in very overcrowded conditions with her four children and her husband, in a room in her father's house.

Miriam V., se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesanías en cartón prensado (trupan) en la ciudad de Cochabamba, y por las noches trabaja de voceadora de transporte público. Madre de 4 niños, Miriam ingresa a Pro Mujer buscando la manera de fortalecer su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de artesanías, puesto que en ocasiones la demanda era tan alta, que no le alcanzaba para la compra de material. Actualmente Miriam quiere capacitarse en la confección de ropa deportiva. Para esto necesitará de capital para la compra de maquinaria y materiales de costura, y comenzar deambulando en las ferias de su ciudad, que paralelamente a su trabajo de voceadora y artesanías le permitirán mejorar las condiciones de vida actuales, ya que se ve obligada a vivir en hacinamiento con sus 4 hijos y su esposo en un ambiente cedido por su padre en el domicilio del mismo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es:
Elizabet is single and does not have children. She lives in a house with her parents, and pays the bills for light, water and gas. She has a business selling women's clothing, which she brings from the town of Desaguadero to sell in the city of Cochabamba where she owns a small stand on Avenue Ayacucho. She was able to secure this stand thanks to steps taken by the unions in the city. When Elizabet joined Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), she had 300 bolivianos (the local currency) invested in some token items. In her first disbursement, she was able to grow her inventory and go to the city of Cochabamba in search of an opening in the market. Right now, she needs capital to continue to make her trips to Desaguadero and primarily to establish a shop specializing in clothing for children and women. In this way, she will be able help her parents more with their bills, and gain more of her own independence.

Soltera, sin hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, y se hace cargo de los gastos de luz, agua y gas domiciliario, Elizabet M., es comerciante de ropa femenina, misma que trae de la localidad de Desaguadero y la lleva para la venta a la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde es dueña de un puesto en la Av. Ayacucho. Este puesto fue conseguido gracias a las gestiones con el sindicato de gremiales de esa ciudad. Cuando Elizabet ingresa a Pro Mujer contaba con un capital de 300 bolivianos invertidos en algunas prendas. Ya en su primer desembolso, logra incrementar su mercadería y se va a la ciudad de Cochabamba en busca de la apertura de un mercado. En la actualidad Elizabet necesita de capital para seguir realizando viajes a Desaguadero y principalmente para el establecimiento de una tienda especializada en la venta de ropa para niños y ropa para mujeres, de esta forma lograr mayores ingresos que le permitan colaborar a sus padres en sus gastos, e independizarse del todo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Grow her clothing business

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía C., divorced and mother of a 13 year-old son, is a craftswoman dedicated to making skirts, blankets, and hats that are sold in a small store in on Franco Valle Avenue in la Ceja de El Alto.

Lucia has been doing this work for more than 18 years, as an associate of Pro Mujer, she would be able to increase her small amount of capital in order to continue making her crafts that could be later sold in the fairs in the city of El Alto and also through travel to sell the crafts in other locations.
