It has been two years since Lucia first had the help of Pro Mujer with her business, which allowed her to open her small store in la Ceja de El Alto, and now Lucia hopes to invest new capital in her goal as stated above, but before doing so she would like to enlarge her store so she could better accomodate a greater variety of products that she has already produced.

Only in this way she will be able to earn the necessary amount of money in order to follow through with her idea of having a booth at the fair in El Alto.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Lucía C., divorciada, y madre de un niño de 13 años, es artesana y se dedica a la confección de polleras, mantas y sombreros, que comercializa en una pequeña tiendita en la Av. Franco Valle de la Ceja de El Alto.

Son más de 18 años que Lucía viene realizando este trabajo, ingresando como socia a Pro Mujer, logra incrementar su pequeño capital para seguir confeccionando sus artesanías, que en ese entonces eran vendidas en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y de forma ambulante.

Hace dos años y con la ayuda de Pro Mujer Lucía logró la apertura de su pequeña tienda en la Ceja de El Alto, y hoy en día su intención es reunir capital para invertir en dicho negocio, pero principalmente para la ampliación de su tienda con el fin de dar mayor cabida a la diversidad de productos que a la fecha ya ha confeccionado.

Solo de esta manera logrará reunir la cantidad de dinero necesaria para concluir su pequeña casita que se encuentra en la fase de terminado con la implementación de la obra fina.

loans.use: To enlarge her store to provide for a greater variety of goods and invest in a sales booth at the fair in El Alto

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Sixty-seven year old Leonida E., a single mother of four works every day in her despensa (store), in order to care for herself and two sons in Ita, a town in Paraguay. Leonida started selling chipas (a bagel-like bread made from corn) on the streets at the age of nine and never had a chance to attend school. She finally saved enough money to start her own despensa fifteen years ago. In the words of Leonida, “my work is my life.” Her business has survived despite the trauma of losing one son to a car accident and the other to a brutal murder by his cousin. She spends approximately two hundred dollars a week buying inventory from the market to sell in her despensa and is asking for a loan in order to buy more meat, bread and candies to sell.

loans.use: To buy more meat, bread and candies to sell.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
After her husband died three years ago from cancer, Marciana O. D. G. started her despensa, convenience store, at her house. She moved into one of the children's room and converted her own room into a small convenience store. She was a housewife before her husband passed away, but soon after had to learn to start her own business and was able to recuperate with the help of her friends, neighbors, and family. Marciana is 60 years old and a mother of three children ages 31, 21, and 15. Her 21-year old and 15-year old child are both students studying at a technology school and are still dependents and living with her. Marciana does not travel to the city to buy her merchandise. She only sells the products that other vendors bring to her and usually repays them every week for the merchandise.

Marciana only makes enough to live every day and support her children. She does not have any extra savings but has to save money to pay her electric, light, water, and telephone bills. She has a truck that belonged to her husband that she wants to sell but cannot sell it because she has no one to sell it to.

Marciana is a member and president of a group called Mujeres Emprendedores. There are 20 women in her group, where members proviD. collateral through a group repayment pledge and the incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members will be responsible for making up the payment amount. In addition, their group also has a separate savings box where each member contributes about $.20 each week. Together their group also fundraises, for example it provided food for the festival for San Juan.

Marciana is very grateful for being able to be part of a group that is respectful and honest. She is looking for a loan to be able to purchase the drinks and bread that she receives every day from the vendors that come to her house to sell.

loans.use: Purchase bread and drinks.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en: Maria Luisa P., 50, is a single mother of four children, ages 28, 25, 18, and 12. Two of her children still live with her and the other two children are professors. She started her business over 20 years ago, and is the owner of a restaurant known for its chicken. In addition to dishes of chicken, she also serves salads. She works every day starting early in the morning and working until she finishes selling her chickens which usually last until 11 pm. She purchases her chickens twice a week from a factory nearby and it takes her an entire day to marinate her chicken. She sells on average about ten chickens per day, but usually more on Saturdays and Sundays when more people eat out. Maria does not sell other kinds of meat because it is more expensive to buy and she runs the restaurant by herself with the occasional help of her children. She is seeking a loan to purchase beer and chickens to operate her business.

loans.use: Purchase beer and chicken.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria Lopez D. P. is a mother of 6 children. She is 57 years old, single, and only her youngest child, 18, still lives with her. Her other children are married and working on their own. She has a table set up outsiD. of Mercado Ita, a small outdoor market, where she sells lottery tickets. She works for a private company and receives 20 percent for the tickets she sells. 
Every day she has over 300 customers that pass by and purchase lottery tickets from her. She has been selling lottery tickets for over 11 years now. With the loan, Maria uses it as capital to buy the lottery tickets from a private lottery ticket company. She is thankful for the many opportunities that her previous loans have provided her.

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario T. Veron is a very hard worker. Starting 15 years ago, he began his micro enterprise creating bricks. Mario is 49-years old, married, and father of four children aged 24, 22, 19, and 16. With the help of his children, he has been able to successful run his business. Over 80 percent of the people in the city of Itá work in this field. Actually, it is the most profitable business to start because in every 15 days he can make up to US$400, which is higher than most incomes. It takes him 15 days to make a load of bricks ready to sell usually about 25,000 bricks. Mario works from 7 am to 11 am and then from 1 pm to 5 pm, using as much daylight as possible.

Mario has 5 clients that buy from him regularly. Mario works in a field area not far from his house. His clients bring their own trucks to load the bricks every month usually to transport to Asuncion, the capital. The bricks are used for building houses in Asuncion, the most common material used in Paraguay to build houses.

In addition, Mario owns 3 horses that help him mix the different ingredients together before they mold it and let it dry. He has two stations that he has set up for mixing. With the loan, Mario will buy wood chips used as part of the mixture and lumber used for firing the bricks.

loans.use: Purchase wood chips and lumber.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Tengo exactamente 2 años que adquirí la vivienda poco a poco, hecho mejoras. Pero necesito ya terminarla ya que trabajo y la casa esta sola casi todo el día y por la colonia se han presentado varios robos. Por eso me urge ponerle la losa la frente de la casa y así quedara más protegida. Solicito un préstamo $1,000.00 Dlls. para la colocación de la losa enfrente da la casa.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

It has been exactly two years I bought a house, which I worked on to improve it little by little. But I need to finish it, now that I work, and the house is unoccupied almost the entire day and there have been some robberies in the area. That is why I feel the urgent need to place flagstone in front of the house so it will be more protected. I am seeking a loan of $1000 to layout flagstone in front of the house.

loans.use: A concrete flagstone in front of the house

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
El Sr. Raymundo R. el desea reconstruir el techo de su casa ya que en época de lluvia tiene el problema que se mete el agua a su casa. Los mueble se están maltratando por la humedad que al igual que su familia se a estado enfermando. Solicita un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la reconstrucción del techo.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr. Raymundo R. wishes to rebuild the roof of his house because when it rains, he runs into a problem where water leaks into his house. The humidity has ruined the furniture as well as affected his family members who have fallen ill. He seeks a loan of $1000 to rebuild his roof.

loans.use: To rebuild the roof

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia C. se dedica a la oficio de corte y confesión: Tengo ya más de un año en este trabajo de costurera cuando tengo mas trabajo es en el regreso a clases ya que tengo varios contratos en varias escuelas para hacer los uniformes. Gracias a dios este año he tenido suficiente trabajo pero me esta haciendo falta una maquina de coser. y así contratar a alguien para sacar los pedidos que tengo de uniformes. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para la compra de una maquina de coser.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Patricia C. works hard as a dressmaker: I have already been in this dressmaking job more than a year. When I have more work it is when I go to the classrooms since I have contracts in various schools to make uniforms. Thanks to the Lord this year I’ve had enough work but what I need is a sewing machine; I hire someone to take the orders I have for the uniforms. I’m looking for $1000 to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Entre mi esposo y yo hemos podido comprar un terreno en el cual estamos construyendo pero no esta asiendo falta la losa y las bardas para ya tenerla lista, para habitarla ya que estamos pagando renta y es muy pesado construir y pagar renta. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para la elaboración de la losa y bardas perimetrales.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Between my husband and me, we have been able to buy some land in which we are developing, but the problem is not lack of material- flagstones (flat stone slab used for paving) and fences -but to live. We pay rent, and it is very difficult to both develop the property and pay rent. We are seeking a loan of $1000 to develop flagstone and perimeter fences.

loans.use: For development of flagstone and perimeter fences

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes C. A. started her despensa, a small grocery store, almost 10 years ago. She runs two despensas; one located at the Mercado Ita, and the other at her house. She works at the despensa at Mercado Ita, an outdoor market, in the mornings; and in the afternoon, she returns to her house to work at the depensa located in front of her house. While she is not at home to watch over the despensa, one of her children looks after it for her. Mercedes is 43 years old, married, and mother to four children, ages 23, 20, 15, and 13. All of her children still live with her. Two are students, one works as a teacher, and the other at a bar.

She is a hard worker and works everyday. Mercedes is seeking a loan to invest in her despensa. She currently sales a variety of items, including bread, vine, eggs, pasta, fruits, candy, and domestic products. With her loan, Mercedes plans to use it as capital to restock her inventory. In particular, she will be buying products such as pasta and drinks in large quantities.

loans.use: Purchase pasta and drinks.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Tengo ya casi terminada mi casa solo me esta asiendo falta el piso en el patio y quiero terminar una cochera, ya que cuando llueve es inunda todo el patio y es un problema con la humedad. Solicito 1,200.00 dlls. Para poner piso en el patio y cochera.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

I have already nearly finished my house; it is just that I need a floor in the patio and I want to finish up the garage because when it rains, it floods all over the patio, creating too much humidity. I’m seeking a loan of $1200 to install a floor in the patio and a garage.

loans.use: To install a floor in the patio and a garage

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mrs Guadalupe A. is requesting a loan to build a tile floor for her patio. "I have been living for more than 15 years in this house, and little by little we have improved it. However, because of economic difficulties we were not able to finish it. I want to put tile in the patio, because when it rains, the complete front gets flooded and we can't get through. I am requesting a loan of $1,200 for this".

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La Sra. Guadalupe A. esta solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de una losa en la galería de su casa. Tengo ya mas de 15 años viviendo en este domicilio el cual poco a poco le hemos mejoras la vivienda. Pero por problemas económicos no hemos podido terminar. Me interesa poner la losa en la galería por que cuando llueve se inunda todo el frente y no se pude pasar. Solicito un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 Dlls. Para la elaboración de la losa en la galería.

loans.use: tiles for the patio

loans.name: Pabla

texts.en:
Pabla C., 44, is mother of 9 children. With the help of her children, she works at home and constructs all types of baskets made from bamboo. She has been working on this for more then 6 years now. Pabla started at a young age learning to weave baskets. All of her children help her everyday in her business. Usually, each person can make about 10 baskets per day, thus, on average she can produce about 30 per day. The length of time to complete each product depends on its size. Usually it is quicker to construct bigger baskets, such as a laundry basket, rather than a smaller basket that is more detail-oriented.

Besides selling in the city of Itá, Pabla also travels to other cities on the weekends to sell her products. She travels by bus to San Lorenzo, Luque, and Olimpia; all of which is about an hour and half bus ride from her home. She usually travels with two of her sons each time so they can help her in carrying the merchandise. For example, a laundry basket sells for about US$1 and even less if bought in a large quantity. She does not travel to Asuncion, the capital, to sell even though she could sell her baskets at higher prices in order to prevent any incidents of assault. She also has a few clients that pay her in advance for a specific order.

Pabla is seeking a loan to buy more bamboo from her neighborhood hoping to create more baskets and to offer a greater selection in sizes and style of baskets.

loans.use: Purchase bamboo.

loans.name: Lucia Rossana

texts.en:
Lucia Rossana M. lives in the neighborhood of San Jose in the city Villa Elisa. She is 31 years old and has been separated from her husband for three years. She lives with her son and brother who is mentally and physically handicapped.

She has been taking care of her brother ever since her mother died in 2004 from a terminal illness. Lucia had to leave her job as a seamstress to stay at home to watch over her brother. She started to sell small items at her house. Then she finally decided to open her own despensa in which she also sells Avon cosmetics. Additionally, she works as a seamstress.

Lucia’s hard work and dedication has allowed her to evolve from selling small products like candy to become the owner of a despensa. She is in need of a loan to purchase merchandise for her despensa, such as sugar, rice, oil, meat, and drinks.

loans.use: To buy more meat, bread and candies to sell.

loans.name: Roque Alsacio

texts.en:
Roque G. lives in the city of Villa Elisa, Paraguay. He is 54 years old and works as a mechanic. He has an auto-body shop and a store at his house where he sells oil, gas and filters for particular vehicles.

He started working as a mechanic as a boy in various shops and finally opened his own shop in 1999. His business is thriving due to the fact that he is the only mechanic in his area. He is known for being a fair and competent mechanic in many parts of the city.

His wife, Juana Lopez, is 43 years old and works as a party decorator. They have two sons and two daughters, all of whom are currently in school. Their oldest son is studying business administration. One of their daughters is in her fourth year of studying child psychology. The other son is studying computer technology and their youngest daughter is enrolled in high school.

Roque wants to obtain a loan to buy 200 liters of oil and diesel in order to increase the quality and quantity of his services.

loans.use: To purchase oil and diesel for their auto body shop.

loans.name: Fakhraddin

texts.en: Fakhraddin N. began his business 10 years ago. Fakhraddin is 47 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives with his family in Yenkiand village, in the Salyan region. His business gives him opportunities to provide for his family. Fakhraddin would like a loan of $1200 to buy fodder, and balling presses. He wants to improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fodder, balling presses

loans.name: Intigam

texts.en: Intigam was born in 1977. He is married and has one child. He lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. FIve years ago he started vine growing to support his family. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy orchard medicines and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy orchard medicines

loans.name: Khudamali

texts.en: Khudamali is forty years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. Khudamali would like a loan of $1200 to purchase fertilizer and medicine for his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Balakhmed

texts.en: Balakhmed is 33 years old, is married, and has two children. He lives with his family in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region. Balakhmed purchased a plot of land to start his own business seven years ago. He need a loan of $1200 to purchase a plot of land, to expand his current plot and attain a larger harvest.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Abulfaz

texts.en: Abulfaz is forty-five years old, married, and lives in Khachmaz town with his wife and two children. Abulfaz has sold shirts for three years now, and would like a loan of $825 to increase and vary the range of his goods.

loans.use: to increase and  vary his goods

loans.name: Habibulla

texts.en: Habibulla is forty-five years old, and lives in Kohna-Khachmaz village, located in the Khachmaz region. Habibulla is married and has three children. He owns his own orchard, where he currently grows fruits and vegetables. He would like a loan of $600 to expand the size of his orchard and to purchase medicines.

loans.use: to expand the area of his orchard and to buy  orchard medicines

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old and maarried, and has a welding shop in the Kirkuk market. He has applied to get $1000 from AL-Aman to purchase a new welding machine. He wants to enhance his live standard and develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en: Nazila is the mother of two children. She is married, and her husband is shown in her place in the photo. Nazila and her husband own a butcher shop, where they started their business four years ago. Nazila would like to apply for a loan of $725 in order to purchase two calves, which would improve their business and attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 24 years old and has a mini-market in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to get more goods for his shop. He lives with his mother and father and two small sisters. He is responsible for supporting them and he wants to increase his income and enhance his family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 23 years old has a shoe shop in the Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to paint the shop and add more shelves. He is getting married in the next couple of months, and he wants to get this loan and develop his shop and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint the shop and add more shelves

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old and has a small shop in the south of Kirkuk to repair electronic equipment. He has a big family; four children and his mother live with him. He is responsible for supporting them. He wants this loan to purchase new equipment for the shop so that he can increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personal attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g., masking portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new equipment

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en: Zamina is forty-three years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is shown in the photo in place of her. Zamina and her husband have their own shop, where they produce boxes made from boards. They have been in this business for four years. These boxes are used for keeping agricultural produce. Zamina would like a loan of $600 to purchase boards for making the boxes.

loans.use: to buy board

loans.name: Zeyvar

texts.en: Zeyvar is forty-four years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in Hadjilar village, in the Khachmaz region. Her husband has a combine, where they grow barley and grain. Her husband then reaps the barley and grain, and feeds it to their cattle. Zeyvar and her husband have been in this business for five years. She would like a loan of $825 to purchase spare parts for their combine.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh is twenty-two years old, and lives in Hadjilar village, in the Khachmaz region. Taleh has a plot of land on which he grows tomatoes, aubergines and peppers. Taleh would like a loan of $825 to purchase fertilizer and medicines to improve his business and increase his harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Sadet

texts.en: Sadet is 50 years old, and the mother of two children. They live in Khachmaz town, where she provides shops with clothes. Every day, Sadet goes to shops and provides them with the clothes they need. She uses the money earned to cover her family’s expenses. She would like a loan of $600 to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en: Fariz is 26 years old, and lives in Khachmaz town. He began his business of repairing mobile phones two years ago. He would like a loan of $725 to purchase spare parts for mobile phones, so he can offer better services to his clients.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for mobile phones

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: Hamida is the mother of two children. She is 31 years old and lives in Khachmaz town. Hamida knits clothes to provide for her family. She has been in the business for four years. She would like a loan of $725 to purchase yarn to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Djalil

texts.en: Djalil is 55 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in Khachmaz town. Djalil has his own orchard, where grows cherry trees, pear trees, and apricot trees. He began his business seven years ago. Djalil would like a loan of $775 in order to purchase fertilizer and medicine.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Zulfugar

texts.en: Zulfugar is 39 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in Gusarchay village, in the Khachmaz region. He has six years of farming experience, and would like a loan of $825 to purchase fertilizer and medicines to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her second-hand clothes business specializing in tops and blouses.

loans.name: Abou

texts.en: Abou Traoré is 24 and single. He sells cell phone accessories. He currently lives in eastern Abidjan and has 2 years of experience in his field. Traoré has been with AE&I since 2006 and he desires a loan to satisfy his customers' demand for cell phone accessories and make more profits. He wants to develop his business and be able to take care of his family.

loans.use: Abou Traoré will use the loan to purchase a stock of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Mardan

texts.en: Marden is 36 years old, and has two children. He lives in Agyazi Budug, located in the Khachmaz region. He has been in his business for four years, and would like a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizer and medicines.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Khachmaz town. He has been selling clothes for four years. He would like a loan of $950 to increase the variety of his goods to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her second-hand ladies' clothes business.

loans.name: Edorh

texts.en: Edorh H. is a fish seller at the Angré open market (eastside of Abidjan). Born in Nigeria in 1966 and married, she is the mother of three children who are completing their education in Abidjan. She started her fish selling business in September, 1999.  The benefits from her activities have permitted her to help her husband (a taxi driver) to pay for their children's education expenses. She requests a loan from AE&I to purchase fish in bulk in order to satisfy retailers' orders and improves her margin.

loans.use: Edorh Hokinde

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock a variety of ladies clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothes business.

loans.name: Affou

texts.en: C. Affou sells goods in the Angré open market (eastside suburb of Abidjan), especially spices. She is 24 years old and is married. She has 5 children. Three of them are living in Korhogo, in the north of Cote d’Ivoire and the other two live with her and are still completing their education. Her husband is an office clerk. She has 11 years of experience in doing her business. She joined the AE&I microcredit program in July, 2005. She requests this loan in order to purchase goods in bulk and benefit from a better purchase price.

loans.use: Affou Coulibaly will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam S. is 49 years old. He lives in Angré (Eastern suburb of Abidjan) and is married and the father of 3 children. His 3 children are all students and will resume school in September.

He has 17 years work experience in selling food (corn, ground nuts, rice, etc.). He joined the AE&I microcredit program in February, 2005 and has performed very well since then. He requests the loan to expand his activities. He expects to increase his business volume and improve his margin.

loans.use: Adam Souleymane will use the loan to purchase food to sell

loans.name: Gbamble

texts.en:
Gbamble L. Z. is a very dynamic 46-year-old woman with 2 children. She sells various fruits and vegetable in Yopougon (Northern suburb of Abidjan ) open market. She lives in Yopougon with her family. She contributes significantly to her family's living expenses with revenues from her micro business. Her husband retired from public administration years ago.

She joined the AE&I microcredit program in January, 2005 and has performed very well since then. She requests the loan to purchase more goods which certainly will help her increase her profits and improve her family's living conditions. She is ambitious and committed to her job.

loans.use: Gbamble Lou Zamble will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Sanjuana

texts.es:
Maria is originally from the town of Escobedo, in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She's married and has two children, ages 16 and 25. Her husband is a teacher at a local school, but his salary isn't sufficient for them to afford the children's education. Out of necessity, five years ago Maria started selling used clothing, and little by little she has increased her supplies and her sales. Now she has posts in three local markets.

In order to keep her business growing, Maria is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to buy more clothing for resale. This will allow her to offer a wider selection to her customers. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be an important part in improving the quality of life for Maria and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 25 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como profesor en una escuela de la localidad pero su salario no era suficiente para poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, ante esta necesidad, desde hace cinco años Maria inició con la venta de ropa usada, poco a poco fue surtiendo más mercancía e incrementando sus ventas, ahora ya se instala en tres mercados rodantes.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, esto le permitirá ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad y promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura is a single mother of two daughters. She's never relied on anyone but herself in moving her family forward, which she has worked hard to do. Her daughters were her motivation in starting her own business 10 years ago. She started selling floral arrangements but later incorporated selling new clothes and experienced better results. Now, she only sells clothing and has been able to grow her business, increasing her customers and offering her products at the market.

Currently, Rosaura is requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase more clothes to cover her clients' growing demand and to provide them with a better service. She plans to repay the loan within four months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business. Your help will lend a great hand to Rosaura and her daughters. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosaura es soltera y tiene dos hijas, nunca ha tenido el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a su familia por lo que ha tenido que esforzarse mucho, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio hace 10 años, empezó vendiendo arreglos florales pero después incorporó la venta de ropa nueva y obtuvo mejores resultados, ahora sólo se dedica a esta actividad y ha hecho crecer su negocio incrementado sus clientes y ofreciendo sus productos en un mercado.

En estos momentos Rosaura necesita de un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Martha Francisca

texts.es:
Martha is a married mother of three. Her husband laborer, and his salary is very small, so Martha, as an enterprising woman, decided to start her own business selling clothes to earn extra income. She started selling used clothing 15 years ago, and now, at the request of her clients, she has incorporated new clothes as well. It has gone very well, and she also has acquired a post at the local market and continues to sell out of her home.

Thanks to her business, Martha's children have been able to continue their education. To keep the business growing, she is requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase more clothing in order to offer a wider selection and increase her sales. She plans to repay the loan within four months. You can be a part in the development of this business and the well being of Martha and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Martha es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es obrero y el salario que recibe es muy bajo, como Martha es una mujer emprendedora decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta D. ropa para obtener un ingreso extra, comenzó a vender ropa usada en su casa hace 15 años, ahora a petición D. sus cliente ha incorporado la venta D. ropa nueva y le ha ido muy bien, también ha adquirido un puesto en el mercado y continua con las ventas en su hogar.

Con este negocio Martha ha logrado que sus hijos continúen estudiando y para seguir creciendo ahora necesita D. un préstamo D. $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra D. mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella está dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte del desarrollo D. este negocio y del bienestar D. esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción is originally from the town Escobedo, in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She is married and has a son and a daughter, ages 16 and 25 respectively. They were the motivation for her to start her business selling cosmetics, jewelry and shoes five years ago. Her husband works for an oil excavating company, which requires him to travel often. To cover the costs of her children's education, she started the business and has been able to make it grow little by little, and she now has a larger clientele.

To be able to meet all the orders she's getting, Concepción is requesting a loan of $550, which she will use to purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be an important part in the growth of this business and help Concepción and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Concepción es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es casada, tiene un hijo y una hija de 16 años y 25 años respectivamente, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual Concepción inició su negocio de ventas de cosméticos, joyería y calzado hace cinco años, el empleo de su esposo como operador en una petro-escavadora le exige constantes viajes y para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos emprendió este negocio que ha hecho crecer poco a poco, y ahora ya cuenta con una amplia clientela.

Para poder surtir todos los pedidos que tiene Concepción está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esa cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Concepción y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas y la oportunidad de mejorar.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
Ever since 6 years ago Maria started her own business selling clothing, footwear and ceramics. She opened her own business because of the financial need her family was going through. She is married and has four children between the ages of 21 and 27.

Her husband is employed in a local business, nonetheless, his wage is insufficient to pay for all of the house's expenses and the education of their children.

Little by little Maria has made her business grow since she enjoys sales and has a great desire to move on ahead.

Nowadays, her clients have multiplied as have her sales. Maria is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase merchandise and offer a greater variety of products and better service to her clientèle.

She is committing to pay back this amount in 6 months. Maria thanks the opportunity you provide her family with your support to grow her business and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Desde hace seis años Maria emprendió su negocio con la venta de ropa, calzado y cerámica. Inició debido a la necesidad por la que pasaba su familia, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos entre 21 y 27 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como empleado de una empresa de la localidad, sin embargo, su salario era insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, poco a poco Maria a hecho crecer su negocio gracias a su gusto por las ventas y a su deseo de salir adelante.

Ahora sus clientes se han multiplicado al igual que sus ventas y Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares para compra de mercancía y poder ofrecerle una mayor variedad y un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Maria agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchasing Merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a married woman. She has three children aged 20, 15 and 8 years old. Her husband is employed in a business but his income is not sufficient to support the family. Hence, she decided to set up her own business which initially rented a small shop and sold basic supplies.

Little by little her business grew and now, seven years later, she owns the shop and wishes to keep growing.

Martha is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase merchandise for her business and supply it with more products so that she can keep and increase her clientèle. She is offering to pay back the loan in 6 months.

Her and her family thank you for the support you give them so that they can provide a better education to their children and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Martha es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos de 20, 15 y 8 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa y sus ingresos no son suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, fue por esto, que ella decidió poner su negocio, el cual inicialmente lo empezó rentando un pequeño local y vendiendo cosas básicas, que poco a poco fue creciendo con el mismo hasta ahora ya después de siete años con su negocio ahora ya tiene su local propio, y desea continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

Martha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y así surtirlo de más productos y así mantener y tener mayor cantidad de clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das para poder brindarles educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Ovideo

texts.es:
Ovideo is a hardworking, entrepreneurial and very creative man. He is married. His wife not works and just stays at home. They have for sons and his youngest son helps him with the business and is the one leading it.

He has managed to make the business succeed, after he acquired it a year ago. He works a lot and saved enough money to buy from a friend a small factory which makes garbage bags. To date, he has created 7 jobs and has been growing his micro-business- everyday having more and more clients.

Ovideo is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase raw materials, since at the moment he has several orders delayed and he does not have the liquidity to supply them. He is offering to pay back the loan in 6 months. Him and his family thank the support that you give them since this business is their only source of income and they wish to continue growing to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Ovideo es un hombre muy trabajador, emprendedor y creativo, esta casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar, su hijo menor le ayuda en el negocio y está al frente del mismo, el salió adelante con su negocio que adquirió hace un año atrás, el trabajaba mucho y ahorro un dinero y hace un año adquirió una pequeña fábrica de hacer bolsas de basura y fue comprada a un amigo de él. A la fecha ha dado siete empleos a personas que colaboran con él en el negocio y ha ido creciendo con el trabajo que dedica a su microempresa, teniendo cada vez más clientes.

Ovideo esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,200 para compra materia prima ya que en este momento tiene pedidos atrasados y no cuenta con liquidez, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das ya que es su única fuente de ingresos y desea continuar creciendo para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru:
Inobat has two children. She is divorced and is raising her sons by herself. She lives with her parents. Her father is a pensioner but his pension is not enough to live on, so Inobat started her business 6 years ago by selling men’s, women’s and children’s clothing. She travels to Karosuu, Kyrgyzstan and Kokand, Uzebkistan to purchase goods. It is very difficult for Inobat to travel to different countries to buy goods because there are problems with transportation and customs inspectors on the borders between countries. But Inobat has gotten used to difficulties and can’t imagine her life without trade.
Inobat is an active client of “MicroInvest”. In the past the loans she received helped her grow her business. With this loan she plans to open her own stall and with the profits she wants to buy a separate flat for her small family.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Инобат мать двоих детей. С мужем она развелась и осталась с двумя детьми на руках. Сейчас она живет со своими родителями и сама растит своих двух сыновей. Ее отец пенсионер и его пенсии не хватает на жизнь. 6 лет назад Инобат начала предпринимательскую деятельность. Начала бизнес с мужской, женской и детской одеждой. За товаром ездит в Каросуу, Кыргызстан и Коканд, Узбекистан. Инобат очень трудно ездить в другую страну за товаром, так как на границе этих городов возникают проблемы с таможенными органами и перевозкой товара. Но Инобат уже привыкла к этим трудностям и не может представить себе жизнь без торговли.
Инобат активный клиент Микроинвест. Полученные займы способствовали развитию бизнеса Инобат в лучшую сторону. В планах у нее открыть лавочку и на доходы приобрести отдельную квартиру для своей маленькой семьи.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Abduvaqos

texts.ru:
Abduvaqos has a large and happy family. He is married and he is lucky more than any one else because he has three sons. Just recently, his sons were small and he was working in the store by himself. Now all of them have grown enough to help him. Abduvaqos’s specialization is selling light cotton fabrics, summer shoes as well as different kinds of towels. His goods are in demand and sales are good. In the past Abduvaqos was selling his goods in the open-air markets, traveling from market to market. A few years ago, Abduvaqos rented a small shop and began his current business. It was then that Abduvaqos got his first loan through “MicroInvest” which helped him expand his business. Since then he has been collaborating with “MicroInvest” and regularly receiving loans. Currently Abduvaqos wants another loan to expand the assortment of more expensive fabrics he sells.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

У Абдувакоса большая и дружная семья. Он женат. Ему повезло как никому другому, так как у него 3 сыновей. Еще совсем недавно они все были маленькие и он торговал в магазине один. Сейчас все его сыновья подросли настолько что уже помогают ему в его нелегком труде. Специализация бизнеса Абдувакоса это легкие хлопчатобумажные ткани, легкая летняя обувь и различные виды полотенец. Товар очень восстребован и торговля идет очень хорошо. Раньше Абдувакос торговал на открытом месте и ездил по базарам. Несколько лет назад он арендовал маленький магазин иначал торговать в нем. Тогда же 2 года назад он получил свой первый займ в Микроинвест, с помощью которого значительно расширил свой бизнес. С тех пор он сотрудничает с Микроинвест, регулярно получая займы. Сейчас он хочет расширить ассортимент тканей более дорогих по цене и получить для этого новый займ.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Hapizova

texts.ru:
G. specializes in the trade of milk products. Five years ago, she took responsibility for her family because her husband was sent to jail. In order to be able to take care of her four young sons and the constant problems with her flat, G. was forced to start selling at the nearby market. G. is originally from Uzbekistan and could have moved her family there but her husband is imprisoned in Tajikistan, so she decided to stay.
Her day starts at 4 in the morning when she starts going through the villages buying milk products. She spends the rest of the day selling them at the central market in Isfara. Her sons have learned how to bake bread, cook food, do laundry and run other household errands in order to help their mother. Since childhood, one of her sons has been shortsighted. In January 2007 G. received a loan through “MicroInvenst” for her son’s surgery. After paying back her first loan, she received a loan to expand her business – the sale of milk products. Currently she is planning to receive another loan to expand her business, which is the only source of income for G. and her family.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Гулчехра специализируется на продаже молочных продуктов. Пять лет назад она вынуждена была взять на свои хрупкие женские плечи все тяготы семейной жизни, так как к несчастью ее мужа посадили в тюрьму. Забота о 4 несовершеннолетних сыновьях и постоянные проблемы с неблагоустроенной квартирой вынудили Гулчехру выйти на базар торговать. Сама она родом из Узбекистана и могла бы со своими детьми переехать туда к своим родным, но ее муж здесь в Таджикистане и она обязана остаться.
Ее рабочий день начинается в 4 утра, когда она начинает ездить по кишлакам и собирать молочные продукты. Затем до 5 вечера она торгует на центральном рынке г. Исфары. Ее сыновья научились сами печь хлеб, готовить еду, стирать, убирать, вести другие дела по домашнему хозяйству – помогают матери. Один из сыновей Гулчехры с детства страдает близорукостью. В январе 2007 года Гулчехра получила займ в Микроинвест для операции своего сына. Погасив первый займ она получила займ на расширение своего бизнеса – торговлю молочными продуктами. Сейчас она собирается получить очередной займ на расширение своего бизнеса, являющегося основным источником дохода для Гулчехры и ее семьи.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Juraeva

texts.ru:
T. has been in business for several years. Her husband helps her. T. is 41 and has four children. She started her business by selling children’s clothing. Slowly she changed to selling fabrics, since as she says herself, it is more profitable. She travels to wholesale markets 100-170 km from her home to purchase fabrics. She does not have a permanent stall, so she travels to different markets. She moves her goods in her own car. T. has been collaborating with “MicroInvest” for 6 months. Her previous loans were used to expand her business and increase the number and variety of different fabrics. Currently, it is peak sales season for T. as there are a lot of weddings which by traditions require that new dresses be made. The season of warm fabrics is coming soon, and T. wants to get a loan to purchase these fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Таборак занимается бизнесом , а именно торговлей тканями уже несколько лет. Ей помогает муж. Таборак 41 год и у нее 4 детей. Начинала она свой бизнес с торговли детской одеждой. Постепенно перешла на торговлю тканями, так как по ее словам прибыли остается больше. За товаром ездит на оптовые рынки, расположенные в 100 – 170 км от ее дома. У нее нет постоянного места для торговли, и она ездит по пригородным базарам. Свой товар она перевозит на собственной машине. С Микроинвест сотрудничает полгода. Полученные займы способствовали расширению бизнеса, увеличению количества и разновидностей тканей. Сейчас для Таборак сезон продаж, так как проходит много свадеб на которые принято шить новые платья. Скоро сезон теплых тканей и Таборак хочет получить займ для закупки этих тканей.

loans.use: to purchase warm fabrics

loans.name: Maman

texts.en:
T. Maman is a young single mother with 2 children. She sells utensils. She lives in Yopougon, a township in northern Abidjan. She is solely responsible for the educations and living expenses of her children, and her business is her only revenue source.

She joined the AE&I microcredit program in June, 2004 when she heard about our institution from her sister. Her dream is to open a big store someday. She requests the loan to increase her stock of goods and improve her margins.

loans.use: Touré Maman will use the loan to purchase household goods in bulk.

loans.name: Missiratou

texts.en: B. Missiratou is a 29 year old lady. She specializes in ladies'  fashion and beautiful skin products. She is married but living alone with her child because her husband has left home. Her ambition is to travel and purchase fashion beauty products in order to reach a new target market. Her business is growing very well and she wants to expand it in the coming months. B. Missiratou joined AE&I micro credit program in January 2005 and has been performing very well since that time. She is ambitious and self-confident. She has sent her daughter to school and wants to be able to pay the school fees by herself.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Z. Marie Chantal is a 31 year old dynamic micro business woman. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She is married and her husband is a modest librarian. She sells meat in Yopougon open market. Her micro business revenue contributes significantly to cover household expenses. She has 3 children who all go to school. Chantal heard about AE&I in October 2004 from her sister. She then joined the AE&I microcredit program. She has been performing very well. Chantal wants to expand her business in order to contribute to her children's school fees payment in October.

loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: N. Beatrice lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She sells African traditional pharmaceutical products, especially natural medicines in the Yopougon open market. Beatrice is 60 years old and has been in this business for more than 30 years. She is married and has 7 children. Beatrice’s retired husband was a schoolmaster. Her micro business is actually the main revenue resource of her family. She is dynamic and strong despite her age and takes care of her household expenses. Beatrice joined AE&I microcredit program in December 2005 and she is a good performer.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of African natural medicine

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.en: A. Marcelle is a 40 year old single mother. She lives with her beautiful 10 year old daughter in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. Early every morning, she goes to the Yopougon open market to sell various food products such as ground-nut paste and spices. Marcelle has been active in this business since 1980. This business helped her to pay for tailoring courses for her daughter, whose dream is to open her own fashion wear shop when she has completed her training. Marcelle is dynamic and courageous. She heard about AE&I in 2005 from her friend and has benefited from some microcredits that she reimbursed in a good manner.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of ground-nut paste

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en: D. T. Lucie is a brave 59 year old woman. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. Lucie sells grilled pig meat at Yopougon open market. She has been doing this micro business for more than 20 years. Her husband, who retired from his public administration work ten years ago, is no longer able to cover all household expenses. Lucie is therefore a key family resources provider. Lucie is seeking to become a pig meat wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase pig meat in bulk

loans.name: Ahon

texts.en: Ahon C. is a 38 year old dynamic single woman. She lives with her two children in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. C. sells various vegetable products in the Yopougon open market. She wants to diversify her product range and improve her business margin. C. will send her second youngest daughter to school in September. She wants to increase her revenues in order to be able to pay the school fees. She joined AE&I microcredit program in September 2004 and has been a very good performer since then.

loans.use: To diversify her product range.

loans.name: Al

texts.en: Al T. is a 34 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. T. is an artisan who manufactures small ice cream and fresh juice plastic bags. He sells his products to ice cream and fresh juice producers. T. lives with his family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. His artisan workshop is located in the Yopougon open market. He started this work when he was 11 and has now gained a lot of experience. T.’s children all go to school and he pays the education fees from his artisan activities. T. wants to purchase new modern equipment that costs about US$3500. He has saved about US$2000. This equipment will help T. to increase production and improve his performance and financial strength. T. is ambitious and has been a good performer since he joined AE&I in March 2006.

loans.use: To acquire modern ice cream bag processing equipment

loans.name: Diby

texts.en:
Diby G. is a 40-year-old single mother. She lives with her 4 children in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. G., who started selling casava paste in 1981, is a dynamic woman who has been able to care for her 4 children's education fees till now.

G. now wants to diversify her business by offering special local sauce products to her increasing customers' needs. This will significantly improve G.'s revenue and ensure better work conditions. She has recently relocated near her business place. G., who heard about AE&I from her cousin, joined the AE&I microcredit program in October, 2004 and has benefited from micro loans that she repaid in a good manner.

loans.use: Diby Germaine will use the loan diversify her business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
K. Jacqueline is a dynamic 41-year-old woman. Jacqueline is divorced and has 7 children. She lives with her children in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She opened her restaurant 6 years ago when she divorced. She has successfully managed her restaurant and has been able to take care of her 3 younger children alone.

Jacqueline’s activities are growing fast and she wants to acquire new equipment to enlarge the space of her restaurant and offer better service to her customers. Jacqueline, who heard about AE&I in February, 2004, joined the AE&I microcredit program then. She has been a good performer. She is ambitious and well organized.

loans.use: Kouakou Jacqueline wants the loan to acquire new equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.en:
Abdoulaye M. is a dynamic and ambitious 34-year-old man. He is married and is the father of a 3-year-old daughter. Abdoulaye lives with his family in Port-Bouët, a popular district in the southern region of Abidjan.

He has been in the fashion clothes selling business since 1997 (10 years experience) and he performs very well. He heard about AE&I early in 2004 from his sister. He then joined the AE&I microcredit program. He wants now to expand and diversify his business.

loans.use: Abdoulaye Mahamane will use the loan to purchase fashion clothes

loans.name: Yvonne Ahou

texts.en: Ahou Y. Yvonne is a 42-year-old single mother. She has a daughter who will start secondary school education in September. Yvonne takes care to her daughter's education and her household expenses alone. She is dynamic and courageous. She lives with her daughter in Port-Bouët, a popular district in the southern area of Abidjan. She has been selling maize and several cereal foods in the Port-Bouët open market for years. She wants to purchase goods in bulk in order to benefit from lower prices and improve her margin. She joined the AE&I microcredit program in February, 2005 and has performed very well since then. Yvonne expects to improve her financial resources in order to be able to ensure regular payments of her daughter's school fees.

loans.use: Ahou Yao Yvonne will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Akim

texts.en: A. Akim is a dynamic and courageous 29-year-old man. He is married and has a 5-month-old daughter. Akim owns an artisan cereal processing workshop in Koumassi, a township in the southern area of Abidjan, where he lives with his family. His workshop is in Koumassi’s open market and nearby his potential customers. Akim heard from AE&I in July, 2005 from his sister and joined our microcredit program at the same time. Akim has performed very well so far. He wants to acquire new machinery and repair parts to increase his performance and processing capacities.

loans.use: Arowossegbe Akim will use the loan to purchase new machinery

loans.name: Binao

texts.en: Banao Bilebié is a 41-year-old man. Banao is married and has 2 children. He is a butcher and lives in Koumassi, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. Binao sells fresh beef and mutton meats. He performs his activities in the Koumassi open market. He is a dynamic and ambitious man. He heard about AE&I in June, 2005 from his sister and then joined the AE&I microcredit program. He has performed very well since then, and has ensured loan repayment in a good manner.

loans.use: Banao Bilebié wants to purchase 2 cows

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: D. Pauline is a dynamic 39-year-old single mother. She lives with her 2 children in Port-Bouët, a popular district in the southern area of Abidjan. Pauline is a good tailor. She performs her activities in the Port-Bouët open market. She takes care to the tuition fees of her two children. Pauline wants to purchase a stock of school uniforms. She will make primary school pupil dress for September. This is a good business opportunity for Pauline as she will get a good margin from the school uniform sales in September and October. Pauline joined the AE&I microcredit program in December, 2005 and has been a good performer since then. She is courageous and ambitious.

loans.use: Dago Pauline

loans.name: Akissi

texts.en: D. Akissi Y. is a dynamic and strong 51-year-old woman. She is married and has 7 children. Akissi lives with her family in Koumassi, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. She wholesales various fruits and vegetables in the Koumassi open market. Akissi has been in this business for more than 25 years and is now one the most active fresh vegetable product wholesalers in the Koumassi market. Akissi joined the AE&I microcredit program early 2005 when she heard about it from a friend. She has been very active and has reimbursed all micro loans in a good manner. Akissi want to increase her activities and purchase goods in bulk from production fields.

loans.use: Dje Akissi Yvonne will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Ganiyou

texts.en: Ganiyou C. is a 24-year-old single mother. She has a 4-year-old daughter and lives in Koumassi, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. C. sells various plastic utensils in the Koumassi open market. She has been in this business for more than 8 years. She performs very well and has improved her business since October 2005 when she benefited a first loan from AE&I. C. is dynamic and ambitious. She wants to expand her business with new range of plastic products such as packaging sachets.

loans.use: Ganiyou Cherifa wants to purchase plastic utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his barber shop business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his telephone services

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en: Sokhoeurn was married in 1983 and has 5 children, 4 sons and 1 daughter. She has been in the business of planting vegetables for more than 10 years. She did not go to school but her husband, Mr. Yean Ley, studied at secondary school even though he did not finish. He is also in this farming business with his wife. With this business they have been able to send their children to school and some of them have jobs now. She bought a computer for her son to use to study at university. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount is for $1,000. She will use this loan to prepare the land, and purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. With her business activity there will be no problem for her to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To prepare the land, and purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sokhoeurn Khlouk paid off her loan already. Thank you.

loans.name: Kim-Earn

texts.en: Kim-earn was married in 1992 and has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter. She has been in the business of sewing clothes since 1994. She did not finish primary school. Her husband is a police officer in Resey Chroy commune. He sometimes assists his wife in bringing the clothes to the markets or to clients. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA twice and the current loan amount is for $200. She will use this loan to repair the house. With the business of sewing clothes they can send all of their children to school. There will be no problem for her to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Boeun

texts.en: Boeun was married in 2002 and has 1 son. She learned to weave silk from her sister 14 years ago and then she started her silk production. She has never been to school. Her husband, Mr. Chea Chamroeun weaves silk as well. She is asking for a $200 loan from MAXIMA to buy silk material and sewing thread. She is able to earn enough to support her family and repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase silk material and sewing thread.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol was married in 1986 and has 4 children, 2 daughters and 2 sons. All of her children are studying at school in the village. Her family has run a battery charging station and welded iron tubes for more than 2 years. The eldest son assists her husband in the business of welding iron tubes in the village. Her husband, Mr. Ling Rin, is not only in the business of welding iron tubes but also repairing motorbikes. He learned to repair motorbikes with his uncle in Phnom Penh when he was young.

Thol has borrowed loans from MAXIMA four times. The current loan amount is $600. The loans borrowed are used for purchasing electric wire and materials for welding iron tubes. She wishes to expand the battery charging station by buying one more machine generator after this loan. This family has the ability to repay the loans.

loans.use: Purchase welding tools.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Thol Chim has enough money to paid off the loan early.

loans.name: Kriya

texts.en:
Kriya is married in 1978 and has 5 children, 4 daughters and 1 son. He started his transportation service since the early of 2006. He has been trained to repair the fishing net and boat machine. His wife with four daughters is employed to embroidering cloths for commission fee at home. Cloths are collected from the factory.

He has already borrowed loan from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount he asked is $600. He will use this given loan to purchase a motorbike in order to use as a transportation service to meet customers who want to use his transportation services and collect cloths from nearby factory to embroider at home. He is capable of handling the loan and could repay it without any problem.

loans.use: Purchasing one motorbike.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny has been married more than 11 years and has 2 daughters. She has been running the grocery store at home since 1999. In addition, she also sells Chinese noodles at her house. Her husband, Mr. Chum Sotha, is a construction contractor and welds iron tubes in the local communities and he has been in this business for more than 3 years. Their 2 daughters are studying at pre-school in the same village. She has received loans from MAXIMA four times already. At this time, she is asking for a loan in the amount of $700. She will use this loan to purchase grocery items in order to increase her stock. She also will use some amount of the loan to buy one motorbike. As she is an existing client of MAXIMA, we see that there will be no problem for her to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items and one motorbike.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal was married in 1996 and has 2 children. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 2000 and then started her silk production at home. Her husband is currently serving as a government offical. He sometimes assists Sophal in weaving the silk at home. She is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the total amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to buy silk material and sewing thread. She will use the rest of the amount to purchase one motorbike for her husband. With her silk products sales and the salary of her husband, she has the ability to repay this first loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase silk material & sewing thread and buy one more motorbike.

payments.comment: Thank you very much to all lenders.
